original: de dag la 'char ba chos ston pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: de dag la 'char ba chos ston pa la zhugs te /

analyzed: ci ltar chags pa de ltar zhen to //

analyzed: khyed su la kha zer 'phags pa khyod la'o // nged kyis ci zhig byas 'phags pa 'char bas bdag cag gi yan lag dang nyid lag khyim thab kyis kyang ma mnam ma reg pa'i gnas thams cad du reg ste mnams pas na gal te bdag cag gi pha ma dang ming pos thos na yang dze ta'i gtsug
translated: What have we done?

analyzed: dge slong dag gis che zhes 'char ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /

original: nye 'phen gyi bu las rab tu byung bas na /
analyzed: nye 'phen gyi bu las rab tu byung bas na /

original: 'dod chags shas che bas na /
analyzed: 'dod chags shas che bas na /

analyzed: thabs de nyid kyis 'dod chags sel to //

analyzed: 'char ba la slan chad de lta bu ma byed cig ces bsgos che zhe dag de lta bu ma zer bar dengs shig 'phags pa dag bsgo yang rung ma bsgo yang rung ste /

analyzed: bdag cag ni slan chad dze ta'i gtsug lag khang du mi mchi'o zhes 'phya bzhin du dong ngo //

analyzed: 'char ba yang gtsug lag khang nas dgod bzhin du phyi bzhin du 'ong ngo //

analyzed: khyim bdag gi bud med rnams ni khyod la 'phya bzhin du dong ngo //

analyzed: ci khyod kyis bden pa la bkod dam /

original: 'char bas smras pa /

original: sems gang gis sdug pa la zhen pa'i sems so //
analyzed: sems gang gis sdug pa la zhen pa'i sems so //

analyzed: chags pa yang ma yin brtul ba yang ma yin pa ni de lta bu med pa'o //

analyzed: thams cad du lhag mar 'gyur ro //

original: dge slong gi lus kyi dbang po nyams kyang rung ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi lus kyi dbang po nyams kyang rung ste /
translated: or if the monk’s sexual organ is damaged,

translated: Likewise, if the woman is insane or afflicted by illness.

original: mi dbang ba las phrin blangs te /🔽dbang po la yang thams cad la sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dbang ba las phrin blangs te / dbang po la yang thams cad la sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If the messenger is a man, and the woman is a man, or if the messenger is a man, and the woman is a neuter, or if the messenger is a neuter, and the woman is a man or a neuter, it is a serious transgression.

original: mi ma yin pa las phrin blangs te /🔽bud med @51b la yang ngam /🔽bud med shin du gzhon nu ma'am /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa las phrin blangs te / bud med @51b la yang ngam / bud med shin du gzhon nu ma'am /
translated: If the messenger is a man, and the woman is a woman, it is a transgression of wrong conduct.🔽If the messenger is a woman, and the man is a man, it is a serious transgression.🔽If the messenger is a woman, and the man is a neuter, it is a transgression of wrong conduct.🔽If the messenger is a woman, and the man is a woman, it is a serious transgression.🔽If the messenger is a woman, and the woman is a woman, it is a transgression of wrong conduct.🔽If the messenger is a woman, and the woman is a man or a neuter, it is a serious transgression.

original: bud med mngal na gnas pa la smyan byas na thams cad nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med mngal na gnas pa la smyan byas na thams cad nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If the messenger is a woman, and the woman is a very young girl, or a woman who is pregnant, it is a serious transgression.

original: las dang po pa dang sems 'khrugs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang sems 'khrugs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the messenger is a nonhuman, or if the messenger is a human, but the first offense has not yet occurred, or if the mind is disturbed.

original: yan lag ni mi yang yin la /
analyzed: yan lag ni mi yang yin la /
translated: The branches are: the messenger is a human;🔽the messenger receives the message from a woman;🔽the messenger conveys the message to a man who has a male organ;🔽the message is conveyed back to the woman;

original: bud med las phrin blangs pa dang / skyes pa dbang po yod pa la bzlugs pa dang / de'i lan slar bskyal ba ste /🔽lan gsum du yang bskyal la /🔽dngos po grub na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med las phrin blangs pa dang / skyes pa dbang po yod pa la bzlugs pa dang / de'i lan slar bskyal ba ste /🔽lan gsum du yang bskyal la /🔽dngos po grub na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the act is completed.

original: khang pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: khang pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The setting for this story is Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong rnams yon bdag gis gnas khang du brtsigs te byin pa dang / dge slong dag gis 'di ni khang pa ring ches /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong rnams yon bdag gis gnas khang du brtsigs te byin pa dang / dge slong dag gis 'di ni khang pa ring ches /
translated: At that time, the monks were given dwellings built by benefactors, but the monks said, “This house is too long.

original: 'di ni ha cang yang thung 'di ni kun du grums pa gso zhing bcos dka'o zhes de dag bor ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ni ha cang yang thung 'di ni kun du grums pa gso zhing bcos dka'o zhes de dag bor ba nas /
translated: This one is too short. This one is crooked and difficult to repair.” They rejected them all.

original: khang pa bcos shing gsar du khang pa gzhan brtsigs pa dang / rtsva shing dang mi blas khyim pa rnams la slong bas na /
analyzed: khang pa bcos shing gsar du khang pa gzhan brtsigs pa dang / rtsva shing dang mi blas khyim pa rnams la slong bas na /
translated: They repaired the houses and built new ones, and they asked householders for grass, wood, and labor.

original: khyim pa dag kyang 'phya nas /
analyzed: khyim pa dag kyang 'phya nas /
translated: The householders ridiculed them.

original: dge slong yang bya ba mang bas lung dbog pa dang / chos klag pa dang / kha don bya ba dang / rnal 'byor yid la byed pa rnams spangs te bar chad du gyur pas /
analyzed: dge slong yang bya ba mang bas lung dbog pa dang / chos klag pa dang / kha don bya ba dang / rnal 'byor yid la byed pa rnams spangs te bar chad du gyur pas /
translated: The monks had so much work to do that they gave up teaching, reading the scriptures, reciting the scriptures, and practicing yoga. This became an obstacle.

original: khyim pa dag 'phya ba 'od srungs chen pos thos nas 'od srungs chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: khyim pa dag 'phya ba 'od srungs chen pos thos nas 'od srungs chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The householder criticized them, and Mahākāśyapa heard about it and told the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams bkug ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams bkug ste /
translated: The Blessed One summoned the monks and asked,🔽“Is it true that you did such a thing?”

original: de ltar gyur pa bden nam zhes rmas pa dang / btsun pa mad do zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa bden nam zhes rmas pa dang / btsun pa mad do zhes gsol nas /
translated: “Yes, it is true, O Venerable One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mgu dka' ba chog mi shes pa zhes rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams bsdus nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mgu dka' ba chog mi shes pa zhes rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams bsdus nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One criticized them, saying, “It is difficult to please those who are insatiable,” and so on, using many synonyms. Then he gathered the saṅgha of monks and established a rule of training in the Monastic Law.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: “Monk” means one who has entered this Dharma.

original: bdag gis bslangs zhes bya ba ni shing dang rtsva dang mi'i blas so //
analyzed: bdag gis bslangs zhes bya ba ni shing dang rtsva dang mi'i blas so //
translated: “I asked for it” means that I asked for it with wood, grass, or human labor.

original: khang pa zhes bya ba ni spyod lam bzhi dang ldan pa ste /🔽'chag pa dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba shong pa'o //
analyzed: khang pa zhes bya ba ni spyod lam bzhi dang ldan pa ste / 'chag pa dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba shong pa'o //
translated: “House” means one that can accommodate the four modes of behavior.

original: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
translated: “To make” means to make it by oneself or to have someone else make it.

original: bdag po med ces bya ba ni bdag po gzhan med de /
analyzed: bdag po med ces bya ba ni bdag po gzhan med de /
translated: The phrase without an owner means that there is no other owner.

original: bdag gi phyir rtsig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi phyir rtsig pa'o //
translated: A wall is for the sake of oneself.

original: tshang bzhin du brtsigs shing zhes bya ba ni khang pa @52a * //
analyzed: tshang bzhin du brtsigs shing zhes bya ba ni khang pa @52a * //
translated: The phrase built in a proper manner means that the building is

original: de'i tshad ni nang srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i tshad ni nang srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bcu gnyis te /
translated: The size of the building is twelve cubits of the Sugata in length.

original: bcu gnyis la mi tha mal pa'i khru bco brgyad do //
analyzed: bcu gnyis la mi tha mal pa'i khru bco brgyad do //
translated: Twelve of these cubits of the Sugata are eighteen cubits of an ordinary human.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang la tha mal pa'i khru phyed dang do'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang la tha mal pa'i khru phyed dang do'o //
translated: One cubit of the Sugata is one and a half cubits of an ordinary human.

original: zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bdun zhes bya ba ni mi tha mal ba'i khru phyed dang bcu gcig go //
analyzed: zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bdun zhes bya ba ni mi tha mal ba'i khru phyed dang bcu gcig go //
translated: Seven cubits of the Sugata in width are eleven and a half cubits of an ordinary human.

original: nang zhes bya ba ni gal te lhag par byas pa'o //🔽dge slong de zhes bya ba ni khang pa brtsig par 'dod pa'i dge slong su yang rung pa'o //
analyzed: nang zhes bya ba ni gal te lhag par byas pa'o // dge slong de zhes bya ba ni khang pa brtsig par 'dod pa'i dge slong su yang rung pa'o //

original: dge 'dun la gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la gsol bar bya'o //
translated: He should request the Saṅgha.🔽When he has requested the Saṅgha and the rite has been performed, the Saṅgha should not believe that monk without investigating whether or not he is free of the causes for dispute,

original: des dge 'dun la gsol ba dang las byas nas dge 'dun rnams kyis kyang dge slong de la yid ches par ma byed par yang na dge 'dun thams cad der deng la ltos shig / yang na dge slong gcig cig skos shig / dge slong des kyang dmigs🔽kyis legs par brtags nas rtsod pa yang med /

translated: whether or not he is free of the causes for contention,🔽whether or not he is free of the causes for quarrels,🔽whether or not he is free of the causes for disputes.🔽If he is free of the causes for dispute,🔽free of the causes for contention,

original: dog pa yang med /
analyzed: dog pa yang med /
translated: free of the causes for quarrels,

original: mi rung ba yang ma yin na /
analyzed: mi rung ba yang ma yin na /
translated: free of the causes for disputes,

original: gdod gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis dge 'dun la gsol nas gdong khang pa brtsig par bya'o //
analyzed: gdod gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis dge 'dun la gsol nas gdong khang pa brtsig par bya'o //

analyzed: dge slong khrid pa'i dge slong dag gis zhes bya ba ni dge slong de na su 'khod pa'o //
translated: The monks who are to lead the monk: those monks who are present there.

original: sa gzhi zhes bya ba ni khang pa brtsig @52b pa'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi zhes bya ba ni khang pa brtsig @52b pa'o //
translated: The site: where the hut is to be built.

original: ltos shig ces bya ba ni so sor brtags pa'o //
analyzed: ltos shig ces bya ba ni so sor brtags pa'o //
translated: Look: investigate.

original: rung ba zhes bya ba ni sbrul dang sdig pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba zhes bya ba ni sbrul dang sdig pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Suitable: free of snakes, scorpions, and so on.

original: mi rtsod ces bya ba ni 'thab mo dang mtshang 'dru ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtsod ces bya ba ni 'thab mo dang mtshang 'dru ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Not disputed means being free from quarrels, slander, and so on.

original: yangs pa zhes bya ba ni de'i 'khor yug 'dom gang tshun chad khron pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yangs pa zhes bya ba ni de'i 'khor yug 'dom gang tshun chad khron pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Spacious means that within a distance of one fathom around it, there are no wells or other such dangers.

original: gal te mi rung bar dge slong des zhes bya ba ni sbrul dang sdig pa la sogs pa gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mi rung bar dge slong des zhes bya ba ni sbrul dang sdig pa la sogs pa gnas pa'o //
translated: If it is unsuitable, that monk should say, There are snakes, scorpions, and so on living there.

original: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni 'thab pa dang mtshang 'dru ba dang 'khrug pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni 'thab pa dang mtshang 'dru ba dang 'khrug pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Disputed means having quarrels, slander, and strife.

original: mi yangs zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi 'dom gang kho ra khor yug nye bar spyod du med pa'o //
analyzed: mi yangs zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi 'dom gang kho ra khor yug nye bar spyod du med pa'o //
translated: Not spacious means that within a distance of one fathom around the monastery, there is no space to use.

original: bdag gis bslangs pa bdag po med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gis bslangs pa bdag po med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is asked, Was it requested by me? Is it ownerless?

original: bdag po gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po gzhan med pa'o //
translated: It means There is no other owner.

original: gzhi bstan pa'i phyir /🔽dge slong dag ma khrid dam zhes bya ba ni gzhi rtog pa'i dge slong ma khrid pa'o /
analyzed: gzhi bstan pa'i phyir / dge slong dag ma khrid dam zhes bya ba ni gzhi rtog pa'i dge slong ma khrid pa'o /
translated: In order to show the basis,🔽it is asked, Monks, were you not led? Meaning that monks who investigate the basis were not led.

original: khrid pa dag la ma bstan tam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khrid pa dag la ma bstan tam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is asked, Were those who were led not shown?

original: dge slong 'gas gnas brtags pa de dge 'dun la ma bzlugs ma gsol ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'gas gnas brtags pa de dge 'dun la ma bzlugs ma gsol ba'o //
translated: A monk who has not informed the Saṅgha and has not requested permission to build a dwelling in a particular place.

original: tshad las 'das zhes bya ba ni tshad gsungs pa las lhag par byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshad las 'das zhes bya ba ni tshad gsungs pa las lhag par byas pa'o //
translated: “Exceeds the right size” means that he builds it larger than the prescribed size.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun la rag lus pas na dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun la rag lus pas na dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bshad do //
translated: “Offense entailing suspension” means that it is explained as an offense entailing suspension because it depends on the Saṅgha.

original: nyes par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the offense?

original: mi rung ba'i gnas su brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //🔽rtsod pa dang bcas par brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rung ba'i gnas su brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro // rtsod pa dang bcas par brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If he builds it in an unsuitable place, he commits a serious offense.🔽If he builds it in a place where there is a dispute, he commits a serious offense.

original: mi yangs par brtsigs na nyes par sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi yangs par brtsigs na nyes par sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If he builds it in a place that is too small, he commits a serious offense.

original: lung med par brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung med par brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If he builds it without permission, he commits a serious offense.

original: tshad las 'das par brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad las 'das par brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If he builds it exceeding the right size, he commits a serious offense.

original: thams cad dang 'gal bar brtsigs na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad dang 'gal bar brtsigs na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he builds it in a place that is unsuitable in all respects, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: dge slong gis dge slong gzhan zhig la skyon rnam pa lnga po med pas rtsigs shig ces bsgo ba las thams cad dang 'gal bar brtsigs na rtsig rtsig pa la nyes par 'gyur ro //🔽thams cad dang 'gal bar brtsigs pa las ma zin pa dang / phyed cam bgyis nas bor ba ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong gzhan zhig la skyon rnam pa lnga po med pas rtsigs shig ces bsgo ba las thams cad dang 'gal bar brtsigs na rtsig rtsig pa la nyes par 'gyur ro // thams cad dang 'gal bar brtsigs pa las ma zin pa dang / phyed cam bgyis nas bor ba ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk orders another monk to build a hut, and the latter builds it in violation of all the rules, the builder incurs an offense.🔽If he builds it in violation of all the rules, but does not complete it, or if he completes it but abandons it, he commits a serious violation.

original: bslab pa byin pa la yang dge 'dun @53a * //🔽lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bslab pa byin pa la yang dge 'dun @53a * // lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he builds it in violation of all the rules, and then gives it away, he commits a pāyattika offense.

original: yan lag ni mi yangs pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa dang / rtsod pa can dang / lung med pas ma yin pa dang / tshad las 'das na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag ni mi yangs pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa dang / rtsod pa can dang / lung med pas ma yin pa dang / tshad las 'das na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: The parts of the rule are: the site is too large, it is not suitable, it is disputed, it is not without danger, and it exceeds the right size.

original: gtsug lag khang gi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yul koo sh'am b'i dgra zin gyi kun dga'i ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yul koo sh'am b'i dgra zin gyi kun dga'i ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin story of the rule about monasteries: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the pleasure grove of Anāthapiṇḍada in the city of Kauśāmbī.

original: de'i tshe dge slong drug sde po rnams gzhan gyis brtsigs pa'i gtsug lag khang na 'khod pa bzhin du dga' bo bsnyen dga' bo ltos /🔽'di ni gogs /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong drug sde po rnams gzhan gyis brtsigs pa'i gtsug lag khang na 'khod pa bzhin du dga' bo bsnyen dga' bo ltos / 'di ni gogs /
translated: At that time the group of six monks were living in a temple built by others, and they were saying, “Look, Nanda.🔽This is low.

original: 'di ni ral /
analyzed: 'di ni ral /
translated: This is torn.🔽This wall is not good.” They were criticizing the temple built by others.

original: 'di rtsig pa ma legs so zhes gzhan gyis brtsigs pa'i gtsug lag khang la 'phyas 'dogs pa la zhugs pa dang / de na dge slong rnams kyis khyod cag nyid kyis pha gu gcig bslang yang mi nus na /
analyzed: 'di rtsig pa ma legs so zhes gzhan gyis brtsigs pa'i gtsug lag khang la 'phyas 'dogs pa la zhugs pa dang / de na dge slong rnams kyis khyod cag nyid kyis pha gu gcig bslang yang mi nus na /
translated: The monks said, “You cannot even put up a single wall,

original: gzhan gyis brtsigs pa la 'phyar ci yod /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brtsigs pa la 'phyar ci yod /
translated: so what is the point of criticizing what others have built?”

original: drug sde po nang bgros pa /
analyzed: drug sde po nang bgros pa /
translated: The group of six discussed this among themselves:

original: lhung bzed nag po can de dag bdag cag la shin tu brnyas kyi /
analyzed: lhung bzed nag po can de dag bdag cag la shin tu brnyas kyi /
translated: “Those who have black begging bowls are very contemptuous of us.🔽Let’s build a temple that none of them have built before.”

original: de dag gis sngon ma brtsigs pa'i khang pa gcig bdag cag gis rtsigs shig / bdag cag kun gyis brtsigs na ni kho yang 'phya na ma legs kyi /
analyzed: de dag gis sngon ma brtsigs pa'i khang pa gcig bdag cag gis rtsigs shig / bdag cag kun gyis brtsigs na ni kho yang 'phya na ma legs kyi /
translated: “If we all build it, they will criticize us, so that would be bad.

original: bdag cag gi nang na gang khab kyi rjes su gnya' shing chud par nus pa gcig gis bya'o zhes nas de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa mos pa can dad par byas so //
analyzed: bdag cag gi nang na gang khab kyi rjes su gnya' shing chud par nus pa gcig gis bya'o zhes nas de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa mos pa can dad par byas so //
translated: They then won over the venerable Upacelā.

original: mos pa can gyis bsams pa /
analyzed: mos pa can gyis bsams pa /
translated: Upacelā thought,

original: gzhan ni med na grong khyer 'di na bram ze phyug po ser sna can bya rog la yang gtor ma mi ster ba ma dad cing su'i yon bdag tu yang ma byas pa zhig yod pa de la 'brid do snyam du bsams nas mos pa can gyis grong
analyzed: gzhan ni med na grong khyer 'di na bram ze phyug po ser sna can bya rog la yang gtor ma mi ster ba ma dad cing su'i yon bdag tu yang ma byas pa zhig yod pa de la 'brid do snyam du bsams nas mos pa can gyis grong
translated: If not, I will deceive the miserly wealthy brahmin in this city who does not give even a morsel to a crow, who has no faith, and who has not made offerings to anyone.🔽Thinking this, Upacelā went to the door of that brahmin's house,

original: khyer gzhan nas bslangs pa'i phye zhig khyer te /🔽bram ze de'i sgor phyin pa dang / sgo bsam ster to //
analyzed: khyer gzhan nas bslangs pa'i phye zhig khyer te / bram ze de'i sgor phyin pa dang / sgo bsam ster to //
translated: having brought flour obtained from begging in another city.🔽While the doorkeeper was distracted by a performance, she went inside and asked the brahmin to have the flour ground.

original: de'i sgo ba yang rol mo zhig la g-yeng ba'i bar du nang du song nas bram ze la phye 'tshag tu bcol ba dang / des bran mo phye 'tshag tu bcug pa dang / bdag gi drung du tshogs shig ces byas so //
analyzed: de'i sgo ba yang rol mo zhig la g-yeng ba'i bar du nang du song nas bram ze la phye 'tshag tu bcol ba dang / des bran mo phye 'tshag tu bcug pa dang / bdag gi drung du tshogs shig ces byas so //
translated: He had a female slave grind the flour, and she said, Gather around me.

original: de drung na 'tshag pa'i tshe yang de la rab tu rtog nas /
analyzed: de drung na 'tshag pa'i tshe yang de la rab tu rtog nas /
translated: When he was near it, he examined it carefully.

original: bram zes khyed ci la rtog ces dris na /
analyzed: bram zes khyed ci la rtog ces dris na /
translated: The brahman asked him, “What are you examining?”

original: de la srog chags yod dam med rtog go //
analyzed: de la srog chags yod dam med rtog go //
translated: “I am examining whether there are living beings in it or not.”🔽“If there are, what will you do?”

original: yod na ci bya zhes smras pa dang / de las gleng nas srog bcad du mi rung ba dge ba bcu bshad pas bram ze dad par byas so //
analyzed: yod na ci bya zhes smras pa dang / de las gleng nas srog bcad du mi rung ba dge ba bcu bshad pas bram ze dad par byas so //
translated: The brahman became a believer after the monk explained the ten virtues, which include not killing.

original: de nas bram ze des dge slong de la zas dang gos kyis bstabs na des phyin chad sgo bcad du dogs nas len du ma btub po //
analyzed: de nas bram ze des dge slong de la zas dang gos kyis bstabs na des phyin chad sgo bcad du dogs nas len du ma btub po //
translated: Then the brahman offered food and clothing to the monk, but the monk was afraid that if he accepted them, he would be shut up, so he did not accept them.🔽Then the monk explained the merit of good deeds, and the brahman said, “What should I do?”

original: de nas dge slong des bsod nams su bya ba'i legs pa bshad pa dang / des @53b 'o na ngas ci bya ba'i rigs zhes byas pa dang / dge 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang brtsig pa'i rigs so zhes byas so //
analyzed: de nas dge slong des bsod nams su bya ba'i legs pa bshad pa dang / des @53b 'o na ngas ci bya ba'i rigs zhes byas pa dang / dge 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang brtsig pa'i rigs so zhes byas so //
translated: “It would be good if you built a temple for the saṅgha.”🔽“I will provide the materials, but I have no site.”

original: 'o na rgyu ni bdag gis sbyor nas gzhi med do zhes byas pa dang sa gzhi ngas rgyal po la bslang ngo //
analyzed: 'o na rgyu ni bdag gis sbyor nas gzhi med do zhes byas pa dang sa gzhi ngas rgyal po la bslang ngo //
translated: “I will ask the king for a site.”

original: zhal ta sus bgyi zhes dris na ngas bya'o zhes khas blangs so //
analyzed: zhal ta sus bgyi zhes dris na ngas bya'o zhes khas blangs so //
translated: When asked, Who will be the supervisor? he replied, I will be the supervisor.

original: de nas rgyal po la sa gzhi gsol ba dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor ma gtogs pa gzhan gar dga' bar brtsigs shig ces byas so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po la sa gzhi gsol ba dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor ma gtogs pa gzhan gar dga' bar brtsigs shig ces byas so //
translated: Then, when the king was asked, Where should the site be? he said, Build it wherever you like, except in the royal palace compound.

original: de nas koo sh'amb'i dang / dgra zin gyi bar na bram ze'i bu lnga brgya tsam yod pa rtag par smrang klog pa'i grib shing chen po gcig yod de /
analyzed: de nas koo sh'amb'i dang / dgra zin gyi bar na bram ze'i bu lnga brgya tsam yod pa rtag par smrang klog pa'i grib shing chen po gcig yod de /
translated: Between Kauśāmbī and Śrāvastī, there were about five hundred brahmin boys who were always reading the Vedas. There was a large banyan tree.

original: bram ze'i bu de dag rtag tu drug sde yan man 'gro ba la 'phya bas na /
analyzed: bram ze'i bu de dag rtag tu drug sde yan man 'gro ba la 'phya bas na /
translated: Since those brahmin boys always went back and forth between the group of six and the group of ten, they were ridiculed.

original: de dag la ku re bya ba'i phyir mtshan mo grib shing chen po bcad de mi mngon par byas nas /
analyzed: de dag la ku re bya ba'i phyir mtshan mo grib shing chen po bcad de mi mngon par byas nas /
translated: In order to joke with them, at night they cut down the large banyan tree and made it invisible.

original: de nyin gcig gis lha khang zin par byas te /
analyzed: de nyin gcig gis lha khang zin par byas te /
translated: In one day, they completed the temple.

original: skar khung ma btod pa de'i phyi de nyin char chen po bab ste /
analyzed: skar khung ma btod pa de'i phyi de nyin char chen po bab ste /
translated: Since no windows were made, the next day it rained heavily.

original: khang pa 'jig par 'gyur bas na bram ze mi dga' zhing khrag gis skyugs par bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen nas de mtshan gcig lha'i 'khor dang srod kyi bar du chos bshad nas /
analyzed: khang pa 'jig par 'gyur bas na bram ze mi dga' zhing khrag gis skyugs par bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen nas de mtshan gcig lha'i 'khor dang srod kyi bar du chos bshad nas /
translated: The Blessed One knew that the house would collapse and that the brahmin would be unhappy and vomit blood. He spent the night with his retinue of gods, teaching the Dharma until dusk.

original: phyi de nyin bram ze phas 'ongs pa la mdun nas bsu ste /
analyzed: phyi de nyin bram ze phas 'ongs pa la mdun nas bsu ste /
translated: The next day, the brahmin's father came and was welcomed by the Blessed One.

original: mdang de ltar khang pa'i nang du chos bshad do zhes bka' stsal pas na /
analyzed: mdang de ltar khang pa'i nang du chos bshad do zhes bka' stsal pas na /
translated: The Blessed One said, Last night, I taught the Dharma inside the house.

original: de yang dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: de yang dga' bar gyur to //
translated: The brahmin was delighted.

original: grib shing chen po bcad pas na bram ze'i bu rnams dge sbyong sh'akya'i bu rnams mi srun pa'i tshig pa can gzhan la gnod par byed pa zhes mi snyan par 'dzer pa dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol to //
analyzed: grib shing chen po bcad pas na bram ze'i bu rnams dge sbyong sh'akya'i bu rnams mi srun pa'i tshig pa can gzhan la gnod par byed pa zhes mi snyan par 'dzer pa dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol to //
translated: The brahmin's sons cut down the great shade tree, saying, 'The shaven-headed ascetics of the Shakya are unruly, angry, and harm others.' The monks reported this unpleasantness to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong drug sde po rnams la rung ba ma yin mthun pa ma yin zhes rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong drug sde po rnams la rung ba ma yin mthun pa ma yin zhes rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
translated: The Blessed One reprimanded the group of six monks in many ways, saying, 'This is not proper, it is not suitable.'

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams bsdus nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams bsdus nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Having gathered the community of monks, he established the training rule for the monks.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde pho rnams te gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde pho rnams te gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: As for a certain monk, it refers to the group of six monks and others like them.

original: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni spyod lam bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni spyod lam bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
translated: As for monastery, it refers to the four modes of conduct.

original: bdag po yod ces bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis rnams so //
analyzed: bdag po yod ces bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis rnams so //
translated: As for with an owner, it refers to men, women, neuters, and those with two sex organs.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge 'dun no //
translated: As for for the sake of the Saṅgha, it refers to the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata.

original: dge slong 'di zhes bya ba ni chos 'di dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'di zhes bya ba ni chos 'di dang ldan pa'o //
translated: As for this monk, it refers to one who possesses this quality.

original: dge slong dag khrid cig ces bya ba ni de na dge slong su yod pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag khrid cig ces bya ba ni de na dge slong su yod pa'o //
translated: As for lead the monks, it refers to those monks who are there.

original: bdag nyid kyis ma brtags kyi bar du dge slong dag sngar ma khrid cig bdag gis @54a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ma brtags kyi bar du dge slong dag sngar ma khrid cig bdag gis @54a * //
translated: As for do not lead the monks before I have examined it myself, it means:

original: brtags te gnas rung ba dang / yangs pa dang mi rtsod pa yin na dge 'dun la gsol nas dge slong gcig gis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: brtags te gnas rung ba dang / yangs pa dang mi rtsod pa yin na dge 'dun la gsol nas dge slong gcig gis blta bar bya'o //
translated: If it is a suitable site, spacious, and free of disputes, then after requesting the Saṅgha, a monk should inspect it.🔽If the Saṅgha has thoroughly inspected it, and after requesting and inquiring, the Saṅgha has requested it, and if the site is suitable, free of disputes, and has been granted permission, then since there is no doubt, build it.

original: dge 'dun rnams kyis rab tu brtags nas gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis dge 'dun la gsol nas gzhi rung ba dang / mi rtsod pa dang / lung byin pa yin na the tshom med pa yin gyis rtsigs shig / dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba ni ltung ba de dge 'dun la rag las pas na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes so //
analyzed: dge 'dun rnams kyis rab tu brtags nas gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis dge 'dun la gsol nas gzhi rung ba dang / mi rtsod pa dang / lung byin pa yin na the tshom med pa yin gyis rtsigs shig / dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba ni ltung ba de dge 'dun la rag las pas na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes so //
translated: The term “remainder of the Saṅgha” means that since that downfall depends on the Saṅgha, it is called “remainder of the Saṅgha.”

original: nyes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the offense?

original: gnas mi rung bar brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas mi rung bar brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one builds on a site that is unsuitable, there is a serious offense.

original: rtsod pa can du brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //🔽mi yangs par brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa can du brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro // mi yangs par brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one builds on a site that is disputed, there is a serious offense.🔽If one builds on a site that is not spacious, there is a serious offense.

original: lung med par brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung med par brtsigs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one builds without permission, there is a serious offense.

original: thams cad dang 'gal bar brtsigs na de 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad dang 'gal bar brtsigs na de 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is built in opposition to all of them, it is an additional offense.

original: dge slong gis gzhan la rtsig tu bcol na yang gnyis kas dga' bar brtsigs na gnyis ka la nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis gzhan la rtsig tu bcol na yang gnyis kas dga' bar brtsigs na gnyis ka la nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If a monk has another build a hut, and both of them are happy with the result, there is a serious offense for both.

original: dge slong la ji ltar nyes par 'gyur ba bslab pa byin pa dang / dge slong ma la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong la ji ltar nyes par 'gyur ba bslab pa byin pa dang / dge slong ma la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as there is an offense for a monk, so it is for a nun.

original: las dang po la yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: las dang po la yang nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner.

original: rung ba ma yin pa dang / yangs pa dang / rtsod pa'i sgras ni khang pa gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa dang / yangs pa dang / rtsod pa'i sgras ni khang pa gong ma bzhin no //
translated: As for “improper” and “large,” and the phrase “dispute,” it is as above in the section on houses.🔽The Origin Story of the Rootless One

original: rtsa ba med pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in Rājagṛha, in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana.

original: de'i tshe na grong khyer sdig pa can zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: de'i tshe na grong khyer sdig pa can zhes bya ba na /
translated: At that time, in the city called Pāpā,

original: gyad sde rgyal zhes bya ba zhig yod de //
analyzed: gyad sde rgyal zhes bya ba zhig yod de //
translated: there was a wrestler named Senagupta.

original: yang rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas yongs su spyad pa las bu gcig cig btsas te /
analyzed: yang rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas yongs su spyad pa las bu gcig cig btsas te /
translated: He took a wife from a family of equal rank, and they enjoyed themselves and had sex. A son was born to them.

original: khye'u de yang mal stan chen po'i sting du bshang gci dag mi byed pas na nor dang 'dra'o zhes grags te /
analyzed: khye'u de yang mal stan chen po'i sting du bshang gci dag mi byed pas na nor dang 'dra'o zhes grags te /
translated: Since the child did not defecate or urinate on his large bed, he was known as “Son of Wealth.”

original: de'i phyir yang ming gyad bu nor du btags so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang ming gyad bu nor du btags so //
translated: Therefore, he was also named Jīvaka Kumārabhṛta.

original: gyad bu nor yang sngon dge ba'i rtsa bas bskul bas na 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gyad bu nor yang sngon dge ba'i rtsa bas bskul bas na 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Jīvaka Kumārabhṛta was urged by his previous roots of virtue to think,

original: lha dang mir bcas pa dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i 'jig rten na rkang gcig pa dang / rkang gnyis pa dang / rkang bzhi'i nang na /
analyzed: lha dang mir bcas pa dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i 'jig rten na rkang gcig pa dang / rkang gnyis pa dang / rkang bzhi'i nang na /
translated: “In the world of gods and humans, including ascetics and brahmins, among those with one leg, two legs, and four legs,

original: sman dang sngags dang rigs pa'i tshig 'dzin pa gang gis bdag 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa de nas rab tu thar bar byed snyam sems so //
analyzed: sman dang sngags dang rigs pa'i tshig 'dzin pa gang gis bdag 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa de nas rab tu thar bar byed snyam sems so //
translated: who holds the words of medicine, mantras, and reasoning that will liberate me from the wilderness of saṃsāra?”

original: des mu stegs kyi mkhan po drug la lung mnos na /
analyzed: des mu stegs kyi mkhan po drug la lung mnos na /
translated: He received the scriptures from six non-Buddhist teachers.

original: de dag la mi mgu nas rab tu sems shing 'dug pa dang / bar skabs 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mi mkhyen pa'am mi gzigs pa @54b med pas gyad bu nor yang sngon gyi sangs rgyas la bya ba byas la rgyud yongs su smin spyod lam gyis 'dul bar gzigs nas dge slong rta thul gyis gyad bu nor rab tu
analyzed: de dag la mi mgu nas rab tu sems shing 'dug pa dang / bar skabs 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mi mkhyen pa'am mi gzigs pa @54b med pas gyad bu nor yang sngon gyi sangs rgyas la bya ba byas la rgyud yongs su smin spyod lam gyis 'dul bar gzigs nas dge slong rta thul gyis gyad bu nor rab tu
translated: He was not pleased with them and was thinking about leaving the world when the Blessed One, who knows all and sees all, saw that he had served the Buddhas of the past and that his mind was ripe.

original: phyung shig par bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: phyung shig par bka' stsal nas /
translated: He saw that he would be disciplined by his conduct and ordered the monk Aśvajit to ordain him.

original: des kyang rab tu phyung ngo //🔽gyad bu nor gyis kha don bslab pas ni sde snod gsum lobs /
analyzed: des kyang rab tu phyung ngo // gyad bu nor gyis kha don bslab pas ni sde snod gsum lobs /
translated: He was ordained.

original: bsam gtan byas pas ni gong nas gong du 'phar ba'i khyad par thob bo //
analyzed: bsam gtan byas pas ni gong nas gong du 'phar ba'i khyad par thob bo //
translated: He learned the Three Baskets by heart through his studies and through his meditation he attained the special state of rising higher and higher.

original: de nas gyad bu nor bcom ldan 'das la phyag tshal du bcom ldan 'das kyi gan du phyin to //
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor bcom ldan 'das la phyag tshal du bcom ldan 'das kyi gan du phyin to //
translated: Then he went to the Blessed One to pay homage to him.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: gyad bu nor bde bar 'ongs mtshur shog / khyod sus phyin to zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: gyad bu nor bde bar 'ongs mtshur shog / khyod sus phyin to zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: “Welcome, Upatiṣya! Come here!”

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po'i khab na dge 'dun gyi gnas khang dang mal stan dag mi mthun par 'gyed de /🔽mdo sde 'dzin pa dang 'dul ba 'dzin par /
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po'i khab na dge 'dun gyi gnas khang dang mal stan dag mi mthun par 'gyed de / mdo sde 'dzin pa dang 'dul ba 'dzin par /
translated: At that time, the monks in Rājagṛha were quarreling over the dwellings and bedding of the saṅgha.🔽The sūtra holders were quarreling with the vinaya holders.

original: mdo sde 'dzin pa dang ni ma mo 'dzin par /
analyzed: mdo sde 'dzin pa dang ni ma mo 'dzin par /
translated: The sūtra holders were quarreling with the mātṛkā holders.

original: ma mo 'dzin pa dang ni dge slong bsam gtan par /
analyzed: ma mo 'dzin pa dang ni dge slong bsam gtan par /
translated: The mātṛkā holders were quarreling with the monks who were meditators.

original: de ltar nang mi mthun par mal stan dang gnas khang bgos pas na /
analyzed: de ltar nang mi mthun par mal stan dang gnas khang bgos pas na /
translated: In this way, they were quarreling over the dwellings and bedding.

original: gcig la gcig sems mi srung zhing mi mdzes pas na dge ba mi 'phel te mi bde bar gnas pa las /
analyzed: gcig la gcig sems mi srung zhing mi mdzes pas na dge ba mi 'phel te mi bde bar gnas pa las /
translated: Since they were not protecting each other’s minds and were not acting in a pleasing way, their virtue did not increase and they lived unhappily.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor mal stan 'ding bar bskos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor mal stan 'ding bar bskos te /
translated: The Bhagavān appointed the venerable Jīvaka to assign the bedding.

original: gyad bu nor gyis mdo sde 'dzin pa dang mdo sde 'dzin par /
analyzed: gyad bu nor gyis mdo sde 'dzin pa dang mdo sde 'dzin par /
translated: Jīvaka assigned the sūtra holders with the sūtra holders,

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang 'dul ba 'dzin par /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang 'dul ba 'dzin par /
translated: the vinaya holders with the vinaya holders,

original: chos smra ba dang chos smra bar /
analyzed: chos smra ba dang chos smra bar /
translated: the dharma teachers with the dharma teachers,

original: bsam gtan pa dang bsam gtan par /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa dang bsam gtan par /
translated: and the meditators with the meditators.

original: rgan rims su thob rgyal med par gnas khang dang mthun mthun du bgos pas na /
analyzed: rgan rims su thob rgyal med par gnas khang dang mthun mthun du bgos pas na /
translated: The elders were not given the best rooms, but were assigned rooms according to their suitability.

original: dge slong rnams dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel ba ni chu can gyi autpa la bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong rnams dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel ba ni chu can gyi autpa la bzhin no //
translated: The monks increased in virtuous qualities like the water-born lotus.

original: glo bur du mtshan mo lhag pa rnams la yang rdzu 'phrul gyis rang gi mdzub mo las me 'bar bar byas nas mal stan mtshan mo bting bas na /
analyzed: glo bur du mtshan mo lhag pa rnams la yang rdzu 'phrul gyis rang gi mdzub mo las me 'bar bar byas nas mal stan mtshan mo bting bas na /
translated: Even on nights when there were unexpected visitors, they would light fires from their fingers through their magical powers and spread out their bedding for the night.

original: dge slong de dag kyang de ltar 'di 'dra ba'i ston pa dang mtshungs pas bdag cag gis mal stan bting bas na bdag cag nyal ba'i mi rigs zhes nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la brtson par dge bar byed do //
analyzed: dge slong de dag kyang de ltar 'di 'dra ba'i ston pa dang mtshungs pas bdag cag gis mal stan bting bas na bdag cag nyal ba'i mi rigs zhes nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la brtson par dge bar byed do //
translated: Those monks, being like such a teacher, thought, “It is not right for us to sleep on bedding that we have spread out.” Thus, they practiced virtue with diligence during the first and last parts of the night.

original: slad kyis dge slong drug sde po rnams kyis khyim bdag dad pas mgron du gnyer ba'i tshe /
analyzed: slad kyis dge slong drug sde po rnams kyis khyim bdag dad pas mgron du gnyer ba'i tshe /
translated: Later, when the group of six monks were invited by a faithful layperson,

original: khyim bdag phyug po dang zas zhim po dag gam tha shal dag tu bsres pas gyad bu nor zas 'gyed par yang bskos so //
analyzed: khyim bdag phyug po dang zas zhim po dag gam tha shal dag tu bsres pas gyad bu nor zas 'gyed par yang bskos so //
translated: they were assigned to the homes of wealthy laypeople, to those with delicious food, and to those with inferior food.

original: gyad bu nor gyis zas rnam pa gsum du bskos te zas zhim rab dang / bar ma dang tha ma'o //
analyzed: gyad bu nor gyis zas rnam pa gsum du bskos te zas zhim rab dang / bar ma dang tha ma'o //
translated: The son of Gyad, having prepared three kinds of food, said: The best, the middling and the lowest.

original: dge slong rgan rims kyis dang po ni der zas @55a * //🔽zhim por bsko /🔽phyi de nyin ni 'bring por bsko'o //
analyzed: dge slong rgan rims kyis dang po ni der zas @55a * // zhim por bsko / phyi de nyin ni 'bring por bsko'o //
translated: The oldest monk, having received the best food, said: This is the best.🔽 The next day, he received the middling food and said: This is the middling.

original: de'i yang phyi de nyin ni thar mar ro //
analyzed: de'i yang phyi de nyin ni thar mar ro //
translated: The next day, he received the lowest food and said: This is the lowest.

original: de'i tshe lho'i ri bo zhes bya ba nas dge slong mdza' bo dang sa can zhes bya ba gnyis ljongs rgyu zhing rgyal po'i khab tu phyin to //
analyzed: de'i tshe lho'i ri bo zhes bya ba nas dge slong mdza' bo dang sa can zhes bya ba gnyis ljongs rgyu zhing rgyal po'i khab tu phyin to //
translated: At that time, two monks named Mitrayus and Sthitamati, having traveled from the southern mountains, arrived in Rajagriha.

original: de gnyis kyis dge 'dun gyi zas 'gyed pa dang / mal stan 'gyed pa su yin zhes smras pa dang / gyad bu nor yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis dge 'dun gyi zas 'gyed pa dang / mal stan 'gyed pa su yin zhes smras pa dang / gyad bu nor yin no //
translated: They asked: Who is distributing the food and bedding of the Sangha? They were told: It is the son of Gyad.

original: de nas gyad bu nor gyi gan du song nas mal stan dang zas la skos shig ces smras pa dang / de'i tshe mal stan dang zas bskos zin pas nang gi ngan pa tha mar mal stan thob po //
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor gyi gan du song nas mal stan dang zas la skos shig ces smras pa dang / de'i tshe mal stan dang zas bskos zin pas nang gi ngan pa tha mar mal stan thob po //
translated: Then they went to the son of Gyad and said: Please distribute the bedding and food. At that time, the distribution of bedding and food was already finished, so they received the worst bedding and food.

original: bram ze phyug po zhig gis der nga zas la bskos pa dang bram ze de yang bu shi ste brel ba dang / bdag gis der su 'ong zhes dris na mdza' bo dang sa can 'ong zhes thos nas gnas ngan len du spyod pas zhal ta dang rim gro cher ma byas te zas ngan pa zhig byin no //
analyzed: bram ze phyug po zhig gis der nga zas la bskos pa dang bram ze de yang bu shi ste brel ba dang / bdag gis der su 'ong zhes dris na mdza' bo dang sa can 'ong zhes thos nas gnas ngan len du spyod pas zhal ta dang rim gro cher ma byas te zas ngan pa zhig byin no //
translated: He did not do much service or honor, but gave him bad food.🔽The next day he was invited to a middling meal,

original: de'i phyi de nyin zas 'bring por bskos pa dang / de dag gis kyang zhal ta ma byas te zas ngan pa byin no //
analyzed: de'i phyi de nyin zas 'bring por bskos pa dang / de dag gis kyang zhal ta ma byas te zas ngan pa byin no //
translated: and they did not do much service and gave him bad food.

original: de'i yang phyi de nyin zas ngan pa bskos pas zas ngan pa thob po //
analyzed: de'i yang phyi de nyin zas ngan pa bskos pas zas ngan pa thob po //
translated: The next day he was invited to a bad meal, and he got bad food.

original: de nas de gnyis kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: de nas de gnyis kyis bsams pa /
translated: Then the two of them thought,

original: kye ma'o bag cag la gyad bu nor gyis zas ngan pa dang gos ngan pas lan du mar mnar te /
analyzed: kye ma'o bag cag la gyad bu nor gyis zas ngan pa dang gos ngan pas lan du mar mnar te /
translated: Alas! We have been harmed by Jīvaka Komārabhacca many times with bad food and bad clothes.

original: lus kyang dmas par gyur na /
analyzed: lus kyang dmas par gyur na /
translated: Our bodies have become emaciated.

original: bdag cag gnyis kyis de la gnod pa zhig bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag cag gnyis kyis de la gnod pa zhig bya'o snyam nas /
translated: We should harm him.

original: de'i mdza' mo sring mo zhes bya ba la sring mo khyod gyad bu nor dang nyal gyis gyad bu nor ni phas pham pa byung ngo zhes bcom ldan 'das la gsol cig dang nged kyis kyang che bzhi bya'o //🔽dge slong ma des kyang bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: de'i mdza' mo sring mo zhes bya ba la sring mo khyod gyad bu nor dang nyal gyis gyad bu nor ni phas pham pa byung ngo zhes bcom ldan 'das la gsol cig dang nged kyis kyang che bzhi bya'o // dge slong ma des kyang bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: His mistress, a nun, said to him, Go to sleep with your sister, and tell the Blessed One that you have committed a pārājika offense. We will make a great deal of money.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gyad bu nor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gyad bu nor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The nun then told the Blessed One, Gautamī, the Blessed One's aunt, has committed a pārājika offense.

original: gyad bu nor khyod kyis thos sam dran nam /
analyzed: gyad bu nor khyod kyis thos sam dran nam /
translated: The Blessed One said to Gautamī, Gautamī, have you heard or do you remember?

original: btsun pa bdag gis mi dran nam /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag gis mi dran nam /
translated: Gautamī said, Venerable One, I do not remember.

original: khyod kyis nyes sam btsun pa bdag gis nongs sam ma nongs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen to //
analyzed: khyod kyis nyes sam btsun pa bdag gis nongs sam ma nongs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen to //
translated: Have I committed an offense or not? The Blessed One knows.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks, Monks, Gautamī has not committed an offense.

original: gyad bu nor ni nyes pa med cing dran pa dang ldan par zung shig / dge slong ma mdza' mo ni bdag rang gis khas len pa sma phob shig / dge slong mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis shin tu legs par smros la /
analyzed: gyad bu nor ni nyes pa med cing dran pa dang ldan par zung shig / dge slong ma mdza' mo ni bdag rang gis khas len pa sma phob shig / dge slong mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis shin tu legs par smros la /
translated: Bhikṣus Maitrāyaṇī­putra and Upasena should be well spoken to.

original: gang du mthong ji ltar mthong /
analyzed: gang du mthong ji ltar mthong /
translated: ‘Where did you see her? How did you see her?🔽Why did you go there? What did you see?’”

original: khyod gnyis der ji la dong dong ba las mthong zhes zhib tu smros shig / de nas dge slong rnams kyis bka' @55b stsal pa bzhin du zhib tu rmas pa dang / mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis kyi mching nas tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor gyis mi tshangs par spyod cing phas pham par gyur pa ni ma mchis kyi gdugs gsum gyi bar du bdag la zas kyis mnar bas na bdag cag zhe sdang gi dbang gis smras
analyzed: khyod gnyis der ji la dong dong ba las mthong zhes zhib tu smros shig / de nas dge slong rnams kyis bka' @55b stsal pa bzhin du zhib tu rmas pa dang / mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis kyi mching nas tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor gyis mi tshangs par spyod cing phas pham par gyur pa ni ma mchis kyi gdugs gsum gyi bar du bdag la zas kyis mnar bas na bdag cag zhe sdang gi dbang gis smras
translated: Then the bhikṣus, as instructed, asked them in detail, and from the mouths of Maitrāyaṇī­putra and Upasena it was said, “The venerable Bhadrika did not commit a pārājika offense of sexual misconduct. For three days we were tormented by food, and out of hatred we spoke thus.”

original: so zhes byas pa dang / de ltar gyur pa dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: so zhes byas pa dang / de ltar gyur pa dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: When that happened, the bhikṣus reported it to the Bhagavān.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis bkug nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis bkug nas /
translated: The Blessed One summoned Mitravati and Sthavira.

original: skyes bu gti mug khyed gnyis kyis zas chung ngu'i phyir shes bzhin du brdzun du smra zhes rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas yang dge slong gang zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: skyes bu gti mug khyed gnyis kyis zas chung ngu'i phyir shes bzhin du brdzun du smra zhes rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas yang dge slong gang zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One rebuked them, saying, Foolish men, you have knowingly lied for the sake of a small amount of food, and so on, in many ways. Then he laid down the training rule for the monks.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis te /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis te /
translated: As for a monk, it refers to Mitravati and Sthavira.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: It also refers to others like them.

original: zhe sdang can zhes bya ba ni khros pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang can zhes bya ba ni khros pa'o //
translated: As for with hatred, it means with anger.

original: zhe sdang gis gnod par byed ces bya ba ni yi ma rangs nas gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gis gnod par byed ces bya ba ni yi ma rangs nas gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: As for harming with hatred, it means harming with displeasure.

original: dge slong gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni gyad bu nor te /
analyzed: dge slong gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni gyad bu nor te /
translated: As for a pure monk, it refers to Yaśas.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: It also refers to others like him.

original: nyes pa med ces bya ba ni rtsa ba'i nyes pa med pas na dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa med ces bya ba ni rtsa ba'i nyes pa med pas na dngos po med pa'o //
translated: As for without a basis, it means without a fundamental offense.

original: rtsa ba med ces bya ba yang gsum ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba med ces bya ba yang gsum ste /
translated: As for without a root, there are three types.

original: mthong ba'i rtsa ba dang / dogs pa'i rtsa ba dang / thos pa'i rtsa ba gsum med pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rtsa ba dang / dogs pa'i rtsa ba dang / thos pa'i rtsa ba gsum med pa'o //
translated: The three roots of seeing, the three roots of doubt, and the three roots of hearing.

original: phas pham pa zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa bzhi po gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: phas pham pa zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa bzhi po gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: “Defeat” means any one of the four defeats.

original: skur zhes bya ba ni klang btab pa'o //
analyzed: skur zhes bya ba ni klang btab pa'o //
translated: “Accuses” means accuses by incriminating.

original: ci nas 'di tshangs par spyod pa dang dbral lo snyam zhes bya ba ni ci nas dge sbyong gi dngos po dang dbral lo snyam pa'o //
analyzed: ci nas 'di tshangs par spyod pa dang dbral lo snyam zhes bya ba ni ci nas dge sbyong gi dngos po dang dbral lo snyam pa'o //
translated: “In order to separate him from the pure life” means in order to separate him from the state of a monastic.

original: de yang dus gzhan zhig na zhes bya ba ni phyi zhig na'o //
analyzed: de yang dus gzhan zhig na zhes bya ba ni phyi zhig na'o //
translated: “At another time” means later.

original: dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis so //
translated: “Whether questioned or not” means by another.

original: ma dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis 'gyod de mthol ba'o //
analyzed: ma dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis 'gyod de mthol ba'o //
translated: “Whether questioned or not” means confessing out of remorse oneself.

original: rtsod pa de yang rtsa ba med par gyur zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i dngos po med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa de yang rtsa ba med par gyur zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i dngos po med par gyur pa'o //
translated: “The dispute was without basis” means the basis of the dispute was non-existent.

original: rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of disputes:

original: rtsod pas rtsod pa dang / mi 'doms pas rtsod pa dang / ltung ba la rtsod pa dang / bya ba la rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pas rtsod pa dang / mi 'doms pas rtsod pa dang / ltung ba la rtsod pa dang / bya ba la rtsod pa'o //
translated: A dispute about a dispute, a dispute about not being instructed, a dispute about a downfall, and a dispute about an action.

original: dge slong yang zhe sdang la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gis skur ba gdab par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong yang zhe sdang la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gis skur ba gdab par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “A monk who is motivated by aversion” means he wants to accuse someone.

original: khros te smras so zhes bya ba ni skur ba 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: khros te smras so zhes bya ba ni skur ba 'debs pa yin no //
translated: “He speaks angrily” means he is accusing.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun la rag las shing nyes pa lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun la rag las shing nyes pa lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “A serious offense” means it is serious because it depends on the Saṅgha and has a remainder.

original: de la nyes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the remainder?

original: nyes pa bcus lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa lngas lhag ma med pa @56a * //
analyzed: nyes pa bcus lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa lngas lhag ma med pa @56a * //
translated: It is a serious offense because of ten remainders and a non-remainder because of five remainders.

original: 'gyur ro // gang zag gtsang ma la skur na'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // gang zag gtsang ma la skur na'o //
translated: If one accuses a pure person,

original: ma mthong ma thos mi dogs par 'du shes dang blo gros sbas nas mthong ngo thos so dogs so zhes smras na lhag ma re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ma thos mi dogs par 'du shes dang blo gros sbas nas mthong ngo thos so dogs so zhes smras na lhag ma re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: if one conceals one’s perception, understanding, or suspicion, and then says, “I see it, I hear it, I suspect it,” then each of these is a serious offense.

original: thos dogs la de yang brjed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: thos dogs la de yang brjed par 'gyur la /
translated: If one hears or suspects it, but then forgets it,

original: bzod pa dang blo gros dang 'du shes sbas nas ma brjed do zhes smras na lhag ma re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pa dang blo gros dang 'du shes sbas nas ma brjed do zhes smras na lhag ma re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says, “I have not forgotten, having concealed my patience, intelligence, and perception,” then there is a partial defeat for each.

original: thos nas yid ches te ngas mthong ngo zhe 'am thos nas yid ma ches par mthong ngo zhes smras sam thos la mi dogs par ngas mthong ngo zhe'am /
analyzed: thos nas yid ches te ngas mthong ngo zhe 'am thos nas yid ma ches par mthong ngo zhes smras sam thos la mi dogs par ngas mthong ngo zhe'am /
translated: If one says, “Having heard, I believe it and I have seen it,” or if one says, “Having heard, I do not believe it and I have seen it,” or if one says, “Having heard, I do not doubt it and I have seen it,”

original: thos la dogs par ngas mthong ngo zhe'am /
analyzed: thos la dogs par ngas mthong ngo zhe'am /
translated: or if one says, “Having heard, I doubt it and I have seen it,”

original: dogs la dogs bzhin du ngas mthong ngo zhes smras na tshig re re zhing lhag ma re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dogs la dogs bzhin du ngas mthong ngo zhes smras na tshig re re zhing lhag ma re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: or if one says, “I doubt it and I have seen it,” then there is a partial defeat for each word.

original: rnam pa lngas ltung ba med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas ltung ba med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a downfall without remainder?

original: mthong ba dang thos pa dang / dogs pa dang / dogs pa yang med la /
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa dang / dogs pa dang / dogs pa yang med la /
translated: It is when one has seen, heard, or suspected, and one has no doubt,

original: 'du shes kyang ma sbas pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes kyang ma sbas pa'o //
translated: and one has not concealed one’s perception.

original: ngas dogs te de yang brjed thos te de yang brjed ces smras na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ngas dogs te de yang brjed thos te de yang brjed ces smras na ltung ba med do //
translated: If one says, “I doubt it and I have forgotten it,” or “I have heard it and I have forgotten it,” then there is no downfall.

original: gang zag nyes pa byung ba dril brdungs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gang zag nyes pa byung ba dril brdungs pa bzhin du /
translated: If one has seen, heard, or suspected that a person has committed a downfall, one should not act like a bell.

original: gun gyis shes pa dang / ri mo bris pa dang / bdag gis shes pa bzhin du 'jig rten kun gyis shes pa ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gun gyis shes pa dang / ri mo bris pa dang / bdag gis shes pa bzhin du 'jig rten kun gyis shes pa ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the world knows it as if it were a well-known painting or as if it were a well-known written document, or as if it were a well-known dream, or as if it were a well-known divination.

original: dge slong gis dge slong la phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brda dang gcig nas gcig du brgyud de skur na sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong la phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brda dang gcig nas gcig du brgyud de skur na sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk sends a message, a written document, a sign, or a hint to a monk, he commits a serious offense.

original: dge slong gis dge slong smyon pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / glan pa dang / lkugs pa dang / 'on pa dang / ra ro ba la skur na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong smyon pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / glan pa dang / lkugs pa dang / 'on pa dang / ra ro ba la skur na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk sends a message to a monk who is insane, deranged, suffering, mute, deaf, or mute and deaf, he commits a serious offense.

original: mtha' 'khob pa'i skad dam dben pa la mi dben pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: mtha' 'khob pa'i skad dam dben pa la mi dben pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: If he sends a message in a barbarian language, or if he does not understand the meaning of the words,

original: sngags dang sman gyis lus mi snang bar byas te smras sam /
analyzed: sngags dang sman gyis lus mi snang bar byas te smras sam /
translated: or if he sends a message with a spell or a medicine that makes the body invisible,

original: lus kyis dmigs te skur na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyis dmigs te skur na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: or if he sends a message by pointing with the body, he commits a serious offense.

original: dge sbyong dang mu stegs can dang / khyim pa skye bo dang bram ze la skur na thams cad kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang mu stegs can dang / khyim pa skye bo dang bram ze la skur na thams cad kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one reviles a renunciate, a tīrthika, a householder, a person, or a brahmin, then in all cases one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mi ma yin pa dang / ma ning dang / dge slong ma sun phyung ba dang / pha ma dang / dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba dang / mu stegs can dang / mu stegs can du song ba dang /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa dang / ma ning dang / dge slong ma sun phyung ba dang / pha ma dang / dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba dang / mu stegs can dang / mu stegs can du song ba dang /
translated: If one reviles a non-human, a paṇḍaka, a monk who has been expelled for not recognizing an offense, one’s father, one’s mother, an arhat, or a tathāgata from whom one has drawn blood with an evil mind, or a tīrthika, one who has gone over to the tīrthikas,

original: rkun gnas su gyur pa dang sngar 'khrugs pa la skur na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkun gnas su gyur pa dang sngar 'khrugs pa la skur na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: or one who has become a stealer of the schism, or one who has previously been expelled, then one commits a serious violation.

original: dge slong gis dge 'dun la skur pa dang / dge 'dun bye ba dang / mi gnas pa dang / rjes su phyogs pa dang / bslab pa byin pa la skur na thams cad kyang lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge 'dun la skur pa dang / dge 'dun bye ba dang / mi gnas pa dang / rjes su phyogs pa dang / bslab pa byin pa la skur na thams cad kyang lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk reviles the Saṅgha, a divided Saṅgha, one who is not present, one who is in accord, or one who has been granted training, then in all cases he commits a downfall.

original: ltung ba 'og ma la @56b yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ltung ba 'og ma la @56b yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to the remaining downfalls.

original: bag tsam gyi gling gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab 'ong ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bag tsam gyi gling gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab 'ong ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying in the Bamboo Grove, in the Squirrels’ Feeding Ground in Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor rgyal po'i khab kyi bya rgod spungs pa'i ri la rdzing bu rdos bskor zhes bya ba zhig yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor rgyal po'i khab kyi bya rgod spungs pa'i ri la rdzing bu rdos bskor zhes bya ba zhig yod de /
translated: At that time, the venerable Aśvajit was staying on Vulture Peak Mountain in Rājagṛha, in a pond surrounded by stones.

original: de'i 'gram yan man gyad bu nor nyin par der gnas shing bsgom mo //
analyzed: de'i 'gram yan man gyad bu nor nyin par der gnas shing bsgom mo //
translated: On the banks of that pond, Aśvajit would stay and meditate during the day.

original: de'i tshe dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'phags pa mood gal gyi bus rab tu phung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'phags pa mood gal gyi bus rab tu phung ngo //
translated: At that time, the nun Utpalavarṇā was well-instructed by the noble Upāli.

original: tshe dang ldan ma autpa la'i mdog sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu dang / 'phags pa gyad bu nor la sogs pa la rtag tu bsnyen bkur byed cing phyag 'tshal du 'gro'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan ma autpa la'i mdog sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu dang / 'phags pa gyad bu nor la sogs pa la rtag tu bsnyen bkur byed cing phyag 'tshal du 'gro'o //
translated: The venerable Utpalavarṇā always went to serve and pay homage to the Buddha, the noble Upāli, the noble Aśvajit, and so forth.

original: de'i nyin par 'phags pa mood gal la sogs pa la phyag byas nas /
analyzed: de'i nyin par 'phags pa mood gal la sogs pa la phyag byas nas /
translated: On that day, after paying homage to the noble Upāli and so forth,

original: tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor la yang phyag 'tshal te chos nyan pa'i phyir mdun na 'dug go //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor la yang phyag 'tshal te chos nyan pa'i phyir mdun na 'dug go //
translated: He bowed to the venerable Jīvaka Kumārabhṛta and sat down in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis kyang rtag tu klan ka tshol ba nan tan byed pas nang par de gnyis phyag dar khrod pa mang zhig btus nas rdzing bu rdos bskor du 'khrur lhags pa dang / de'i tshe ri dags khyu mang po zhig rdzing bu der chu 'thung du lhags nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis kyang rtag tu klan ka tshol ba nan tan byed pas nang par de gnyis phyag dar khrod pa mang zhig btus nas rdzing bu rdos bskor du 'khrur lhags pa dang / de'i tshe ri dags khyu mang po zhig rdzing bu der chu 'thung du lhags nas /
translated: At that time, the monks Maitrāyaṇī­putra and Saṅgharakṣita were always intent on finding fault. In the morning, they collected a lot of rags from the garbage and went to wash them in a pond surrounded by stones. At that time, a large herd of deer came to that pond to drink water.

original: chu 'thungs zin pa'i 'og tu ri dags rnams gcig la gcig zhon zhing mi tshangs par spyod pa dang mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis kyis mthong nas gcig la gcig smras pa /
analyzed: chu 'thungs zin pa'i 'og tu ri dags rnams gcig la gcig zhon zhing mi tshangs par spyod pa dang mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis kyis mthong nas gcig la gcig smras pa /
translated: After they had drunk water, the deer rode on each other and engaged in sexual misconduct. Maitrāyaṇī­putra and Saṅgharakṣita saw this and said to each other,

original: dge slong autpa la'i mdog dang gyad bu nor gnyis mi tshangs par spyod kyi /
analyzed: dge slong autpa la'i mdog dang gyad bu nor gnyis mi tshangs par spyod kyi /
translated: The monks Utpalavarna and Jīvaka Kumārabhṛta engage in sexual misconduct.

original: dge slong dag la bsnyad du 'dong zhes byas pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa khar nyin yang bdag cag aang por do spangs nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag la bsnyad du 'dong zhes byas pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa khar nyin yang bdag cag aang por do spangs nas /
translated: The Venerable Kharadya said, We have already been accused of being a couple.🔽Do you want to do a second act of abandonment?

original: da yang spang ba'i las byed 'dod dam zhes sa can gyis smras pa dang / des khar nyin ni'u bu cag brdzun gyi /
analyzed: da yang spang ba'i las byed 'dod dam zhes sa can gyis smras pa dang / des khar nyin ni'u bu cag brdzun gyi /
translated: He said, Kharadya, we lied.

original: da ni bag tsam gyi cha las blangs pas rung gis dge slong dag la bsnyad du 'dong ngo zhes byas nas /
analyzed: da ni bag tsam gyi cha las blangs pas rung gis dge slong dag la bsnyad du 'dong ngo zhes byas nas /
translated: Now it is appropriate to take a small portion. Let us go and tell the monks.🔽They said to the monks, Ghoṣila and the nun Utpalavarnā are engaging in sexual misconduct.

original: de dag dge slong dag la gyad bu nor dang dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog mi tshangs par spyod do zhes smras pa dang / dge slong dag gis tshe dang ldan pa khyod gnyis lha dang mi ni shin tu spangs kyi /
analyzed: de dag dge slong dag la gyad bu nor dang dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog mi tshangs par spyod do zhes smras pa dang / dge slong dag gis tshe dang ldan pa khyod gnyis lha dang mi ni shin tu spangs kyi /
translated: The monks said, Venerables, you two have completely abandoned gods and humans.🔽You have approached animals, hell beings, and hungry ghosts.

original: byol song ngang sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags ni mngon par bsnyen to zhes bya ba dang / dge slong dag gis yang gong ma bzhin du ci'i phyir mthong /
analyzed: byol song ngang sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags ni mngon par bsnyen to zhes bya ba dang / dge slong dag gis yang gong ma bzhin du ci'i phyir mthong /
translated: The monks asked, Why do you see this?

original: gang du mthong khyed cag ci la dong dong ste mthong zhes smras pa dang / de gnyis kyis ci ltar gyur pa zhib tu smras pa dang / don nyung ba'i @57a * //
analyzed: gang du mthong khyed cag ci la dong dong ste mthong zhes smras pa dang / de gnyis kyis ci ltar gyur pa zhib tu smras pa dang / don nyung ba'i @57a * //
translated: Where did you see him? They replied, We saw him when we went to the village to beg for alms.

original: dge slong rnams 'phya ste /
analyzed: dge slong rnams 'phya ste /
translated: The monks who had few concerns criticized them,

original: dge slong gtsang ma nyes pa med pa la gzhan gyi cha ma yin pa la phas pham par skur ces smod cing mi snyan par 'dzer to //
analyzed: dge slong gtsang ma nyes pa med pa la gzhan gyi cha ma yin pa la phas pham par skur ces smod cing mi snyan par 'dzer to //
translated: saying, How can a monk who is pure and without fault be slandered with an unfounded charge of defeat?

original: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
translated: They told the Blessed One what had happened.

original: legs pa rnam pa bcu la gzigs nas /
analyzed: legs pa rnam pa bcu la gzigs nas /
translated: The Blessed One, seeing the ten benefits,

original: yang dge slong gang zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas te rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas te rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
translated: established a training rule for the monks, saying,🔽A monk who is angry and upset,

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo dang sa can te gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //🔽zhe sdang can zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis kun nas bskor ba'o //🔽khros nas gnod par byed ces bya ba ni yi ma rangs te /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo dang sa can te gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o // zhe sdang can zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis kun nas bskor ba'o // khros nas gnod par byed ces bya ba ni yi ma rangs te /
translated: having been reproved by the monks,🔽should not slander them with an unfounded charge of defeat.🔽If he says, I will expel you, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: 'khrugs pa ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa ma btang ba'o //
translated: If he says, I will have you removed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: dge slong gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni gyad bu nor ram gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dge slong gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni gyad bu nor ram gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: “A pure monk” is Gayākassapa or another of the same type.

original: ma nyas zhes bya ba ni nyes pa de'i dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: ma nyas zhes bya ba ni nyes pa de'i dngos po med pa'o //
translated: “Not defiled” means that he is not the sort of person who has that fault.

original: gzhan gyi cha ma yin zhes bya ba gzhan gyi mya ngan las 'das pa ste /🔽de'i cha ma yin pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi cha ma yin zhes bya ba gzhan gyi mya ngan las 'das pa ste / de'i cha ma yin pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: “Not a part of others” means that it is not the nirvana of others.🔽“Not a part of that” means that it is not the four defeats.

original: phas pham pa'i chos so phas pham pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi po las gang gis kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: phas pham pa'i chos so phas pham pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi po las gang gis kyang rung ngo //
translated: “Defeat” means any one of the four.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas so //
translated: “Dharma” means that it holds its own characteristics.

original: skur zhes bya ba ni klang btab ba'o //
analyzed: skur zhes bya ba ni klang btab ba'o //
translated: “To slander” means to deny.

original: de ci nas kyang tshangs par spyod pa dang dbral lo snyam pa ni de ci nas kyang dge slong gi dngos po dang dbral lo snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: de ci nas kyang tshangs par spyod pa dang dbral lo snyam pa ni de ci nas kyang dge slong gi dngos po dang dbral lo snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: “So that he will be separated from pure conduct” means so that he will be separated from the status of a monk.

original: dus gzhan zhig na zhes bya ba ni dus phyi zhig na'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na zhes bya ba ni dus phyi zhig na'o //
translated: “At another time” means at a later time.

original: dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis so //
translated: “Whether asked or unasked” means by another.

original: ma dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis te /
analyzed: ma dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis te /
translated: Even if not asked means by oneself.

original: rab tu 'gyod cing rnam par 'gyed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'gyod cing rnam par 'gyed pa'o //
translated: It is to be very remorseful and to dispute.

original: gzhan gyi cha ma yin zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa las gzhan pa phas pham par smras pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi cha ma yin zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa las gzhan pa phas pham par smras pa'o //
translated: The other part means that which is other than nirvana, and is called defeat.

original: rtsod pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of disputes:

original: rnam par rtsod pas rtsod pa dang / mi 'doms pas rtsod pa dang / ltung bas rtsod pa dang bya bas rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtsod pas rtsod pa dang / mi 'doms pas rtsod pa dang / ltung bas rtsod pa dang bya bas rtsod pa'o //
translated: disputes through debate, disputes through not instructing, disputes through downfalls, and disputes through activities.

original: gzhan gyi cha ma yin pas rtsod pa yang bag tsam gyi cha las 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni ri dags sa pho mos 'khrig pa'i cha las blangs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi cha ma yin pas rtsod pa yang bag tsam gyi cha las 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni ri dags sa pho mos 'khrig pa'i cha las blangs pa'o //
translated: The other part is a dispute that is taken from a small part, some means that which is taken from the part of copulation of a male and female deer.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni chos ma yin par chos kyi sgrar gsungs so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni chos ma yin par chos kyi sgrar gsungs so //
translated: The dharma is that which is not dharma, spoken as the word of the dharma.

original: blangs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: blangs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gzung ba yin no //
translated: It is taken means it is grasped.

original: dge slong yang zhe sdang la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni klang gdab par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong yang zhe sdang la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni klang gdab par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The monk who dwells in hatred is one who wishes to slander.

original: khros te smras so zhes bya ba ni klang 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: khros te smras so zhes bya ba ni klang 'debs pa'o //
translated: “Angry” means “angry at the one who is not angry.”

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin na //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin na //
translated: “The Saṅgha’s serious offense” is as above.

original: nyes pa gang zhe na /
