analyzed: nyes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the offense?

original: dge slong gis dge slong la phas pham pa'i ltung ba byung ba mthong nas des de la ltung ba ma yin no snyam du bltas la 'du @57b shes dang blo gros sbas nas phas pham pa byung ba mthong ngo zhes smras na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong la phas pham pa'i ltung ba byung ba mthong nas des de la ltung ba ma yin no snyam du bltas la 'du @57b shes dang blo gros sbas nas phas pham pa byung ba mthong ngo zhes smras na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk sees a monk commit a defeating offense, but thinks, “It’s not a defeating offense,” and then hides his recognition and his opinion, and says, “I’ve seen a defeating offense,” he commits a serious offense.

original: dge slong gis dag slong la phas pham pa byung ba mthong na des dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o snyam du bltas la 'du shes dang bzod pa sbas na phas pham pa'i ltung ba byung ngo zhes smras na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dag slong la phas pham pa byung ba mthong na des dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o snyam du bltas la 'du shes dang bzod pa sbas na phas pham pa'i ltung ba byung ngo zhes smras na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk sees a monk commit a defeating offense, but thinks, “It’s a serious offense,” and then hides his recognition and his opinion, and says, “I’ve seen a defeating offense,” he commits a serious offense.

original: de bzhin du ltung ba rigs lnga la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ltung ba rigs lnga la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to the five classes of offenses.

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma mthong ba dang / spangs pa dang / ltung ba dang / so sor bshags pa dang / nyes byas byung ba mthong ba la nges 'du shes sbas na blo gros sbas nas phas pham pa byung ngo zhes bya ba smras na thams cad du lhag mar 'gyur ba de re rer sbyor cig / kun gyis shes pa dang /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma mthong ba dang / spangs pa dang / ltung ba dang / so sor bshags pa dang / nyes byas byung ba mthong ba la nges 'du shes sbas na blo gros sbas nas phas pham pa byung ngo zhes bya ba smras na thams cad du lhag mar 'gyur ba de re rer sbyor cig / kun gyis shes pa dang /
translated: If one sees a partial defeat of the Saṅgha, or if one sees a downfall, a downfall that is confessed individually, or a wrong action, and conceals the certainty, then if one says, “I concealed my discernment and a defeating offense arose,” then in all cases it is a partial defeat. Apply this to each.

original: ri mo bris pa 'dra ba dang / las dang po pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ri mo bris pa 'dra ba dang / las dang po pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If it is known by all, or if it is like a drawing, or if it is a beginner, there is no offense.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The introduction to the schism of the Saṅgha: The Blessed Buddha was dwelling in the Kalandaka Garden in the Veṇuvana by Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe dge slong lha sbyin dang / de'i grogs rjes su phyogs pa dge slong ko ka li ka dang / khanda dra ba bya dang / ka da mo ra ka ti shya dang / rgya mtshos byin la sogs pa dge 'dun 'dum pa dbye ba la zhugs nas gsol pa dang zhu ba'i las kyis lan gsum gyi bar du bzlog kyang ma btub nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong lha sbyin dang / de'i grogs rjes su phyogs pa dge slong ko ka li ka dang / khanda dra ba bya dang / ka da mo ra ka ti shya dang / rgya mtshos byin la sogs pa dge 'dun 'dum pa dbye ba la zhugs nas gsol pa dang zhu ba'i las kyis lan gsum gyi bar du bzlog kyang ma btub nas /
translated: At that time, the monk Devadatta, his friends and followers, the monks Kokālika, Kaṭamorakatiṣya, Kaṇṭhaka, and Sāgara, and others, having entered into the division of the Saṅgha, were not able to be stopped by the three requests and the three actions of the Saṅgha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' bcag pas nyon mongs pas na dge 'dun gyi lhag ma bcu pa dang bcu gcig pa bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' bcag pas nyon mongs pas na dge 'dun gyi lhag ma bcu pa dang bcu gcig pa bcas pa'o //
translated: Because they had transgressed the word of the Tathāgata, they were afflicted, and they committed the tenth and eleventh offenses of the Saṅgha.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab na mu ge chen po byung nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab na mu ge chen po byung nas /
translated: At that time, there was a great famine in Rājagṛha.

original: kha zas rab tu dkon te rnyed par dka' nas dge slong rdzu 'phrul thob pa rnams gyis 'dzam bu'i gling nas shing 'dzam bu'i 'bru dang skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu la sogs len /
analyzed: kha zas rab tu dkon te rnyed par dka' nas dge slong rdzu 'phrul thob pa rnams gyis 'dzam bu'i gling nas shing 'dzam bu'i 'bru dang skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu la sogs len /
translated: Because food was very rare and difficult to obtain, the monks who had attained magical powers took fruits of the rose apple tree and āmalakī fruit from Jambudvīpa.

original: dge slong kha cig gis byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling nas ma btab ma rmos pa'i 'bras len /
analyzed: dge slong kha cig gis byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling nas ma btab ma rmos pa'i 'bras len /
translated: Some monks went to the northern continent of Kuru and brought back rice that did not need to be planted or cultivated.

original: kha cig rgyal chen bzhi dang sum cu rtsa gsum du dong nas lha'i zas kyis ltung bkang ste khyer te 'ongs nas bdag kyang za dge slong gzhan rnams la yang sbyin no //
analyzed: kha cig rgyal chen bzhi dang sum cu rtsa gsum du dong nas lha'i zas kyis ltung bkang ste khyer te 'ongs nas bdag kyang za dge slong gzhan rnams la yang sbyin no //
translated: Some went to the Heaven of the Thirty-three and the Heaven of the Four Great Kings and filled their begging bowls with divine food. They brought it back and ate it themselves and gave it to the other monks.

original: de nas lha sbyin gyis bsams pa /
analyzed: de nas lha sbyin gyis bsams pa /
translated: Then Devadatta thought,

original: da ltar kha zas dkon zhing sdug bsngal che na bdag gis kyang rdzu 'phrul mngon par bsgrubs la bdag kyang zas gzhan la yang sbyin no snyam nas bcom ldan 'das la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam zhig dri'i snyam du bsams pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha sbyin la rdzu 'phrul bstan na de lta bu'i sdig pa'i 'dod @58a * //
analyzed: da ltar kha zas dkon zhing sdug bsngal che na bdag gis kyang rdzu 'phrul mngon par bsgrubs la bdag kyang zas gzhan la yang sbyin no snyam nas bcom ldan 'das la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam zhig dri'i snyam du bsams pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha sbyin la rdzu 'phrul bstan na de lta bu'i sdig pa'i 'dod @58a * //
translated: “Now that food is scarce and suffering is great, I too will accomplish miracles and give food to others.” He thought, “I will ask the Blessed One for a path of miracles.” The Blessed One knew that if he showed miracles to Devadatta, he would develop such great evil desires

original: chen skyed par mkhyen nas phung po lnga la rtog tu bcug nas rdzu 'phrul ma bstan to //
analyzed: chen skyed par mkhyen nas phung po lnga la rtog tu bcug nas rdzu 'phrul ma bstan to //
translated: and so he had him contemplate the five aggregates. He did not show him miracles.

original: de bzhin du gnas brtan lnga brgya po la dris pa dang / sems kyis brtags nas rdzu 'phrul ma bstan to /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas brtan lnga brgya po la dris pa dang / sems kyis brtags nas rdzu 'phrul ma bstan to /
translated: In the same way, he asked the five hundred elders, but they did not display their miracles, having examined his mind.

original: de nas 'od srungs stobs bcu la dris pa dang / des rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan te /
analyzed: de nas 'od srungs stobs bcu la dris pa dang / des rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan te /
translated: Then he asked Kāśyapa, who had the ten powers, and he displayed the path of miracles.

original: lha sbyin gyis rnal 'byor la brtson par gnas pas rdzu 'phrul mngon par thob ste /
analyzed: lha sbyin gyis rnal 'byor la brtson par gnas pas rdzu 'phrul mngon par thob ste /
translated: Devadatta, who was diligent in yoga, attained miracles.

original: lus sna tshogs su bsgyur nas nam mkha' la ni bya bzhin /
analyzed: lus sna tshogs su bsgyur nas nam mkha' la ni bya bzhin /
translated: He transformed his body into various forms and flew through the sky like a bird.

original: chu la ni nya bzhin du rgyal po ma skyes dgra yang mgu bar byas te /
analyzed: chu la ni nya bzhin du rgyal po ma skyes dgra yang mgu bar byas te /
translated: He pleased King Ajātaśatru by walking on water like a goose.

original: de'i mchil ma 'thungs nas ma skyes dgras kyang lha sbyin gyi 'tsho ba yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i mchil ma 'thungs nas ma skyes dgras kyang lha sbyin gyi 'tsho ba yang sbyar ro //
translated: He drank the king's spit, and Ajātaśatru also provided for Devadatta's livelihood.

original: de nas lha sbyin gyis bcom ldan 'das ni rgas thug ste /
analyzed: de nas lha sbyin gyis bcom ldan 'das ni rgas thug ste /
translated: Then Devadatta thought, The Blessed One is old and decrepit.

original: 'khor rnam bzhi la ston kyang mi nus la 'o brgyal gyis 'khor rnam bzhi bdag la gtad par gsol na /
analyzed: 'khor rnam bzhi la ston kyang mi nus la 'o brgyal gyis 'khor rnam bzhi bdag la gtad par gsol na /
translated: Even if he teaches the four assemblies, he is unable. He should retire and entrust the four assemblies to me.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽Devadatta, you are not fit to be the teacher of the four assemblies.

original: ngas sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu la yang ma gtad na skyes bu blun po khyod la ci smos zhes ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: ngas sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu la yang ma gtad na skyes bu blun po khyod la ci smos zhes ma gnang ngo //
translated: I would not entrust it even to Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, so how much less to you, a foolish man!🔽 Then Devadatta approached the five monks, Kadrāmōkana and the others, and said,

original: de nas lha sbyin gyis dge slong grogs ka da mo ra ka la sogs pa lnga po la khe mo tshur shog / dge sbyong goo ta ma 'dug bzhin du 'khor nyan thos rnams 'khrug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lha sbyin gyis dge slong grogs ka da mo ra ka la sogs pa lnga po la khe mo tshur shog / dge sbyong goo ta ma 'dug bzhin du 'khor nyan thos rnams 'khrug par bya'o //
translated: Come here! While the ascetic Gautama is still alive, let us create a schism in the assembly of his śrāvaka disciples.

original: 'u bu cag 'das pa'i 'og tu phyogs phyogs su grags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'u bu cag 'das pa'i 'og tu phyogs phyogs su grags par 'gyur ro //
translated: After we have passed away, we will become famous in all directions.

original: zhes bgros nas /
analyzed: zhes bgros nas /
translated: They agreed.

original: gnas brtan dag ni longs spyod kyis kha drangs /
analyzed: gnas brtan dag ni longs spyod kyis kha drangs /
translated: The elders were attracted by material things,

original: gzhan ni longs spyod dang bslab pas kha drangs nas /
analyzed: gzhan ni longs spyod dang bslab pas kha drangs nas /
translated: and the others were attracted by both material things and the precepts.

original: dge slong 'khor lnga brgya kha drangs so //
analyzed: dge slong 'khor lnga brgya kha drangs so //
translated: Thus he attracted five hundred monks.

original: bslab pa lnga bcas te /
analyzed: bslab pa lnga bcas te /
translated: He established five precepts:

original: 'o ma mi btung ba dang / sha mi bza' ba dang / lan tshva mi bza' ba dang / skyes bu'i mthu rtsal la gnod pas ras kha tshar bcas pa mi gon pa dang / byin pa'i chos longs spyod bkag pas dgon par mi gnas so zhes bya ba bcas so //
analyzed: 'o ma mi btung ba dang / sha mi bza' ba dang / lan tshva mi bza' ba dang / skyes bu'i mthu rtsal la gnod pas ras kha tshar bcas pa mi gon pa dang / byin pa'i chos longs spyod bkag pas dgon par mi gnas so zhes bya ba bcas so //
translated: not to drink milk, not to eat meat, not to eat salt, not to wear woolen cloth, and not to live in the wilderness, because it is forbidden to enjoy the gifts of the faithful.

original: de ltar gyur pa dge slong gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa dge slong gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this to the Blessed One.🔽The Blessed One summoned Devadatta and said, “Devadatta, is it true that you are doing this?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lha sbyin bkug nas lha sbyin de ltar byed pa bden nam zhes smras pa dang / mad do zhes gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lha sbyin bkug nas lha sbyin de ltar byed pa bden nam zhes smras pa dang / mad do zhes gsol to //
translated: “Yes, it is true,” he replied.

original: de ltar gyur pa de'i phyir 'dul ba bslab pa'i gnas bcas te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de'i phyir 'dul ba bslab pa'i gnas bcas te /
translated: “For this reason, I establish a rule of training for the monks.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
translated: ‘Any monk’ means a monk who is a root monk.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: lha sbyin dang rjes su phyogs pa'i dge slong dang gzhan yang 'di 'dra ba'i tshig bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha sbyin dang rjes su phyogs pa'i dge slong dang gzhan yang 'di 'dra ba'i tshig bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: “You should admonish Devadatta and the monks who side with him in a way that accords with the Dharma.

original: de ste yang gtong du yang ma btub na gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis lan gnyis lan gsum @58b du bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ste yang gtong du yang ma btub na gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis lan gnyis lan gsum @58b du bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: If he still does not give up that view, then after the motion, he should be pressed up to three times to make him give up that view.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin te gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin te gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: “The monk” is Devadatta, and so on.

original: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: “In agreement” means in six ways:

original: cha lugs dang / las dang / tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / 'tsho ba dang / spyod lam mthun pa de lta bu drug ces bya'o //
analyzed: cha lugs dang / las dang / tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / 'tsho ba dang / spyod lam mthun pa de lta bu drug ces bya'o //
translated: in appearance, in action, in morality, in view, in livelihood, and in ritual.

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: “The Saṅgha” is the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata’s disciples.

original: dbyen byed ces bya ba ni ston pa dang lam gzhan du gzung cing rnam pa gnyis su 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbyen byed ces bya ba ni ston pa dang lam gzhan du gzung cing rnam pa gnyis su 'byed pa'o //
translated: “To cause a split” means to hold a different teacher and path, and to divide the community into two.🔽“Therefore” means because of that.🔽“To engage in litigation” means to engage in a dispute.

original: de'i phyir zhugs zhes bya ba ni rtsod par zhugs pa ste /🔽tshul khrims sam gsol pa byed pa'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhugs zhes bya ba ni rtsod par zhugs pa ste /🔽tshul khrims sam gsol pa byed pa'i //
translated: “To be expelled” means to be expelled from the community.🔽“To be suspended” means to be suspended from the community.🔽“To be made to confess” means to be made to confess a fault.🔽“To be given the trial period” means to be given the trial period.🔽“To be rehabilitated” means to be rehabilitated.🔽“To be expelled for not recognizing an offense” means to be expelled for not recognizing an offense.🔽“To be expelled for not making amends for an offense” means to be expelled for not making amends for an offense.🔽“To be expelled for not giving up a bad view” means to be expelled for not giving up a bad view.🔽“To be expelled for not giving up schism in the Saṅgha” means to be expelled for not giving up schism in the Saṅgha.🔽“To be expelled for not giving up following one who has been expelled for not giving up schism in the Saṅgha” means to be expelled for not giving up following one who has been expelled for not giving up schism in the Saṅgha.🔽“To be expelled for not giving up following one who has been expelled for not giving up schism in the Saṅgha” means to be expelled for not giving up following one who has been expelled for not giving up schism in the Saṅgha.

original: dbye ba'i phyir yang zhes bya ba ni zas la sogs pa byin pa dang / grogs po la sogs pa'o / rtsod ces bya ba ni 'khrug pa'i rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba'i phyir yang zhes bya ba ni zas la sogs pa byin pa dang / grogs po la sogs pa'o / rtsod ces bya ba ni 'khrug pa'i rtsod pa'o //
translated: “Dispute” means a dispute of contention.

original: dge slong rnams zhes bya ba ni las ma byas par bzhams te bsgo zhing slar bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams zhes bya ba ni las ma byas par bzhams te bsgo zhing slar bzlog par bya'o //
translated: “Monks” means that one should admonish and turn back without performing the action.

original: yang dag par bzung ste zhes bya ba ni sems kyis so //
analyzed: yang dag par bzung ste zhes bya ba ni sems kyis so //
translated: “Having taken up” means with the mind.

original: rab tu 'dzin ces bya ba ni mngon par chags pas na mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin ces bya ba ni mngon par chags pas na mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Holding” means not changing due to manifest attachment.

original: mnyam du zhes bya ba ni chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod la mtshungs pa 'am /
analyzed: mnyam du zhes bya ba ni chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod la mtshungs pa 'am /
translated: “Together” means equal enjoyment of Dharma and material goods,

original: phan tshun dad pa la sogs pas sbyin pa la mnyam du 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun dad pa la sogs pas sbyin pa la mnyam du 'tsho ba'o //
translated: or living together with faith, etc.

original: kun du dga' zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i tshogs 'phel bar dga' ba'am /
analyzed: kun du dga' zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i tshogs 'phel bar dga' ba'am /
translated: “Delighting” means delighting in the increase of the collection of virtue,

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: or delighting in the accomplishment of meditative concentration.

original: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba log par gyur pa la spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba log par gyur pa la spang bar bya'o //
translated: “Dispute” means that one should abandon the occurrence of wrong views.

original: rtse gcig ces bya ba ni sems gzhan du mi 'gyur bar thub par bya'o //
analyzed: rtse gcig ces bya ba ni sems gzhan du mi 'gyur bar thub par bya'o //
translated: One-pointed means to be silent without letting the mind go elsewhere.

original: 'don ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa tha dad du mi 'byed pas ni gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'don ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa tha dad du mi 'byed pas ni gcig pa'o //
translated: The chant is the recitation of the Pratimoksha Sutra, which is not divided into different parts.

original: chu dang 'o ma gcig tu 'des zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig rim gro byed cing ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu dang 'o ma gcig tu 'des zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig rim gro byed cing ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like water and milk mixed together means to serve and teach each other.

original: ston pa'i bstan pa rgyas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis 'gran par mi byed pas na /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa rgyas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis 'gran par mi byed pas na /
translated: In order to spread the teachings of the Teacher means that others do not compete with each other.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung rab bshad cing ston tam bshad cing phye na rgyas par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung rab bshad cing ston tam bshad cing phye na rgyas par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: If the Bhagavan explains and teaches the scriptures, explains and analyzes them, they will spread.

original: de ltar gsung rab rgyas dang slob ma'i 'khor dge 'dun rnams tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsung rab rgyas dang slob ma'i 'khor dge 'dun rnams tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Thus, may the scriptures spread and the assembly of disciples, the Sangha, dwell in happiness in this life.

original: de yang ji ltar bde zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar bde zhe na /
translated: How is that happiness?

original: lus ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: lus ni bde ba'o //
translated: The body is at ease.

original: sems ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni reg pa'o //
translated: The mind is at ease.

original: bzhams te bsgo ba'i tshe ma mnyan na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhams te bsgo ba'i tshe ma mnyan na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not listen when instructed, it becomes a minor offense.

original: gsol pa dang zhu ba'i las kyis bsgo ste ldog tu ma btub na nyes pa sbom po gsum dang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma gcig go //
analyzed: gsol pa dang zhu ba'i las kyis bsgo ste ldog tu ma btub na nyes pa sbom po gsum dang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma gcig go //
translated: If he does not desist from his course of action by the work of requesting and entreating him, then there are three grave offenses and one offense entailing suspension.

original: lan gnyis las gsum zhes @59a * //
analyzed: lan gnyis las gsum zhes @59a * //
translated: The phrase two times, three times

original: bya ba ni ha cang nyung na yang g-yengs pa kha cig gis mi go la ha cang mang na yang ring du thogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba ni ha cang nyung na yang g-yengs pa kha cig gis mi go la ha cang mang na yang ring du thogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that if there is too little, some people who are distracted will not understand, and if there is too much, it will be delayed for a long time.

original: yang dag par bsgo ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba la gzhug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgo ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba la gzhug par bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase he is properly admonished means that he is to be made to enter into virtue.

original: yang dag par bstan zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba las bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba las bzlog par bya'o //
translated: The phrase he is properly instructed means that he is to be turned away from nonvirtue.

original: 'khor 'gyed par bsams nas gzhan gyi 'khor kha drangs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //🔽gal te dge 'dun 'dus nas chos bzhin du ma byas na smra ba rdzogs kyang nyes pa med do //🔽chos bzhin du byas kyang tshogs na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'khor 'gyed par bsams nas gzhan gyi 'khor kha drangs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro // gal te dge 'dun 'dus nas chos bzhin du ma byas na smra ba rdzogs kyang nyes pa med do // chos bzhin du byas kyang tshogs na ltung ba med do //
translated: If he invites the retinue of another with the intention of dividing the retinue, then there is a grave offense.🔽If the Saṅgha has assembled and he does not act in accordance with the Dharma, then there is no offense even if he speaks.🔽If he acts in accordance with the Dharma, then there is no offense even if he does not speak.

original: 'dus kyang chos kyi gzugs brnyan gyis bsgo na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'dus kyang chos kyi gzugs brnyan gyis bsgo na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: If the Saṅgha has assembled and he admonishes with a counterfeit of the Dharma, then there is no offense.

original: dge 'dun yang tshogs la ston pa'i bstan pa ji lta ba dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du bsgo na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun yang tshogs la ston pa'i bstan pa ji lta ba dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du bsgo na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Saṅgha instructs the Saṅgha in accordance with the Teacher’s doctrine and the Vinaya, it is a pārājika offense.

original: nyes pa rab tu ma bshags ma mthol bar dge 'dun gyi nang du 'jug cing gnas na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa rab tu ma bshags ma mthol bar dge 'dun gyi nang du 'jug cing gnas na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one enters and remains in the Saṅgha without confessing and revealing one’s faults, it is a fault in all cases.

original: rjes su phyogs pa'i gleng gzhi ni gong ma dang gcig go //
analyzed: rjes su phyogs pa'i gleng gzhi ni gong ma dang gcig go //
translated: The basis of the following is the same as the previous one.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das gdan de nyid la bzhugs bzhin du rjes su phyogs pa'i bslab pa bca' bar dgongs nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gdan de nyid la bzhugs bzhin du rjes su phyogs pa'i bslab pa bca' bar dgongs nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then, while still seated on that seat, the Blessed One, intending to lay down the training rule for the following, said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag dge 'dun gyi bya ba cung zad cig yod kyi skad cig sdod cig ces bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge 'dun gyi bya ba cung zad cig yod kyi skad cig sdod cig ces bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Monks, there is a small matter of the Saṅgha. Please wait a moment.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen bzhin du 'dri bas na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen bzhin du 'dri bas na /
translated: Since the Blessed One knew, he asked.

original: ko ka li ka dang / ka da mo ra ka la sogs pa la de lta bur rjes su phyogs pa bden nam zhes smras pa dang / mad do zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: ko ka li ka dang / ka da mo ra ka la sogs pa la de lta bur rjes su phyogs pa bden nam zhes smras pa dang / mad do zhes gsol nas /
translated: and they said, It is true.

original: dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin na zhes rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin na zhes rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
translated: After rebuking them in many ways, he said, Monks, this causes harm to non-believers, and is a stumbling block for believers.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
translated: The words monks are the basic words.

original: dge slong rjes su phyogs pa rnams la dge 'dun rnams kyis chos dang mthun pa 'dul ba dang mthun pa'i tshig gis lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo bar bya /
analyzed: dge slong rjes su phyogs pa rnams la dge 'dun rnams kyis chos dang mthun pa 'dul ba dang mthun pa'i tshig gis lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo bar bya /
translated: The monks who side with them should be admonished by the Saṅgha up to two or three times with words in accordance with the Dharma and the Vinaya.

original: bstan par bya yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin no /
analyzed: bstan par bya yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin no /
translated: The words monks refer to Devadatta.

original: grogs su gyur ces bya ba ni ko ka li ka la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: grogs su gyur ces bya ba ni ko ka li ka la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words who side with him refer to Kokālika, etc.

original: dbyen byed par phyogs zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang / de'i 'don pa dang / de'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: dbyen byed par phyogs zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang / de'i 'don pa dang / de'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The words who side with the schism refer to the view, its recitation, and its intention.

original: gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun ma longs pa dbyen mi srid pas bzhi yan chad la bya'o //🔽gal te de dag dge slong rnams la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun ma longs pa dbyen mi srid pas bzhi yan chad la bya'o // gal te de dag dge slong rnams la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: One, two, or many means four or more, because it is impossible to divide a saṅgha that is not complete.🔽If they say to the monks, “This monk is righteous,” means “This monk is engaged in this Dharma.”

original: de skad kyang zer zhes bya ba ni smra ba'o / tshe dang ldan pa dag dge slong 'di la zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin la bya'o //
analyzed: de skad kyang zer zhes bya ba ni smra ba'o / tshe dang ldan pa dag dge slong 'di la zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin la bya'o //
translated: If they say, “He is a speaker of Dharma,” means “He is a speaker of the Vinaya.”

original: dge yang rung zhes bya ba @59b ni dge ba la ma sbyor cig pa'o //
analyzed: dge yang rung zhes bya ba @59b ni dge ba la ma sbyor cig pa'o //
translated: Venerable ones, do not associate with this monk, whether he is righteous or not, means “Do not associate with him in terms of virtue.”

original: sdig kyang rung zhes bya ba ni sdig pa las ma bzlog cig la'o /
analyzed: sdig kyang rung zhes bya ba ni sdig pa las ma bzlog cig la'o /
translated: Do not turn him away, whether he is sinful or not, means “Do not turn him away from sin.”

original: dge slong 'di ni chos smra ba 'dul ba smra ba zhes bya ba ni de dag gi don dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni chos smra ba 'dul ba smra ba zhes bya ba ni de dag gi don dang mthun pa'o //
translated: This monk is a speaker of Dharma, a speaker of the Vinaya, means “He is in accord with their aims.”🔽He is not ignorant, means “He is a monk who has realized the meaning.”

original: mi shes pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni don rtogs pa'i dge slong de gang la dad pa bdag cag kyang dad do zhes bya ba ni dge slong rjes su phyogs pa lnga po rnams /
analyzed: mi shes pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni don rtogs pa'i dge slong de gang la dad pa bdag cag kyang dad do zhes bya ba ni dge slong rjes su phyogs pa lnga po rnams /
translated: We have confidence in whatever he has confidence in, means “The five monks who follow him have confidence in whatever he has confidence in.”

original: lha sbyin gyi bsam pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: lha sbyin gyi bsam pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: It is in accordance with Devadatta’s intention.

original: yang dag par bstan yang dag par bsgo zhes bya ba ni snga ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan yang dag par bsgo zhes bya ba ni snga ma yin no //
translated: “Correctly taught” and “correctly admonished” are as before.

original: rjes su phyogs pa la zhugs na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su phyogs pa la zhugs na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is engaged in agreeing with him, then in all cases there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tshig bzhams te bsgo nas ma btub na nyes pa sbom po 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig bzhams te bsgo nas ma btub na nyes pa sbom po 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is not able to do so after being admonished with gentle speech, then there is a serious offense.

original: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis lan gsum du bsko ste /🔽gtong du ma btub na nyes byas gcig dang sbom po gsum dang lhag ma gcig tu 'gyur ro //🔽bsdum par bzhams te ma bsgo bar gsol ba dang / bzhi'i las kyis sngar bsgo na bsgo bar yang mi chud la dge 'dun yang nyes byas so //🔽bsdum par bzhams te sngar bsgo nas gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo na bsgo bar yang chud de nyes pa med do //

original: rigs sun pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: rigs sun pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na yul srin bu ri zhes bya ba na dge slong tha skar skyes dang / nab so dang / dge slong dur kha dang da mar zhes bya ba'i dge slong rnams 'khod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe na yul srin bu ri zhes bya ba na dge slong tha skar skyes dang / nab so dang / dge slong dur kha dang da mar zhes bya ba'i dge slong rnams 'khod do //
translated: At that time, in the country of Kṛmi there were monks named Aśvinī, Nabhas, and the monks Śmaśru and Dāmanaka.

original: de dag rigs sun pa'i sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag rigs sun pa'i sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They were guilty of the evil deed of disgracing their families.

original: gnas dang longs spyod gnyis kyi sgo nas rigs sun par byed do //
analyzed: gnas dang longs spyod gnyis kyi sgo nas rigs sun par byed do //
translated: They disgraced their families in two ways: by their dwelling and by their enjoyment.

original: de dag la gnas kyi sgo nas rigs sun pa ni bud med dang stegs gad rgyangs byed /
analyzed: de dag la gnas kyi sgo nas rigs sun pa ni bud med dang stegs gad rgyangs byed /
translated: By their dwelling they disgraced their families by living with women, laughing loudly,

original: 'dzum snyegs lus kyi snyogs shing stan gcig la 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzum snyegs lus kyi snyogs shing stan gcig la 'dug pa'o //
translated: smiling, touching their bodies, and sitting on the same seat.

original: de la longs spyod kyi sgo nas rigs sun pa ni bud med dang snod gcig gi nang du za /
analyzed: de la longs spyod kyi sgo nas rigs sun pa ni bud med dang snod gcig gi nang du za /
translated: By their enjoyment they disgraced their families by eating with women from the same dish,

original: phor bu gcig gi nang du 'thung /
analyzed: phor bu gcig gi nang du 'thung /
translated: drinking from the same cup,

original: glu len / rnga rdung /
analyzed: glu len / rnga rdung /
translated: singing, playing musical instruments,

original: gar byed / 'jong mo dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / bya gag dang / ngur ba lta bu'i skad 'byin de dag 'thab tu gzud /
analyzed: gar byed / 'jong mo dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / bya gag dang / ngur ba lta bu'i skad 'byin de dag 'thab tu gzud /
translated: They will fight, making sounds like those of a peacock, an elephant, a horse, a cock, or a goose.

original: de ltar rtse mo sna tshogs byed pas na /
analyzed: de ltar rtse mo sna tshogs byed pas na /
translated: Since they will engage in various kinds of play,🔽the people who live there will be unhappy and the families will be ruined.

original: de na gnas pa'i skye bo rnams mi dga' zhing rigs rnams sun pas na skye bo de dag kyang ma dad nas de na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams la yang bsod snyoms mi ster zhing yul gzhan du spong bar byed na glo bur du lhags pa la lta🔽zhig ci smos /
analyzed: de na gnas pa'i skye bo rnams mi dga' zhing rigs rnams sun pas na skye bo de dag kyang ma dad nas de na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams la yang bsod snyoms mi ster zhing yul gzhan du spong bar byed na glo bur du lhags pa la lta zhig ci smos /
translated: Since the people will have no faith, they will not give alms to the monks who live there, and they will be expelled to other lands.
What need is there to speak of the temporary visitors?

original: nas dus gzhan zhig na tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo yul snang ba can du ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba las de'i nub mo srin bu'i ri'i nags na gnas /
analyzed: nas dus gzhan zhig na tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo yul snang ba can du ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba las de'i nub mo srin bu'i ri'i nags na gnas /
translated: At another time, the venerable Ānanda was traveling through the country of Āpaṇa and that night he stayed in the forest on Worm Mountain.

original: nang bar grong khyer du bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang / bsod snyoms kyang ma rnyed lan kyang ma thob nas kun dga' bos bsams pa nyan thos byis pa mi mkhas pa mi gsal ba 'ga' zhig gis rigs kyi bu mo dag la kha ngan nam lus kyis kun du reg pa zhig byas so snyam du sems so //
analyzed: nang bar grong khyer du bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang / bsod snyoms kyang ma rnyed lan kyang ma thob nas kun dga' bos bsams pa nyan thos byis pa mi mkhas pa mi gsal ba 'ga' zhig gis rigs kyi bu mo dag la kha ngan nam lus kyis kun du reg pa zhig byas so snyam du sems so //
translated: When he went for alms in the city, he did not get any alms and was not even offered any. Ananda thought, Some ignorant, unskillful, unclear śrāvakas must have said something bad to the daughters of good families or touched them with their bodies.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos sngon chad srid bu ri'i grong khyer de 'byor pa dang rgyas pa dang / le logs pa dang / skye bo dad pa mang po dag dang ldan pas bsod snyoms dag kyang rnyed sla na da ci nyes zhes skye bo'i tshogs mdun ma pa lnga brgya tsam gyi nang du dris pa dang de'i nang na dge bsnyen chur 'jug ces bya bas dge slong tha skar la
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos sngon chad srid bu ri'i grong khyer de 'byor pa dang rgyas pa dang / le logs pa dang / skye bo dad pa mang po dag dang ldan pas bsod snyoms dag kyang rnyed sla na da ci nyes zhes skye bo'i tshogs mdun ma pa lnga brgya tsam gyi nang du dris pa dang de'i nang na dge bsnyen chur 'jug ces bya bas dge slong tha skar la
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda, who had previously seen that the city of Śrāvastī was prosperous, flourishing, and full of many faithful people, and where alms were easily obtained, asked the five hundred leading people in front of him, What is the problem now? Among them, the lay brother called Water Entry said, Bhikṣu Punarvasu

original: sogs pas rigs sun pa'i chos mang du byas so zhes kun dga' bo la rgyas par gsol to //
analyzed: sogs pas rigs sun pa'i chos mang du byas so zhes kun dga' bo la rgyas par gsol to //
translated: and so on, and so forth.🔽Ānanda reported this in detail to the Buddha.

original: kun dga' bo snyan du gsol nas bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: kun dga' bo snyan du gsol nas bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: dge slong gnas brtan dag dang / kun dga' bo nyid song la /
analyzed: dge slong gnas brtan dag dang / kun dga' bo nyid song la /
translated: “The elder monks and Ānanda himself should go

original: dge slong tha skar skyes dang / nab so gnyis la /
analyzed: dge slong tha skar skyes dang / nab so gnyis la /
translated: to the monks Aṣṭamaka and Revata

original: dge sbyong gi chos ma yin pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgo nas gling ba po'i dge slong gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis lam du bskos te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ma yin pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgo nas gling ba po'i dge slong gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis lam du bskos te /
translated: and, by means of a legal procedure of announcement and a legal procedure of asking for consent, appoint them as the monks who will expel the monks who are the instigators of various things that are not the Dharma of the ascetic.🔽“Then they should expel them.”🔽Then the monks Aṣṭamaka and Revata performed the act of banishment, and the monks Durāpāyaya and Lohitaka thought, “They will perform the act of banishment against us too,” and they fled to Śrāvastī.

original: de rnams bskrad par gyis shig ces bka' stsal nas de nas dge slong tha skra skyes dang / nab so gnyis po la spang ba'i las byas pa dang / dur khar dang dmar gyi dge slong bdag cag la yang bskrad pa'i las byed par 'ong gis mnyan du yod par bros te dong ngo zhes mnyan du yod par dong nas nyes pa rnam bshags shing mthol /
analyzed: de rnams bskrad par gyis shig ces bka' stsal nas de nas dge slong tha skra skyes dang / nab so gnyis po la spang ba'i las byas pa dang / dur khar dang dmar gyi dge slong bdag cag la yang bskrad pa'i las byed par 'ong gis mnyan du yod par bros te dong ngo zhes mnyan du yod par dong nas nyes pa rnam bshags shing mthol /
translated: They went to Śrāvastī and confessed and revealed their faults.

original: sems kyi rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyang yongs su bsdams nas dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa dang 'dra bar gnas so //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyang yongs su bsdams nas dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa dang 'dra bar gnas so //
translated: They also controlled the various thoughts in their minds and lived like monks who abide in their natural state.

original: tha skar skyes dang nam so gnyis kyang spang ba'i las byas pa dang / bdag cag kyang sa la bsgyel na slar yang sa la brten te ldang ba bzhin du bcom ldan 'das nyid la mthol zhing bshags na legs so snyam nas mthar gyis rgyu zhing mnyan du yod par phyin te /
analyzed: tha skar skyes dang nam so gnyis kyang spang ba'i las byas pa dang / bdag cag kyang sa la bsgyel na slar yang sa la brten te ldang ba bzhin du bcom ldan 'das nyid la mthol zhing bshags na legs so snyam nas mthar gyis rgyu zhing mnyan du yod par phyin te /
translated: The two, Aśvakī and Tiṣya, also performed the act of abandoning, and thought, If we were to fall to the ground, it would be good if we were to rely on the ground again and rise up, confessing to the Bhagavān himself. Thinking this, they gradually traveled and arrived at Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong gnas brtan dag dang dur khar dang dmar gyi dge slong dag dang phrad nas de na gnas pa'i dge slong gcig gis kyang bltar yang mi btub phyag kyang mi 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dge slong gnas brtan dag dang dur khar dang dmar gyi dge slong dag dang phrad nas de na gnas pa'i dge slong gcig gis kyang bltar yang mi btub phyag kyang mi 'tshal lo //
translated: They met with the elder monks and the monks of the Pāṁśula and Lohitaka groups. At that time, not even one of the resident monks was able to look at them or pay homage to them.

original: de gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis smras pa /
translated: The two said,

original: dge slong @60b gzhan ni yus na dur kha dang dmar gyi dge slong gnyis bdag cag dang 'dra bar nyes pa byed na ci ste bdag cag la mi smra zhes byas pa dang / bdag cag gis nyes pa sna tshogs byas te /
analyzed: dge slong @60b gzhan ni yus na dur kha dang dmar gyi dge slong gnyis bdag cag dang 'dra bar nyes pa byed na ci ste bdag cag la mi smra zhes byas pa dang / bdag cag gis nyes pa sna tshogs byas te /
translated: They said, We have committed various faults.

original: kun dga' bo dang / gnas zhes byas pa dang / de gnyis khros te bdag cag nyes pa 'dras kho na las kha cig ni bskrad kha cig ni ma bskrad pa las dge slong kun dga' bo la sogs pa kha cig ni 'dod chags kyi dbang du 'gro /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dang / gnas zhes byas pa dang / de gnyis khros te bdag cag nyes pa 'dras kho na las kha cig ni bskrad kha cig ni ma bskrad pa las dge slong kun dga' bo la sogs pa kha cig ni 'dod chags kyi dbang du 'gro /
translated: We have committed various faults, and the two became angry.  Some of us have been expelled and some not. Some monks such as Ananda and Sthavira have gone under the power of attachment.

original: kha cig ni zhe sdang gi dbang du 'gro /
analyzed: kha cig ni zhe sdang gi dbang du 'gro /
translated: Some have gone under the power of anger.

original: gti mug gi dbang du 'gro'o zhes 'dzer ba dang / dge slong rnams bdag cag gis nyes pa sna tshogs byas te /
analyzed: gti mug gi dbang du 'gro'o zhes 'dzer ba dang / dge slong rnams bdag cag gis nyes pa sna tshogs byas te /
translated: Some have gone under the power of delusion. The monks said, We have committed various faults.

original: kun dga' bo dang / gnas brtan dag gis gsol ba dang / zhu ba'i las kyis bskrad par shes bzhin du de skad 'dzer ces 'phya bzhin du snyan du gsal to //
analyzed: kun dga' bo dang / gnas brtan dag gis gsol ba dang / zhu ba'i las kyis bskrad par shes bzhin du de skad 'dzer ces 'phya bzhin du snyan du gsal to //
translated: Ananda and the elders, having asked and requested, knowing that he was to be expelled, said, “You are slandering us.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du smra ba dang gzhan yang 'di 'dra ba la dge 'dun rnams kyis tshig 'jam pos sgo shig ces rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du smra ba dang gzhan yang 'di 'dra ba la dge 'dun rnams kyis tshig 'jam pos sgo shig ces rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
translated: Then the Blessed One said, “Those who speak like this and others like them should be addressed by the Saṅgha with gentle words.” These are the root words.

original: rtsa ba'i tshig rnams kyis bzhams te bsgo yang gtong du ma btub na /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i tshig rnams kyis bzhams te bsgo yang gtong du ma btub na /
translated: “Even though addressed with gentle words, if he does not stop,

original: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa dang / lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo yang gtong du ma btub pa dang / de ltar gyur pa de'i phyir yang dge slong gang rigs sun pa'i chos byas na dge slong lhag mar 'gyur ro zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa dang / lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo yang gtong du ma btub pa dang / de ltar gyur pa de'i phyir yang dge slong gang rigs sun pa'i chos byas na dge slong lhag mar 'gyur ro zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: he should be addressed a second and a third time through the procedure of asking and requesting. If he still does not stop, then for that reason also, if a monk commits a root downfall, he becomes one who is defeated.” Thus he laid down a training rule for the monks.

original: dge slong dag ces bya ba ni tha skar skyes dang nas so gnyis te /
analyzed: dge slong dag ces bya ba ni tha skar skyes dang nas so gnyis te /
translated: The monks are the thirty-two beginning with Punarvasu.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The rest is similar.

original: mang po zhes bya ba ni dge slong gnyis yan chad la mang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mang po zhes bya ba ni dge slong gnyis yan chad la mang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The many are those who are more than two.

original: grong ngam grong rdal zhes bya ba ni srin bu ri'o //
analyzed: grong ngam grong rdal zhes bya ba ni srin bu ri'o //
translated: A village or town is a place where there are many houses.

original: de dag kyang rigs sun par byed ces bya ba ni rigs ni bram ze dang / khyim bdag gi rigs te /
analyzed: de dag kyang rigs sun par byed ces bya ba ni rigs ni bram ze dang / khyim bdag gi rigs te /
translated: They defame means that they defame the brahmin and householder families.

analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis kyis sun par byed de gnas dang longs spyod do //
translated: And that is done in two ways: by their dwelling and by their enjoyment.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: The visible is by the eye consciousness.

original: thos so zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: thos so zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas so //
translated: The heard is by the ear consciousness.

analyzed: rab tu shes zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i rtsam par shes pas so//
translated: The cognized is by the other consciousnesses.

original: sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod ces bya ba ni nyes pa sna tshogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod ces bya ba ni nyes pa sna tshogs byed pa'o //
translated: The evil dharmas are the various faults.

analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la zhugs pas so //
translated: The monks are those who have entered this Dharma.

analyzed: tshig 'di skad smros shig ces bya ba ni tshig 'jam pos bsgo ba'o //
translated: The words speak thus means to order with gentle words.

original: ji skad bsgo ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad bsgo ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As ordered means as before.

original: tshig 'jam pos bsgo na dngos po de gtong ba lta na ni zhes @61a * //
analyzed: tshig 'jam pos bsgo na dngos po de gtong ba lta na ni zhes @61a * //

analyzed: bya ba de ltar lta ba yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: means to give up that view.

analyzed: gal te mi gtong zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi 'dor ba'o //

analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bstan par bya ba ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bstan cing bsgo ba'o //

original: nyes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the fault?

original: dge slong rnams kyis spangs pa'i las byas par shes bzhin du de dag la 'dod pas zhe sdang gis gti mug gis 'jigs pas 'gro zhes zer na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //

translated: If, knowing that the monks have done the action of relinquishment, he says, out of desire, hatred, confusion, or fear, that they should go, in all cases it is an offense of wrong conduct.
