original: bskrad pa yang byas la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo na bsgo bar yang chud de nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bskrad pa yang byas la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo na bsgo bar yang chud de nyes pa med do //
translated: If he is expelled and then ordered by a legal procedure requiring a proposal and a single proclamation, there is no offense.🔽There is no offense if the monk is a beginner at this, and so on.

original: las dang po pa la sogs pa la nyes pa med do / bka' blo mi bde ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yul koo sh'amb'i dgra zin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: las dang po pa la sogs pa la nyes pa med do / bka' blo mi bde ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yul koo sh'amb'i dgra zin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The story of the unpleasant order: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the Kūtadhania shrine in the Kosalan country.

original: de'i tshe koo sh'amb'i na dge slong mos pa can la ltung ba byung nas chos bzhin du slar mi byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe koo sh'amb'i na dge slong mos pa can la ltung ba byung nas chos bzhin du slar mi byed de /
translated: At that time, a nun named Nandavali had committed an offense but did not make amends for it in accordance with the Teaching.

original: de ltung ba byung ba grogs po kha cig gis mthong nas grogs po phan par 'dod rnams kyis de la bskul zhing ltung ba shogs shig ces byas na /
analyzed: de ltung ba byung ba grogs po kha cig gis mthong nas grogs po phan par 'dod rnams kyis de la bskul zhing ltung ba shogs shig ces byas na /
translated: Some friends of hers saw that she had committed an offense and urged her, “Friend, make amends for your offense.”

original: su la ltung ba byung ba de slar byed grang ngas ni ltung ba ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: su la ltung ba byung ba de slar byed grang ngas ni ltung ba ma mthong ngo //
translated: But she said, “I don’t see any offense.”

original: khyed la ltung ba byung na gzhan du bshags te /
analyzed: khyed la ltung ba byung na gzhan du bshags te /
translated: “If you don’t see your offense, then confess it to someone else.

original: su mthong ba de ltung ba chos bzhin du bshags shing byed grang /
analyzed: su mthong ba de ltung ba chos bzhin du bshags shing byed grang /
translated: Confess it to anyone you see and make amends for it in accordance with the Teaching.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge yang rung /🔽sdig kyang rung cung zad kyang nga la ma smra shig / dge yang rung zhes bya ba ni dge ba la ma gzhug cig pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge yang rung / sdig kyang rung cung zad kyang nga la ma smra shig / dge yang rung zhes bya ba ni dge ba la ma gzhug cig pa'o //
translated: Venerable ones, do not speak to me at all,🔽whether it is good or bad.

original: sdig kyang rung zhes bya ba ni sdig pa las ma bzlog cig pa'o //
analyzed: sdig kyang rung zhes bya ba ni sdig pa las ma bzlog cig pa'o //
translated: “Do not speak to me, whether it is good or bad” means do not engage me in what is good or do not dissuade me from what is bad.

original: khyed rigs dang rus tha dad pa las rab tu byung ba 'dab ma rlung gis brdabs nas gcig tu @61b spungs pa dang 'dra ba khyed cag yin na /🔽nged kyi rigs las ni byang chub thob po zhes zer ba don nyung ba'i dge slong rnams 'phya ste bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis bsgo na /
analyzed: khyed rigs dang rus tha dad pa las rab tu byung ba 'dab ma rlung gis brdabs nas gcig tu @61b spungs pa dang 'dra ba khyed cag yin na / nged kyi rigs las ni byang chub thob po zhes zer ba don nyung ba'i dge slong rnams 'phya ste bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis bsgo na /
translated: “You have gone forth from different castes and clans, like leaves blown by the wind into a single heap.🔽We have attained awakening from our own caste.”

original: ngag mi nyan to zhes snyan du gsol to //
analyzed: ngag mi nyan to zhes snyan du gsol to //
translated: The monks who had few desires criticized him, saying, “He does not listen when we admonish him with the sūtras of the Well-Gone One.”🔽They reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong mos pa can dang gzhan yang de dag dang 'dra ba la bslab pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mos pa can dang gzhan yang de dag dang 'dra ba la bslab pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: “Monks, you should admonish the monk Sthūlanandana and others like him with the precepts included in the sūtras of the Well-Gone One.

original: zhes rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: zhes rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
translated: These are the root verses.

original: de ste yang ltung ba bshags su ma btub na gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ste yang ltung ba bshags su ma btub na gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: If he still does not confess the downfall, he should be admonished up to three times by a formal act with proposal.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo ste ma btub na nyes byas gcig dang / sbom po gsum dang dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur ro zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo ste ma btub na nyes byas gcig dang / sbom po gsum dang dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur ro zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: If he does not confess after being admonished up to three times, he commits one offense of wrong conduct, three serious offenses, and a partial defeat of the monastic community. Thus the training precept was formulated in the Monastic Law Code.

original: dge slong 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni mos pa can te gzhan yang de 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni mos pa can te gzhan yang de 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A certain monk” means a monk who is obstinate, and so on.

original: bka' blo mi bde ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni mthun pa dang rigs pa dang legs su dga' ste smras pa la nyan du mi btub cing log par 'dzin pa ni bka' blo mi bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bka' blo mi bde ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni mthun pa dang rigs pa dang legs su dga' ste smras pa la nyan du mi btub cing log par 'dzin pa ni bka' blo mi bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: “By nature disobedient” means that he is not obedient to the advice of others, and he does not listen to what is said in a way that is agreeable, appropriate, and beneficial. He is called “disobedient” because he holds on to his own views.

original: bstan par gtogs zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa bzhi nas rtsod pa zhi ba bdun gyi bar du ste /
analyzed: bstan par gtogs zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa bzhi nas rtsod pa zhi ba bdun gyi bar du ste /
translated: “Belonging to the doctrine” means from the four defeating offenses up to the seven methods for resolving disputes.

original: ltung ba'i ris lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba'i ris lnga la bya'o //
translated: It refers to the five classes of offenses.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'am mngon pa'i chos la bya'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'am mngon pa'i chos la bya'o //
translated: The phrase included in the sutras of the Well-Gone One refers to the teachings of the sutras and the Abhidharma.

original: dge yang rung zhes bya ba ni phan pa can no //
analyzed: dge yang rung zhes bya ba ni phan pa can no //
translated: The phrase even if it is virtuous means if it is beneficial.

original: dge slong rnams zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the monks refers to those who have entered this Dharma.

original: chos dang mthun zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang ma mo la bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang mthun zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang ma mo la bya'o //
translated: The phrase in accordance with the Dharma refers to the sutras and the Vinaya.

original: 'dul ba dang mthun zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba de nyid do //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang mthun zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba de nyid do //
translated: The phrase in accordance with the Vinaya refers to the Vinaya itself.

original: bsgo zhes bya ba ni chos dang 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: bsgo zhes bya ba ni chos dang 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du bsgo ba'o //
translated: The phrase to admonish means to admonish in accordance with the Dharma and the Vinaya.

original: khyed kyis bdag la bsgo bas chog gis zhes zer ba ni bka' blo mi bde ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis bdag la bsgo bas chog gis zhes zer ba ni bka' blo mi bde ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase you have admonished me enough means to remain disobedient.

original: dngos po de spang ba'i phyir tshig 'jam pos sgo shig ces bya ba ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las ni gong ma dag dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dngos po de spang ba'i phyir tshig 'jam pos sgo shig ces bya ba ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las ni gong ma dag dang 'dra'o //
translated: The phrase you should admonish with gentle words in order to abandon that thing means to request and to petition.

original: bstan pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis bsgo ste ma btub na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis bsgo ste ma btub na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is admonished by those included in the sutras of the Well-Gone One and does not comply, then in all cases it is a minor offense.

original: gsol ba dang zhu ba re re la yang sbom po re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsol ba dang zhu ba re re la yang sbom po re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: And for each request and each petition, there is a separate grave offense.

original: chos bzhin la ma tshogs pa dang / tshogs pa las chos kyi gzugs brnyan dang / chos ji lta ba dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du ma bsgo na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chos bzhin la ma tshogs pa dang / tshogs pa las chos kyi gzugs brnyan dang / chos ji lta ba dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du ma bsgo na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the assembly is not complete, or if the assembly is complete but the Dharma is not taught, or if the Dharma is taught but not in accordance with the Dharma, or if the Vinaya is not taught in accordance with the Vinaya.

original: dgu ni dang po dag nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni byung ma thag tu lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgu ni dang po dag nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni byung ma thag tu lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Nine are only at the beginning means that as soon as they occur, they are residual faults.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum bsgo nas lhag mar 'gyur ba ni dbyen dang rjes su phyogs pa dang / rigs sun pa @62a * //🔽dang bka' blo mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum bsgo nas lhag mar 'gyur ba ni dbyen dang rjes su phyogs pa dang / rigs sun pa @62a * // dang bka' blo mi bde ba'o //
translated: Residual faults after two or three admonitions are schism, siding with a schismatic, and censuring a monk.

original: de dag las gang yang rung zhes bya ba ni lhag ma bcu gsum po dag byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las gang yang rung zhes bya ba ni lhag ma bcu gsum po dag byung ba la bya'o //
translated: From among those, any one means that any of the thirteen residual faults have occurred.

original: ji srid du zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma byung nas ji srid du bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma byung nas ji srid du bcas pa'o //
translated: For as long as means for as long as the saṃgha’s residual faults have occurred.

original: ji srid du bcas pa de srid du chad pa byed du chug shig pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du bcas pa de srid du chad pa byed du chug shig pa'o //
translated: For as long as they have occurred, they should be made to be punished.

original: sems 'khrugs pa dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / mi dran pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sems 'khrugs pa dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / mi dran pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the mind is disturbed, if one is sick, or if one is not mindful.

original: gang zag de'i chad pa ni dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa dang / stan gcig la mi 'dug lhan cig mi 'chag khyim gcig na mi nyal /
analyzed: gang zag de'i chad pa ni dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa dang / stan gcig la mi 'dug lhan cig mi 'chag khyim gcig na mi nyal /
translated: The punishment for that person is that he should not sit on the same seat as a monk who is living in accordance with the Dharma, he should not walk with him, he should not lie down in the same room as him,

original: dge slong thams cad kyi 'jug tu gzhag / bsil yab g-yob pa dang lhung bzed bkru bar bya /
analyzed: dge slong thams cad kyi 'jug tu gzhag / bsil yab g-yob pa dang lhung bzed bkru bar bya /
translated: and he should not be given a fan or a washing bowl by any monk.

original: chad pa byas nas zhag drug gi bar du dge 'dun la mgu ba'i las bya'o //🔽ma bcabs na chad pa mi dgos te mgu bar zad do //
analyzed: chad pa byas nas zhag drug gi bar du dge 'dun la mgu ba'i las bya'o // ma bcabs na chad pa mi dgos te mgu bar zad do //
translated: After the punishment has been carried out, he should do pleasing actions for the community for six days.🔽If he does not conceal the offense, the punishment is not necessary, and he is satisfied.

original: chad pa byed du gzhug pa ni nga rgyal med pa dang bcas pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chad pa byed du gzhug pa ni nga rgyal med pa dang bcas pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is made to undergo the punishment because he has no pride and his offense is minor.

original: nang sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir yid mgu bar byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: nang sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir yid mgu bar byed du gzhug go //
translated: He is made to do pleasing actions in order to purify himself internally.

original: ltung ba las 'byin pa'i phyir 'byung bar gsol lo //
analyzed: ltung ba las 'byin pa'i phyir 'byung bar gsol lo //
translated: He requests absolution in order to be released from the offense.

original: dge 'dun la rag las zhes bya ba ni dbang yod pa'i don to //
analyzed: dge 'dun la rag las zhes bya ba ni dbang yod pa'i don to //
translated: It is said that he depends on the community because he is under their control.

original: dge slong nyi shu med ces bya ba ni grangs ma tshang na mi phyin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong nyi shu med ces bya ba ni grangs ma tshang na mi phyin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase without twenty bhikṣus means that if the number is not complete, it is not a going forth.

original: de ni 'du shes zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: The phrase that is the idea means a certainty.

original: yang na phyin pa'i dus 'dis zhes bya ba'i rgyu ste gzhung 'di la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na phyin pa'i dus 'dis zhes bya ba'i rgyu ste gzhung 'di la bya'o //
translated: Or, the phrase by this going forth is the reason, and this text is to be applied.

original: glengs shing dran par byas pa la bdag nyid bka' blo mi bde ba la gnas na nyes byas so //
analyzed: glengs shing dran par byas pa la bdag nyid bka' blo mi bde ba la gnas na nyes byas so //
translated: If one dwells in a state of mental unease without being reminded and made to remember, it is a minor offense.

original: ma glengs shing dran par ma bgyis par bdag nyid bka' blo mi bde ba la gnas na bsgo ba mi 'chags so //
analyzed: ma glengs shing dran par ma bgyis par bdag nyid bka' blo mi bde ba la gnas na bsgo ba mi 'chags so //
translated: If one dwells in a state of mental unease without being reminded and made to remember, it is not an acknowledgment of the admonition.

original: mtshams kyi nang rol nas bsgo 'am /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang rol nas bsgo 'am /
translated: Is it an admonition from within the boundary or from outside?

original: phyi rol nas bsgo 'am sa la 'dug ste nam mkha' la 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: phyi rol nas bsgo 'am sa la 'dug ste nam mkha' la 'jug pa'am /
translated: Is it an admonition from the sky while sitting on the ground, or

original: dge 'dun gyis dge 'dun longs pa la bsgo na bsgo bar mi chud do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis dge 'dun longs pa la bsgo na bsgo bar mi chud do //
translated: is it an admonition from the Saṅgha to the Saṅgha? It is not an acknowledgment of the admonition.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma bcu gsum mi brjed pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma bcu gsum mi brjed pa'i tshig go //
translated: The thirteen remaining Saṅgha offenses are the words of non-forgetting.

original: gnyis mi mngon pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnyis mi mngon pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The second obscure nidāna: The Blessed Buddha was dwelling in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na tshe dang ldan pa 'char ba po bsod snyoms las 'khor te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na tshe dang ldan pa 'char ba po bsod snyoms las 'khor te /
translated: At that time, the venerable Udayin was returning from his alms round in Śrāvastī.

original: khyim bdag gi chung ma sbed ma'i khyim du song ngo //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma sbed ma'i khyim du song ngo //
translated: He went to the house of the householder's wife Ghosa.

original: de stan bting ba la 'dug pa dang / sbed ma yang 'char ba la chos nyan pa'i phyir 'char ba dang stan gcig la pus mo sprad de skyabs yod pa na 'dug cing chos 'chad pa dge bsnyen ma sa gas mthong nas /
analyzed: de stan bting ba la 'dug pa dang / sbed ma yang 'char ba la chos nyan pa'i phyir 'char ba dang stan gcig la pus mo sprad de skyabs yod pa na 'dug cing chos 'chad pa dge bsnyen ma sa gas mthong nas /
translated: When he sat on the prepared seat, Ghosa also sat down with her knee to his knee on the same seat in the open, and he explained the Dharma. The laywoman Sthūlanandā saw this and thought,

original: de ltar ma dad pa rnams kyis mthong na ni dge sbyong gi chos ma yin pa zhig byed du gdon mi za'o zhes skur par yang @62b 'gyur na de lta bu mi mdzes pa nyan thos rnams la spangs pa'i phyir dge bsnyen ma des snyan du gsol to
analyzed: de ltar ma dad pa rnams kyis mthong na ni dge sbyong gi chos ma yin pa zhig byed du gdon mi za'o zhes skur par yang @62b 'gyur na de lta bu mi mdzes pa nyan thos rnams la spangs pa'i phyir dge bsnyen ma des snyan du gsol to
translated: If those without faith see this, they will surely say, 'Without a doubt, they are doing something that is not the Dharma of ascetics.' They will slander us.

original: // legs pa bcu gzigs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: // legs pa bcu gzigs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Seeing ten advantages, he said,

original: rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
analyzed: rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
translated: Having criticized in many ways,

original: yang dge slong gang zhes 'du la ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes 'du la ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: 'If any monk...' he established a training rule for the Sangha.

original: dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste /
translated: The monk is Upasena.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: bud med ces bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyad pa'i chos bzod pa'o //
analyzed: bud med ces bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyad pa'i chos bzod pa'o //
translated: A woman is one who consents to sexual intercourse.

original: lhan cig ces bya ba ni de dang lhan cig pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba ni de dang lhan cig pa'o //
translated: Together means with her.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyis so //
translated: Two means a man and a woman.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ni gang na skyes pa'am /
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ni gang na skyes pa'am /
translated: A secluded place means a place where there are no men,

original: bud med dam /
analyzed: bud med dam /
translated: women,

original: ma ning gzhan su yang med pa'o //🔽skyabs yod pa zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa 'am sab mo'am /
analyzed: ma ning gzhan su yang med pa'o // skyabs yod pa zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa 'am sab mo'am /
translated: or neuter persons.

original: yol bas bskyabs pa'o //
analyzed: yol bas bskyabs pa'o //
translated: A screened place means a place screened by a wall, a fence, a curtain,🔽or anything else.

original: stan la zhes bya ba ni stan gyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: stan la zhes bya ba ni stan gyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: A seat means any kind of seat.

original: 'dug ces bya ba ni 'dom gang gis 'khor ba na rkub bzhag cing 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dug ces bya ba ni 'dom gang gis 'khor ba na rkub bzhag cing 'dug pa'o //
translated: To sit means to sit down on the seat and to place one’s buttocks on the seat.

original: 'dod pa chog pa zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod du khom pa'i phyir chog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa chog pa zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod du khom pa'i phyir chog pa'o //
translated: To be satisfied with little means to be satisfied with the opportunity for sexual intercourse.

original: dge bsnyen ma'i tshig gis nges par bya ba ni bden pa bzhi la the tshom med cing rtogs la dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ba mngon par btul ba srog gi phyir yang brdzun du mi smra ba ni dge bsnyen ma yid ches pas zhes bya ba'o
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma'i tshig gis nges par bya ba ni bden pa bzhi la the tshom med cing rtogs la dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ba mngon par btul ba srog gi phyir yang brdzun du mi smra ba ni dge bsnyen ma yid ches pas zhes bya ba'o
translated: The meaning of the words of the lay vow holder is that one is a lay vow holder who has confidence in the four truths, who has realized them without doubt, who has gone for refuge to the Three Jewels, who is fully subdued, and who would not tell a lie even to save his life.🔽From among the three dharmas, any one.

original: // chos gsum las gang yang rung zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa dang lhag ma dang ltung ba ste /
analyzed: // chos gsum las gang yang rung zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa dang lhag ma dang ltung ba ste /
translated: The three are: the defeating offenses, the residual faults, and the downfalls.

original: de dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: From among those, any one.

original: dge slong bud med dang stan gcig la 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: dge slong bud med dang stan gcig la 'dug pa'am /
translated: A monk sitting on the same seat as a woman,

original: chang 'thung ba'am /
analyzed: chang 'thung ba'am /
translated: drinking alcohol,

original: gong du smos pa gsum las gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: gong du smos pa gsum las gang yang rung ste /
translated: or any one of the three mentioned above.

original: sdig pa'i las su byed pa cung zad cig mthong ngo zhes dge bsnyen ma smra na de dag las gang dge slong gis khas len pa byed du chug shig ces byed du bcug pa ni ltung ba bshags shing byed du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las su byed pa cung zad cig mthong ngo zhes dge bsnyen ma smra na de dag las gang dge slong gis khas len pa byed du chug shig ces byed du bcug pa ni ltung ba bshags shing byed du gzhug pa'o //
translated: If a lay vow holder says, “I have seen you commit a slight sinful action,” then the monk should confess the downfall and be made to do penance for any one of those that the monk admits to having done.

original: 'di ni ma nges pa'i chos so zhes bya ba ni chos de dag gtan la ma phebs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma nges pa'i chos so zhes bya ba ni chos de dag gtan la ma phebs pa'o //
translated: The phrase this is an indeterminate phenomenon means that those phenomena are not ascertained.

original: de la nyes pa ni dge bsnyen yid ches pa'i tshig gis gang dang gang glengs pa de dang de byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: de la nyes pa ni dge bsnyen yid ches pa'i tshig gis gang dang gang glengs pa de dang de byed du gzhug go //
translated: The phrase in regard to that, the fault means that the layperson is to be made to confess whatever he has been accused of.

original: de ste khas mi len na gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis nyes pa'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gsol cig / nyes pa mthong na khas mi len na nyes pa'i ngo bo nyid tshol ba'i dge slong gis chad pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya /
analyzed: de ste khas mi len na gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis nyes pa'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gsol cig / nyes pa mthong na khas mi len na nyes pa'i ngo bo nyid tshol ba'i dge slong gis chad pa rab tu dbyung bar mi bya /
translated: If he does not confess, then the monk who is investigating the nature of the fault should request that the layperson be questioned and that he be made to confess. If he still does not confess, then the monk who is investigating the nature of the fault should not impose a penalty on him.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par mi bya /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par mi bya /
translated: He should not give him the full ordination.🔽He should not make him attend on a novice monk.

original: dge tshul g-yog byed du mi gzhug / mtshams kyi nang na dge slong tshul khrims nyams sam /
analyzed: dge tshul g-yog byed du mi gzhug / mtshams kyi nang na dge slong tshul khrims nyams sam /
translated: If there is a monk in the community who has violated his ethical discipline,

original: lta ba nyams @63a * //
analyzed: lta ba nyams @63a * //
translated: who has violated his view,🔽who has violated his livelihood,

original: pa 'am / 'tsho ba nyams pa 'am /
analyzed: pa 'am / 'tsho ba nyams pa 'am /
translated: or who has violated his ethical discipline, view, or livelihood,

original: spyod lam nyams pa la ma gleng shig / dran par ma byed cig / lung ston pa 'am 'doms su ma gzhug shig /'dul ba 'dzin pa'i dge slong yod na dge 'dun gyi dbus su 'dul ba ma 'chad cig / gso sbyong dang tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe
analyzed: spyod lam nyams pa la ma gleng shig / dran par ma byed cig / lung ston pa 'am 'doms su ma gzhug shig /'dul ba 'dzin pa'i dge slong yod na dge 'dun gyi dbus su 'dul ba ma 'chad cig / gso sbyong dang tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe
translated: If there is a monk who upholds the Vinaya, do not recite the Vinaya in the midst of the Saṅgha.🔽When the Poṣadha and the Upoṣadha are held,🔽do not let him participate in the recitation or the ritual.

original: / gsol ba dang las kyi nang du ma gzhug cig / de kun byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / gsol ba dang las kyi nang du ma gzhug cig / de kun byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do all of that, it becomes a minor offense.

original: ma nges pa gnyis pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khang na bzhugs so //
analyzed: ma nges pa gnyis pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khang na bzhugs so //
translated: The nidāna of the second undetermined [case] is this. The Bhagavān was staying in the king's palace.

original: de'i tshe dge slong ri bo dang khyim bdag gi chung ma nyes sman gnyis 'dod pa ni mi chog par stan la 'dug pa dge bsnyen ma legs skyes mas mthong ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong ri bo dang khyim bdag gi chung ma nyes sman gnyis 'dod pa ni mi chog par stan la 'dug pa dge bsnyen ma legs skyes mas mthong ste /
translated: At that time, the monk Girika and the householder's wife Dūṣikā were sitting on the same seat, and the laywoman Sujātā saw them.

original: de ltar gyur pa snyan du gsol nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa snyan du gsol nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Having reported what had happened, a rule of training in the Vinaya was established.

original: 'dod pa chog par bya ba'i nyes pa de med de phas pham par mi 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: 'dod pa chog par bya ba'i nyes pa de med de phas pham par mi 'gyur bas na /
translated: Since there is no fault of being satisfied with desire, it does not become a defeating offense.

original: chog gnyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chog gnyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Two” refers to the two downfalls of the monk and nun.

original: gnyis ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dang ltung ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dang ltung ba ste /
translated: The two downfalls of the monk and nun are the two that are mentioned in the root text.

original: de dag gang gis gleng ba de byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: de dag gang gis gleng ba de byed du gzhug go //
translated: The one who accuses another of these two downfalls should be made to do the duties.

original: ma nges pa ni snga ma gcig pur ma zad kyi 'di yang ma nges pa'i chos yin pas na gtan la ma phab pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni snga ma gcig pur ma zad kyi 'di yang ma nges pa'i chos yin pas na gtan la ma phab pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “indeterminate” is not only the previous one, but also this one is an indeterminate phenomenon, so it is the meaning of “not determined.”🔽The fourth recitation of the Pratimokṣa Sūtra is the words of not forgetting.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa bzhi pa mi brjed pa'i tshig go / spang ba'i ltung byed las brtsams te 'chang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa bzhi pa mi brjed pa'i tshig go / spang ba'i ltung byed las brtsams te 'chang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The basis for the accusation of a partial defeat is that the Blessed One was dwelling in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe dge slong dag de lta bu'i gos mang por gyur te gos la longs spyod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong dag de lta bu'i gos mang por gyur te gos la longs spyod de /
translated: At that time, the monks had many such robes and used them as clothing.

original: gtsug lag khang chag chag gdab pa la sogs pa las sna re byed kyang gos lan re brje zhing gon nas kha ton dang lung dbog pa dang / bsam gtan byed pa'i bar chad du gyur nas /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang chag chag gdab pa la sogs pa las sna re byed kyang gos lan re brje zhing gon nas kha ton dang lung dbog pa dang / bsam gtan byed pa'i bar chad du gyur nas /
translated: Even if they did one task such as sprinkling water in the temple, they changed their robes and put on another, and this became an obstacle to reciting the scriptures, giving oral transmissions, and practicing concentration.

original: dge slong rnams kyis snyan du gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis snyan du gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this to the Buddha.

original: de'i tshe sman pa'i rgyal po 'tsho byed kyis ras bzang po gcig sangs rgyas la yon du phul nas kun dga' bo la chos gos su drubs shig ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe sman pa'i rgyal po 'tsho byed kyis ras bzang po gcig sangs rgyas la yon du phul nas kun dga' bo la chos gos su drubs shig ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: At that time, the king of physicians, Jivaka, offered a fine cloth to the Buddha as a gift and requested, Please have Ananda sew it into a Dharma robe.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gos gsum du drubs pa dang lhag ste kun dga' bo nyid dang / sras r'a hu la gnyis kyi yang stod g-yogs gnyis dang lnga longs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gos gsum du drubs pa dang lhag ste kun dga' bo nyid dang / sras r'a hu la gnyis kyi yang stod g-yogs gnyis dang lnga longs so //
translated: The Buddha had three Dharma robes sewn, and there was an extra. He had two upper robes sewn for Ananda and his son Rahula, making a total of five.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das lo sar gyi lhags pa che ba'i yul aa la byir zhes bya bar gshegs nas de'i nub mo srod la ni chos gos lnga pa gsol to /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das lo sar gyi lhags pa che ba'i yul aa la byir zhes bya bar gshegs nas de'i nub mo srod la ni chos gos lnga pa gsol to /
translated: Then the Blessed One went to the country of Alavi, where the winter winds were strong. That night, in the first watch, he put on the five-piece Dharma robe.

original: des kyang mi thub ste grang bar gyur nas gung la chos gos bdun pa gsol to //
analyzed: des kyang mi thub ste grang bar gyur nas gung la chos gos bdun pa gsol to //
translated: That was not enough, and it became cold. In the middle watch, he put on the seven-piece Dharma robe.

original: des kyang mi thub nas tho rangs chos gos sbyar ma gsol na lhags pa thub pa dang / nga lta bu sha mdangs 'jam @63b zhing gzhon pa yang chos gos gsum gyis chog na /
analyzed: des kyang mi thub nas tho rangs chos gos sbyar ma gsol na lhags pa thub pa dang / nga lta bu sha mdangs 'jam @63b zhing gzhon pa yang chos gos gsum gyis chog na /
translated: If that does not work, then at dawn he should put on his combined cloak and that will keep out the cold.🔽If even someone like me, with smooth, tender skin, can get by with just the three robes, then why can’t you?

original: khyed la des cis mi chog ces 'dod pa chung ba dang mgu sla ba dang / yo byad nyung dus chog pa dang / nyung du la sogs pa'i bsngags pa brjod de /
analyzed: khyed la des cis mi chog ces 'dod pa chung ba dang mgu sla ba dang / yo byad nyung dus chog pa dang / nyung du la sogs pa'i bsngags pa brjod de /
translated: He should praise having few desires, being easily satisfied, and being content with few possessions.

original: dge slong gos mang du 'chang zhing yo byad mang po la chags pa la rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
analyzed: dge slong gos mang du 'chang zhing yo byad mang po la chags pa la rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
translated: He should criticize the monk who has many possessions and is attached to many things in many ways.🔽Then he should say, “A monk whose robes are finished and who has taken out the lining should make the three robes.”

original: yang dge slong chos gos zin te gtan pa phyung nas chos gos gsum bcos shig ces 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so /
analyzed: yang dge slong chos gos zin te gtan pa phyung nas chos gos gsum bcos shig ces 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so /
translated: He should establish a rule for training in the Monastic Law.

original: de ltar bslab pa bcas pa dang / khyim bdag gcig gis kun dga' bo la bdag gis snga mo zhig nas btsun pa 'od srungs chen po lha dang mi'i mchod pa'i gnas de la bdag gis bshos dang gos shig gsol bar bgyi ba las bdag cag khyim pa las kyis brel te phyag tu ma phul
analyzed: de ltar bslab pa bcas pa dang / khyim bdag gcig gis kun dga' bo la bdag gis snga mo zhig nas btsun pa 'od srungs chen po lha dang mi'i mchod pa'i gnas de la bdag gis bshos dang gos shig gsol bar bgyi ba las bdag cag khyim pa las kyis brel te phyag tu ma phul
translated: The householder said to Ananda, I have long wanted to offer food and clothing to the Venerable Mahakasyapa, who is an object of worship for gods and men. But we householders are busy with work and have not been able to offer it to him.

original: na 'di tsam zhig kun dga' bos 'od srungs chen po la dbul bar gsol zhes byas pa dang / kun dga' bos bsams pa dang / bdag gis blangs na ni bslab pa dang yang 'gal /
analyzed: na 'di tsam zhig kun dga' bos 'od srungs chen po la dbul bar gsol zhes byas pa dang / kun dga' bos bsams pa dang / bdag gis blangs na ni bslab pa dang yang 'gal /
translated: Please offer this much to Mahakasyapa. Ananda thought, If I accept it, it will contradict the precepts.

original: ma blangs na ni 'od srungs chen po'i rnyed pa yang nyams la khyim bdag kyang bsod nams mi thob na bdag gis blangs te snyan du gsol lo snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: ma blangs na ni 'od srungs chen po'i rnyed pa yang nyams la khyim bdag kyang bsod nams mi thob na bdag gis blangs te snyan du gsol lo snyam du bsams nas /
translated: If I do not accept it, Mahakasyapa's gain will be lost, and the householder will not obtain merit. I will accept it and offer it to him.

original: blangs te gsol ba dang rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: blangs te gsol ba dang rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: He accepted it and offered it, and it was approved.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa la nan tan byed pa dang / gus pa'i yon tan brjod nas yang dge slong gang chos gos zin ces bya ba la sogs pa rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa la nan tan byed pa dang / gus pa'i yon tan brjod nas yang dge slong gang chos gos zin ces bya ba la sogs pa rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
translated: Then, the Bhagavān, having spoken of the qualities of being diligent in the precepts and being respectful, again said, “Monks, if one’s robe is finished,” and so on, the words of the root text.

original: chos gos zin ces bya ba ni dge slong gi chos gos bkru ba dang dra ba dang drub pa dang kha dog bsgyur ba la sogs pa zin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos zin ces bya ba ni dge slong gi chos gos bkru ba dang dra ba dang drub pa dang kha dog bsgyur ba la sogs pa zin pa la bya'o //
translated: “If one’s robe is finished” means that the monk’s robe has been washed, darned, sewn, dyed, and so on.

original: gtan pa phyung zhes bya ba ni tshul du zhugs pa'i dge 'dun rnams tshul nas 'byung ste tshul nas 'byung ba'i yon tan gtan pa drub pa yin pas na gtan pa drubs dang / zhag bcu las 'das kyang spang pa'i ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gtan pa phyung zhes bya ba ni tshul du zhugs pa'i dge 'dun rnams tshul nas 'byung ste tshul nas 'byung ba'i yon tan gtan pa drub pa yin pas na gtan pa drubs dang / zhag bcu las 'das kyang spang pa'i ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: “If the rainy season retreat has been entered” means that the Saṅgha that has entered the proper conduct has emerged from the proper conduct. Since the quality of emerging from the proper conduct is the sewing of the rainy season retreat, it is called “sewing the rainy season retreat.” Therefore, even if ten days have passed, there is no offense of discarding.

original: gtan pa ma drubs sam gtan pa phyung ba'i tshe zhag bcu las 'das na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gtan pa ma drubs sam gtan pa phyung ba'i tshe zhag bcu las 'das na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: If the rainy season retreat has not been sewn or if the rainy season retreat has been unsewn, then if ten days have passed, there is an offense of discarding.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //🔽zhag bcu las 'das te /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o // zhag bcu las 'das te /
translated: “Bhikṣus” means many bhikṣus.🔽“More than ten days” means more than eleven days.

original: zhag bcu gcig gi skya rengs shar na spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhag bcu gcig gi skya rengs shar na spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Having passed” means having gone beyond.

original: gos lhag ces bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa las lhag pa'o //
analyzed: gos lhag ces bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa las lhag pa'o //
translated: “Extra robe” means a robe other than the three robes.

original: rung ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni rung bar ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni rung bar ma byas pa'o //
translated: “Not allowable” means not having made it allowable.

original: chongs shig ces bya ba ni bdag gir bya ba'o //
analyzed: chongs shig ces bya ba ni bdag gir bya ba'o //
translated: “Keep” means to possess.

original: de las 'das par bcangs na ni zhes bya ba ni zhag bcu las thal @64a * //
analyzed: de las 'das par bcangs na ni zhes bya ba ni zhag bcu las thal @64a * //
translated: “Having kept it more than that” means having gone beyond ten days.

original: ba'o // spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o /
analyzed: ba'o // spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o /
translated: “A downfall requiring relinquishment and confession” means that having relinquished the object, one must confess the downfall.

original: de la nyes pa ni dge slong gis gos shig rnyed na zhag bcu tshun chad du byin gyis brlab par bya /🔽spang bar bya /
analyzed: de la nyes pa ni dge slong gis gos shig rnyed na zhag bcu tshun chad du byin gyis brlab par bya / spang bar bya /
translated: The offense is this: if a bhikṣu obtains a robe, he should consecrate it within ten days.🔽He should relinquish it.

original: rung bar bya /
analyzed: rung bar bya /
translated: He should make it allowable.

original: gzhan la sbyin par bya /
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par bya /
translated: He should give it to another.

original: de ltar ma byas na zhag bcu gcig gi skya rengs shar na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na zhag bcu gcig gi skya rengs shar na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not do that, at dawn on the eleventh day, he commits a downfall.

original: ltung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po ma bshags sam /
analyzed: ltung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po ma bshags sam /
translated: If the object of the downfall has not been confessed,

original: bral bar ma byas sam ma spangs na de tshun chad dge slong gis yo byad ji snyed rnyed pa de thams cad spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bral bar ma byas sam ma spangs na de tshun chad dge slong gis yo byad ji snyed rnyed pa de thams cad spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or if it has not been relinquished, or if it has not been abandoned, then all the articles that the monk has obtained since the downfall occurred are to be relinquished.

original: zhag bcu ma lon yang spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba yod de /
analyzed: zhag bcu ma lon yang spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba yod de /
translated: There are cases where the downfall is to be relinquished even though ten days have not passed.

original: snga ma zhag bcu 'das pa'i rgyun gyis spang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma zhag bcu 'das pa'i rgyun gyis spang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The downfall is to be relinquished by the continuation of the previous ten-day period.

original: spang bar bya ba'i gos de chus khyer ram mes tshig na spang du med pas nyes pa bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i gos de chus khyer ram mes tshig na spang du med pas nyes pa bshags par bya'o //
translated: If the relinquished robe is carried away by water or is burned by fire, it need not be relinquished, but the fault must be confessed.

original: gos rnyed ma thag tu dge slong sems 'khrugs sam /
analyzed: gos rnyed ma thag tu dge slong sems 'khrugs sam /
translated: If, immediately after obtaining a robe, the monk becomes mentally disturbed

original: nad kyis gzir nas mi dran par gyur nas /
analyzed: nad kyis gzir nas mi dran par gyur nas /
translated: or is afflicted by illness and becomes unconscious,

original: nam de'i sems rnyed pa nas zhag bcu ba grang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nam de'i sems rnyed pa nas zhag bcu ba grang bar bya'o //
translated: then the ten-day period begins anew from the time he regains his senses.

original: gos mang po zhig sngags kyis ma btab byin gyis ma brlabs par nam 'tsho ba'i bar du 'chang yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod do //
analyzed: gos mang po zhig sngags kyis ma btab byin gyis ma brlabs par nam 'tsho ba'i bar du 'chang yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod do //
translated: There are cases where, if many robes are obtained, they need not be relinquished even if they are kept for the rest of one’s life without being consecrated with the appropriate mantra.

original: nyi ma re re zhing gos las slar phyung zhing gzhan la byin gyis rlob pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma re re zhing gos las slar phyung zhing gzhan la byin gyis rlob pa'o //
translated: Every day he took out some of the cloth and gave it to others to bless.

original: zhag bcu las 'das kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /🔽gos kyi rgyu rung la spun mi rung ba'am /
analyzed: zhag bcu las 'das kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod de / gos kyi rgyu rung la spun mi rung ba'am /
translated: There is also a case where one does not incur an offense even if one keeps the cloth more than ten days.🔽The cloth is suitable, but the wool is not.

original: rgyu dang spun gnyis ka mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang spun gnyis ka mi rung ba ste /
translated: Both the cloth and the wool are not suitable.

original: mi rung ba ni rnga mo'i bal dang / ba lang dang / ra dang / ri dags kyi bal dang 'dres pa ni zhag bcu las 'das kyang ltung ba med de nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rung ba ni rnga mo'i bal dang / ba lang dang / ra dang / ri dags kyi bal dang 'dres pa ni zhag bcu las 'das kyang ltung ba med de nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: The unsuitable wool is that of a camel, cow, goat, or deer. If one keeps the cloth more than ten days, one does not incur an offense, but a minor offense.

original: zhag bcus ltung bar 'gyur ba'i tshe gcig tu bcangs kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba yod do //
analyzed: zhag bcus ltung bar 'gyur ba'i tshe gcig tu bcangs kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba yod do //
translated: There is a case where one does not incur an offense even if one keeps the cloth more than ten days.

original: zhag bcu tshun chad kyis dus las 'das pa'o //🔽zhag bcu ma lon pa la zhag bcu lon par 'du shes sam /
analyzed: zhag bcu tshun chad kyis dus las 'das pa'o // zhag bcu ma lon pa la zhag bcu lon par 'du shes sam /
translated: The time limit is exceeded by more than ten days.🔽If one keeps the cloth more than ten days, but thinks that it has been less than ten days,

original: zhag bcu lon pa na ma lon par 'du shes pa ni thams cad kyang nyes byas so //
analyzed: zhag bcu lon pa na ma lon par 'du shes pa ni thams cad kyang nyes byas so //
translated: or if one thinks that it has been ten days, but it has been less than ten days, one commits a minor offense.

original: gtan pa ni bting yang zhag bcu las 'das pa'i nyes pa yod de /
analyzed: gtan pa ni bting yang zhag bcu las 'das pa'i nyes pa yod de /
translated: Even if one spreads out the mat, there is an offense if one keeps it more than ten days.

original: dge slong gis gos spang bar bya ba ma spangs ma bshags par dge 'dun gyi gtan pa bting ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis gos spang bar bya ba ma spangs ma bshags par dge 'dun gyi gtan pa bting ba'o //
translated: A monk who has not abandoned or confessed the abandonment of a robe spreads out a mat belonging to the community.

original: dge slong la ltung bar 'gyur bde bzhin du dge slong ma dang bslab pa byin pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong la ltung bar 'gyur bde bzhin du dge slong ma dang bslab pa byin pa la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as there is an offense for a monk, so it is for a nun and for one who has received the preliminary ordination.

original: 'bral pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'bral pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The basis of the rule concerning separation is this. The Blessed Buddha was staying at Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong dag mang zhig rnyed par gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong dag mang zhig rnyed par gyur nas /
translated: At that time, many monks had acquired robes.

original: gos 'khru ba dang / dra ba dang / drub pa dang / kha dog bsgyur ba la sogs pa'i las byas nas pa dang / kha dog bsgyur ba la sogs pa'i las byas nas @64b tshang thur gyi nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: gos 'khru ba dang / dra ba dang / drub pa dang / kha dog bsgyur ba la sogs pa'i las byas nas pa dang / kha dog bsgyur ba la sogs pa'i las byas nas @64b tshang thur gyi nang du bcug ste /
translated: They washed the robes, sewed them, dyed them, and so on.

original: dge slong gzhi na gnas pa rnams la bcol nas /
analyzed: dge slong gzhi na gnas pa rnams la bcol nas /
translated: They put them in a bag and entrusted them to the monks who were staying there.

original: gzhi na gnas pa rnams kyang gos skem pa dang / sdud cing sbed pa dag byed pas lung dpog pa dang klog pa'i bar chad du yang gyur la bdag cag ljongs rgyur dong ba rnams kyang stong g-yogs dang smad g-yogs nyi tshe gyon zhing 'gro bas na /🔽gos kyis ma g-yogs pa snang zhing mi mdzes par gyur pas /
analyzed: gzhi na gnas pa rnams kyang gos skem pa dang / sdud cing sbed pa dag byed pas lung dpog pa dang klog pa'i bar chad du yang gyur la bdag cag ljongs rgyur dong ba rnams kyang stong g-yogs dang smad g-yogs nyi tshe gyon zhing 'gro bas na / gos kyis ma g-yogs pa snang zhing mi mdzes par gyur pas /
translated: We who were traveling had to go about wearing only our upper and lower robes.🔽The Buddha laid down a training rule that said, “You should not be without your robes.”

original: yang dge slong gang dag chos gos dang 'bral du mi rung ngo zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dag chos gos dang 'bral du mi rung ngo zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Buddha allowed monks to be without their robes in the following cases.

original: de la rjes su gnang ba ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs te de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab kyi sde chen po'i phug na 'od srungs chen po gnas te /
analyzed: de la rjes su gnang ba ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs te de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab kyi sde chen po'i phug na 'od srungs chen po gnas te /
translated: The Buddha was staying at Rājagṛha when Mahākāśyapa was staying in a cave in the Great Range.

original: bco lnga dang bcu bzhi'i gso sbyong rgyal po'i khab kyi dge 'dun dang lhan cig byed do //
analyzed: bco lnga dang bcu bzhi'i gso sbyong rgyal po'i khab kyi dge 'dun dang lhan cig byed do //
translated: He was observing the poṣadha ceremony on the fourteenth and fifteenth days of the month together with the saṅgha of Rājagṛha.

original: de nas bco lnga'i gso sbyong gi dus kyi tshe /
analyzed: de nas bco lnga'i gso sbyong gi dus kyi tshe /
translated: On the occasion of the poṣadha ceremony on the fifteenth day of the month,

original: 'od srungs chen po gso sbyong la song song ba dang / chu bo dbyar bzangs 'brub nas chos gos sbyar ma la sogs pa yang gsher te /
analyzed: 'od srungs chen po gso sbyong la song song ba dang / chu bo dbyar bzangs 'brub nas chos gos sbyar ma la sogs pa yang gsher te /
translated: and the river Bhadra­putrā had flooded, carrying away his robes and so on.

original: de'i skam srad la ring mo zhig thogs pas gso sbyong sar phyis par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i skam srad la ring mo zhig thogs pas gso sbyong sar phyis par gyur to //
translated: He was left with only his under robe for a long time, and so he was late in returning to the observance-day ceremony.

original: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
translated: When this happened, the monks reported it to the Blessed One.

original: 'od srungs rgas thug pa dang / sh'a ri'i sras po rlung nad can la sogs pa chos gos dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur bar dge 'dun gyi sdom pa byin cig ces sngom pa gnang ngo //
analyzed: 'od srungs rgas thug pa dang / sh'a ri'i sras po rlung nad can la sogs pa chos gos dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur bar dge 'dun gyi sdom pa byin cig ces sngom pa gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, give the monk Kāśyapa the saṃnāsa ordination, so that he will not be separated from his robes.

original: chos gos zin gtan pa phyung zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chos gos zin gtan pa phyung zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: “ ‘The end of the period for the robe’ means as above.

original: nub gcig ces bya ba ni zhag gcig skya rengs shar na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nub gcig ces bya ba ni zhag gcig skya rengs shar na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‘One night’ means that if the dawn breaks, there is an offense.

original: chos gos gsum zhes bya ba ni sbyar ma dang / bdun pa dang lnga pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos gsum zhes bya ba ni sbyar ma dang / bdun pa dang lnga pa'o //
translated: ‘The three robes’ means the sewn robe, the seven-piece robe, and the five-piece robe.

original: chos gos gzhan na 'dug la dge slong mtshams kyi nang na 'dug na skya rengs shar na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gos gzhan na 'dug la dge slong mtshams kyi nang na 'dug na skya rengs shar na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the extra robe is in another place, and the monk is within the boundaries, then at dawn it becomes a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: dge 'dun gyis chos gos byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis chos gos byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: If the Saṅgha has consecrated the robe,

original: nub gcig mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral na nyes pa bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: nub gcig mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral na nyes pa bshags par bya'o //
translated: and the monk is outside the boundaries for one night, he should confess the offense.

original: gos kyi dngos po ni spang mi dgos so //
analyzed: gos kyi dngos po ni spang mi dgos so //
translated: The robe itself does not need to be relinquished.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol na chos gos bzhag ste /🔽dge slong mtshams kyi nang na 'dug gam /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol na chos gos bzhag ste / dge slong mtshams kyi nang na 'dug gam /
translated: If the robe is outside the boundaries,🔽and the monk is within the boundaries,

original: dge slong nam mkha' la gnas te /
analyzed: dge slong nam mkha' la gnas te /
translated: or if the monk is in the sky,

original: chos gos sa la 'dug ste /
analyzed: chos gos sa la 'dug ste /
translated: and the robe is on the ground,

original: bar du skya rengs kyis chod na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar du skya rengs kyis chod na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the dawn breaks while they are separated by an intervening space, it becomes a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: dge slong khyim gcig pa'i gnas shig na gnas nas chos gos nang na kun bzhag pa'am /
analyzed: dge slong khyim gcig pa'i gnas shig na gnas nas chos gos nang na kun bzhag pa'am /
translated: If a monk is staying in a house, and he stores his extra robe inside the house,

original: khyim gyi phyi rol du 'dom gang tshun chad mi dag 'dug pa ni spang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim gyi phyi rol du 'dom gang tshun chad mi dag 'dug pa ni spang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or outside the house within an arm’s reach, he does not commit a downfall.

original: yang na khyim de'i yos rdo ba dang phye @65a * //
analyzed: yang na khyim de'i yos rdo ba dang phye @65a * //
translated: If the house is made of stone, or of flour,

original: 'thag pa dang / khye'u sus za ba dang / skom 'thung ba'i gnas de dag ni bdag gi 'dug gnas te nang du skya rengs shar na yang spang ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thag pa dang / khye'u sus za ba dang / skom 'thung ba'i gnas de dag ni bdag gi 'dug gnas te nang du skya rengs shar na yang spang ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the place where one sleeps is the same place where one’s robes are stored, or where one eats, or where one drinks, or where one stores one’s begging bowl, then even if the dawn breaks while one is away, there is no offense.

original: nang ngam 'dug gnas su chos gos bzhag ste /
analyzed: nang ngam 'dug gnas su chos gos bzhag ste /
translated: If one stores one’s robes in a house or a temple,

original: bdag nyid gzhan na 'dug na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan na 'dug na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but one is staying elsewhere, there is an offense.

original: grong gnyis pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: grong gnyis pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to a second village.

original: shing thags kyis bskor ba'i grong na 'dug na ni nang kun dang phyi rol 'dom gang tshun chad chos gos bzhag la bdag kyang nang na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing thags kyis bskor ba'i grong na 'dug na ni nang kun dang phyi rol 'dom gang tshun chad chos gos bzhag la bdag kyang nang na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is staying in a village surrounded by a fence, then if one stores one’s robes anywhere within the village, and one is also within the village, there is no offense.

original: de las 'das na nyes pa nyid do //🔽grong rtsig pas bskor ba'i 'dug gnas na dang phyi rol 'dom gang tshun chad dam /
analyzed: de las 'das na nyes pa nyid do // grong rtsig pas bskor ba'i 'dug gnas na dang phyi rol 'dom gang tshun chad dam /
translated: But if one goes beyond that, there is an offense.🔽If one is staying in a house or temple surrounded by a wall, then if one stores one’s robes anywhere within a distance of one armspan outside the wall,

original: ba lang 'gro ba'i mig rdul grar reg pa'am /
analyzed: ba lang 'gro ba'i mig rdul grar reg pa'am /
translated: or if one stores them in a place where cattle can reach them,🔽or if one stores them in a place where dust can reach them,

original: mi rang bzhin gyis ngo tsha shes pa'i bshang gci tshun chad ni 'dug gnas te 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rang bzhin gyis ngo tsha shes pa'i bshang gci tshun chad ni 'dug gnas te 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The natural shame of a man is his toilet, and he does not leave it.

original: de las 'das na 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las 'das na 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he goes beyond it, he leaves it.

original: 'obs kyis bskor ba ni de nyid 'dug gnas te /
analyzed: 'obs kyis bskor ba ni de nyid 'dug gnas te /
translated: The moat is the toilet, and he does not leave it.

original: bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he goes beyond it, he leaves it.

original: grong gcig pa'i 'dug gnas gcig gang zhe na /
analyzed: grong gcig pa'i 'dug gnas gcig gang zhe na /
translated: What is the dwelling of the same village?

original: lha khang ngam /🔽'dun sa 'am /
analyzed: lha khang ngam / 'dun sa 'am /
translated: The temple,🔽the meeting place,

original: skyed mo tshal lam /
analyzed: skyed mo tshal lam /
translated: the garden,

original: 'dug gnas su chos gos bzhag gam lha khang du chos gos bzhag na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dug gnas su chos gos bzhag gam lha khang du chos gos bzhag na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or the dwelling where the robe is laid down, or the robe is laid down in the temple, there is no offense.

original: gzhan du gnas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du gnas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he stays elsewhere, there is an offense.

original: spun mang po'i khyim sgo gcig pa zhig na sgo nyid 'dug gnas yin te grong du gnas sam 'dug na spang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spun mang po'i khyim sgo gcig pa zhig na sgo nyid 'dug gnas yin te grong du gnas sam 'dug na spang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In a house of many brothers, the door is the dwelling, and if he stays in the village, there is no offense.

original: lam du zhugs pa'i dge slong gis 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam du zhugs pa'i dge slong gis 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk has entered the road, he does not leave it as long as he has not gone beyond forty-nine fathoms.

original: 'greng ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba'i 'dom gang khor khor yug tshun chad mtshams so //
analyzed: 'greng ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba'i 'dom gang khor khor yug tshun chad mtshams so //
translated: The boundary is the distance of a stone’s throw in each of the four directions.

original: mtshams kyi bar du nyal na lus dang bral ma thag tu nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams kyi bar du nyal na lus dang bral ma thag tu nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one lies down within the boundary, the offense is incurred as soon as one’s body is separated from the robe.

original: dge slong pa la nyes par 'gyur ba de bzhin du dge slong ma dang bslab pa byin pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong pa la nyes par 'gyur ba de bzhin du dge slong ma dang bslab pa byin pa la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The offense for a bhikṣuṇī is the same as for a bhikṣu. The same is true for one who has received the precepts.

original: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge sbyong ma ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge sbyong ma ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: A śrāmaṇerī and a śikṣamāṇā incur an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gos kha sogs 'jog pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gos kha sogs 'jog pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of the rule concerning the storage of robes is as follows. The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong rnams de lta bu'i gos mang du rnyed de sngon po dang / ser po dang dmar po dang / srab mo stug po la sogs pa rnyed kyang gos su ma langs nas nam de lta bu zhig rnyed na bya'o snyan nas re ba dang bcas pas sogs shing zla ba gcig las 'das par bzhag pas na dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong rnams de lta bu'i gos mang du rnyed de sngon po dang / ser po dang dmar po dang / srab mo stug po la sogs pa rnyed kyang gos su ma langs nas nam de lta bu zhig rnyed na bya'o snyan nas re ba dang bcas pas sogs shing zla ba gcig las 'das par bzhag pas na dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol te /
translated: At that time, the monks obtained many such robes, blue, yellow, red, thin, thick, and so on. But since they did not wear them, they stored them for a month, hoping that they would obtain something like that.

original: 'dod pa mang ba mgu mi myong ba gso dka' ba zhes smad nas sbyangs pa'i yon @65b tan la dga' ba dang 'dod pa nyung ba'i bsngags pa brjod nas bslab pa bcas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa mang ba mgu mi myong ba gso dka' ba zhes smad nas sbyangs pa'i yon @65b tan la dga' ba dang 'dod pa nyung ba'i bsngags pa brjod nas bslab pa bcas te /
translated: The monks complained, saying, “Those with many desires are not satisfied, and are difficult to support.” After criticizing them, the Buddha praised the virtues of austerity and few desires, and established the training rule.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
translated: “A monk” is the basic phrase.

original: dge slong chos gos zin te gtan pa phyung zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong chos gos zin te gtan pa phyung zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: “Having completed his robe, and having left the rainy season retreat” is as above.

original: gos rnyed ces bya ba ni gzhan las so //
analyzed: gos rnyed ces bya ba ni gzhan las so //
translated: “Obtained a robe” means from another.

original: dus ma yin pa'i gos zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis gos rnyed pa'i dus ni gang zhe na /🔽gnas su gtan pa drubs te /🔽ston zla tha chungs nas dpyid zla ra ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i gos zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis gos rnyed pa'i dus ni gang zhe na / gnas su gtan pa drubs te / ston zla tha chungs nas dpyid zla ra ba'i bar du ste /
translated: The term out of season means that the time for a monk to obtain robes is from the middle autumn month until the middle winter month.

original: de ni gos slong ba'i dus so //
analyzed: de ni gos slong ba'i dus so //
translated: The term time means the time for making robes.

original: de phan chad ni dus ma yin no //
analyzed: de phan chad ni dus ma yin no //
translated: The term out of season means after that.

original: gnas su gtan pa ma drubs na thams cad kyang gos kyi dus ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas su gtan pa ma drubs na thams cad kyang gos kyi dus ma yin no //
translated: If the robes are not made, then all of it is out of season.

original: 'dod ces bya ba ni dgos par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod ces bya ba ni dgos par gyur pa'o //
translated: The term if he desires means if he needs them.

original: zla ba gcig gi bar du zhog ces bya ba ni zla ba gcig tshun chad do //
analyzed: zla ba gcig gi bar du zhog ces bya ba ni zla ba gcig tshun chad do //
translated: The term keep them for one month means up to one month.

original: gos rnyed du re ba yod na zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis gos re ba gang zhe na /🔽pha ma dang / phu nu pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon gyi byin grang snyam du sems pa'am /🔽lo lnga la rnyed pa'am /🔽lo drug la rnyed pa'am /
analyzed: gos rnyed du re ba yod na zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis gos re ba gang zhe na / pha ma dang / phu nu pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon gyi byin grang snyam du sems pa'am / lo lnga la rnyed pa'am / lo drug la rnyed pa'am /
translated: The term if he has hope of obtaining robes means if a monk has hope of obtaining robes.

original: gtsug phud kyi dus ston dang / khang pa'i ston mo'am /
analyzed: gtsug phud kyi dus ston dang / khang pa'i ston mo'am /
translated: The term hope means thinking, My parents, brothers, preceptor, or teacher will give me robes, or thinking, I will obtain robes after five years, or thinking, I will obtain robes after six years, or thinking, I will obtain robes at the festival of the tonsure, or thinking, I will obtain robes at the festival of the house.

original: dus ston chen po la rnyed grang snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: dus ston chen po la rnyed grang snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: Thinking, I will get it at the great festival, is the thought of not enough.

original: kha ma longs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyar ma dang stod g-yogs kyi kha ma longs pa longs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha ma longs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyar ma dang stod g-yogs kyi kha ma longs pa longs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not enough means not enough of the lower robe and upper robe.

original: de las 'das par bzhag na zhes bya ba ni thal ba'o //
analyzed: de las 'das par bzhag na zhes bya ba ni thal ba'o //
translated: Exceeding means exceeding the limit.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags bar bya'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags bar bya'o //
translated: A downfall through transgression means that one must confess the downfall after giving up the object.

original: dge slong gis tshes gcig la gos sngon po'am /
analyzed: dge slong gis tshes gcig la gos sngon po'am /
translated: If a monk obtains a blue,

original: dmar po'am ser po zhig rnyed na de zhag bcu tshun chad du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dmar po'am ser po zhig rnyed na de zhag bcu tshun chad du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: red, or yellow robe on the first day, he may consecrate it for ten days.

original: gzhan la bskur bar byas de ltar rung bar ma byas na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la bskur bar byas de ltar rung bar ma byas na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he sends it to another, but it is not suitable, it is a downfall through transgression.

original: de ste dge slong gis gos sngon po'am /
analyzed: de ste dge slong gis gos sngon po'am /
translated: If a monk obtains a blue,

original: dmar po dang ser po zhig tshes gcig la rnyed nas de kha ma longs na rnyed du re ba yin na zla ba gcig tu gzhag par bya'o //
