analyzed: nor can zhes bya ba ni phyug po'o //
translated: The Buddha said, Monks, you should not do

original: tshong dpon zhes bya ba ni thabs byin pa'o //
analyzed: tshong dpon zhes bya ba ni thabs byin pa'o //
translated: The “merchant” is the one who gives the means.

original: ded dpon zhes bya ba ni 'gron pa mang po ded cing lan grangs mang du phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ded dpon zhes bya ba ni 'gron pa mang po ded cing lan grangs mang du phyin pa'o //
translated: The “leader” is the one who leads many travelers and has gone many times.

original: pho nya'i lag tu zhes bya ba ni bud med dam skyes pa'am ma ning la'o //
analyzed: pho nya'i lag tu zhes bya ba ni bud med dam skyes pa'am ma ning la'o //
translated: “Into the hand of a messenger” means into the hand of a woman, a man, or a neuter.

original: gos kyi rin zhes bya ba ni gser dngul lo //
analyzed: gos kyi rin zhes bya ba ni gser dngul lo //
translated: “The price of cloth” means gold and silver.

original: de nas pho nyas gos kyi rin de khyer te /
analyzed: de nas pho nyas gos kyi rin de khyer te /
translated: Then the messenger, having taken that price of cloth,

original: dge slong gal pa der song ste phyin pa dang / dge slong la 'phags pa rgyal po dang bram ze la sogs pa ming 'di zhes bgyis bas khyod la gos kyi rin 'di bskur gyis 'phags pa thugs brtse ba'i slad du 'di dag bzhes su gsol zhes de skad zer ba @71a * //
analyzed: dge slong gal pa der song ste phyin pa dang / dge slong la 'phags pa rgyal po dang bram ze la sogs pa ming 'di zhes bgyis bas khyod la gos kyi rin 'di bskur gyis 'phags pa thugs brtse ba'i slad du 'di dag bzhes su gsol zhes de skad zer ba @71a * //
translated: goes to that monk and, having arrived, says to the monk, “Noble one, this is the price of cloth sent to you by the king, or the brahman, etc., named so-and-so. Noble one, please accept this out of compassion.”

original: dang / dge slong des pho nya de la tshe dang ldan pa pho nya dge slong rnams ni gos kyi rin len du mi rung ste bdag cag dus su gos shing rnyed na ni len to zhes bya ba de skad smros shig / rung ba zhes bya ba ni spyad
analyzed: dang / dge slong des pho nya de la tshe dang ldan pa pho nya dge slong rnams ni gos kyi rin len du mi rung ste bdag cag dus su gos shing rnyed na ni len to zhes bya ba de skad smros shig / rung ba zhes bya ba ni spyad
translated: And that monk should say to that messenger, “Venerable messenger, monks are not suitable to receive the price of robes. If we need robes, we will receive them at the right time.”

original: par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: par 'os pa'o //
translated: “Suitable” means fit to be used.🔽If that messenger says to that monk, “Noble one, is there anyone who acts as attendant for the noble ones?” then the monk who wants robes should point out an attendant.

original: gal te pho nya des dge slong de la 'phags pa rnams kyi zhal ta bgyid pa 'ga' mchis sam zhes de skad zer ba dang gos 'dod pa'i dge slong gis zhal ta byed pa ston cig / gos 'dod ces bya ba ni dgos par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gal te pho nya des dge slong de la 'phags pa rnams kyi zhal ta bgyid pa 'ga' mchis sam zhes de skad zer ba dang gos 'dod pa'i dge slong gis zhal ta byed pa ston cig / gos 'dod ces bya ba ni dgos par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Who wants robes” means who has a need for them.

original: kun dga'i ra ba zhes bya ba ni rung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun dga'i ra ba zhes bya ba ni rung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Pleasure garden” means a suitable place.

original: dge bsnyen zhes bya ba ni skyabs su song zhing bslab tshig lnga la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen zhes bya ba ni skyabs su song zhing bslab tshig lnga la gnas pa'o //
translated: “Layman” means someone who has gone for refuge and abides in the five precepts.

original: tshe dang ldan pa pho nya 'di ni dge slong gi zhal ta byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa pho nya 'di ni dge slong gi zhal ta byed pa'o //
translated: “Venerable messenger, this is the monk’s attendant.”

original: de nas pho nyas gos kyi rin khyer la zhal ta pa'i der song ste phyin nas zhal ta pa la tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta pa shes par gyis shig / khyod kyis gos kyi rin 'dis 'di 'dra ba'i gos shig nyos ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i dge
analyzed: de nas pho nyas gos kyi rin khyer la zhal ta pa'i der song ste phyin nas zhal ta pa la tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta pa shes par gyis shig / khyod kyis gos kyi rin 'dis 'di 'dra ba'i gos shig nyos ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i dge
translated: Then the messenger, taking the price of the cloth, should go to the attendant and say, “Venerable attendant, please know that you should buy such-and-such cloth with this price of cloth for the monk named so-and-so.🔽When he comes, give him the appropriate cloth at the right time.”

original: slong 'ongs pa dang / de la dus su gos rung ba skon cig rung ba zhes bya ba ni spyad par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: slong 'ongs pa dang / de la dus su gos rung ba skon cig rung ba zhes bya ba ni spyad par 'os pa'o //
translated: “Appropriate” means suitable.🔽Then the messenger should say, “Noble one, the attendant has entrusted me to give you the cloth. Please take it.”

original: de nas pho nyas 'phags pa zhal ta ba bdag la bstan pa la gos bdag gis phul cig par gtad pa lags kyis der long zhes bsgo shig / de nas dge slong gis zhal ta byed pa'i gan du song ste /
analyzed: de nas pho nyas 'phags pa zhal ta ba bdag la bstan pa la gos bdag gis phul cig par gtad pa lags kyis der long zhes bsgo shig / de nas dge slong gis zhal ta byed pa'i gan du song ste /
translated: Then the monk should go to the attendant and say,🔽“Venerable, I need cloth.” He should request it a second and a third time.🔽If he is given the cloth, good. If not, he should sit in a visible place for five or six times.

original: tshe dang ldan pa bdag gis gos dgos so zhes lan gnyis lan gsum skul cig / byin na ni legs ma byin na lan lnga drug tu snang ba'i phyogs su 'dug shig / snang ba'i phyogs ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa bdag gis gos dgos so zhes lan gnyis lan gsum skul cig / byin na ni legs ma byin na lan lnga drug tu snang ba'i phyogs su 'dug shig / snang ba'i phyogs ni bzhi'o //
translated: “Visible place” means the four directions.

original: bskul ba'i sgo ni drug go //
analyzed: bskul ba'i sgo ni drug go //
translated: The six doors of invitation.

original: snang ba'i phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba'i phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the side of appearance?

original: 'dug gnas par khyim dang zhing dang / las byed pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: 'dug gnas par khyim dang zhing dang / las byed pa'i gnas so //
translated: The place of residence is the house, the field, and the place of work.🔽The six doors of invitation are:

original: bskul ba'i sgo drug ni khyod byon tam zhe na /
analyzed: bskul ba'i sgo drug ni khyod byon tam zhe na /
translated: Have you come?🔽For that reason.🔽Have you come well?🔽For that very reason.🔽Sit on this seat?

original: de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / bde bar byon tam zhe na yang don de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gdan 'di la bzhugs she na yang don de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / bca' ba 'cho zhe na yang don de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / bde bar byon tam zhe na yang don de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gdan 'di la bzhugs she na yang don de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / bca' ba 'cho zhe na yang don de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang /
translated: For that very reason.🔽Eat the food?🔽For that very reason.🔽Drink the drink?🔽For that very reason.

original: bza' ba zo zhe na yang don de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / btung ba 'thung zhe na yang don de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / drug po bskul ba'i sgo yin par tshig myur du smras te /
analyzed: bza' ba zo zhe na yang don de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / btung ba 'thung zhe na yang don de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / drug po bskul ba'i sgo yin par tshig myur du smras te /
translated: These six are the doors of invitation, spoken quickly.

original: pha rol gyis ma go na sgo drug ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyis ma go na sgo drug ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: If the other does not understand, the six doors are not complete.

original: mi rings par dal nas smras te pha rol gyis don go na sgo drug rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi rings par dal nas smras te pha rol gyis don go na sgo drug rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: If the other person understands the meaning, then the six elements are complete.

original: gal te ma grub na de'i 'og tu stsal te thob na spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags @71b par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ma grub na de'i 'og tu stsal te thob na spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags @71b par bya'o //
translated: If it is not accomplished, then after that, if it is obtained, it is called a downfall that is to be confessed after one has given up the object.

original: de'i 'og tu gos ma grub na dang po gang nas 'ongs pa der sbron cig ces bya ba ni bdag gis slob ma mngag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gos ma grub na dang po gang nas 'ongs pa der sbron cig ces bya ba ni bdag gis slob ma mngag par bya'o //
translated: After that, if the robe is not accomplished, then one should send a message to where one first came from.🔽The elder should say, I have not accomplished anything of the goods you sent.

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyis zong bskur ba bdag gis ci yang ma grub po zhes bya ba ni nad pa'i sman la sogs par phan ma thogs pa'o de ni 'du shes bya ba ni de dang mthun pa'i chos so //🔽nye bar 'gyur ba ni bdag po yang mi /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyis zong bskur ba bdag gis ci yang ma grub po zhes bya ba ni nad pa'i sman la sogs par phan ma thogs pa'o de ni 'du shes bya ba ni de dang mthun pa'i chos so // nye bar 'gyur ba ni bdag po yang mi /
translated: The elder should say, I have not accomplished anything of the goods you sent.🔽If it is not a human,

original: pho nya yang mi /
analyzed: pho nya yang mi /
translated: if it is not a messenger,

original: dge slong yang mi yin na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong yang mi yin na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and if it is not a fully ordained monk, then there is no offense.

original: mis byin pa la mi ma yin pas pho nya byas sam /
analyzed: mis byin pa la mi ma yin pas pho nya byas sam /
translated: If a human gives to a non-human, or if a non-human acts as a messenger,🔽or if a fully ordained monk is not present,

original: mi ma yin pas byin la mis pho nya byas la rung bar byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi ma yin pas byin la mis pho nya byas la rung bar byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If a non-human gives it to him, and a human acts as messenger, then it is a minor infraction.

original: lan lnga drug tu ma thob pa las slad kyis stsal te grub na ltung bar 'gyur ba de la gzhan gyi sgo nas ltung bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /
analyzed: lan lnga drug tu ma thob pa las slad kyis stsal te grub na ltung bar 'gyur ba de la gzhan gyi sgo nas ltung bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /
translated: If he does not obtain it in five or six times, but later receives it, then there is a downfall.

original: phrin dang phrin yig gis lan lnga drug las lhag par brtsal te gos grub na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrin dang phrin yig gis lan lnga drug las lhag par brtsal te gos grub na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he sends a message or a letter more than five or six times, and obtains the cloth, then it is a minor infraction.

original: de bzhin lag brda dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'ang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin lag brda dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'ang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if he uses sign language or passes a message through an intermediary, it is a minor infraction.

original: dge slong gis khyim pa smyon pa dang / ra ro ba dang nad kyis gzir ba dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / glen pa dang / lkugs pa dang / snyoms par zhugs pa dang / mu stegs can dang / 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa la /
analyzed: dge slong gis khyim pa smyon pa dang / ra ro ba dang nad kyis gzir ba dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / glen pa dang / lkugs pa dang / snyoms par zhugs pa dang / mu stegs can dang / 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa la /
translated: If a monk asks a householder who is insane, intoxicated, sick, mentally disturbed, mute, or in deep sleep; a tīrthika; or someone who has taken ordination in another Buddhist tradition

original: lan drug las lhag par gos bsgrubs te thob kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan drug las lhag par gos bsgrubs te thob kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: to obtain cloth for him more than six times, and he obtains it, then it is a minor infraction.

original: gos kyi rgyu dang spun mi gnang ba'i nang nas blangs kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos kyi rgyu dang spun mi gnang ba'i nang nas blangs kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one takes it from among those who do not give cloth or cloth materials to one’s relatives, it becomes a misdeed.

original: spang ba'i chos gos kyi tshogs te bcu phung dang po'o /
analyzed: spang ba'i chos gos kyi tshogs te bcu phung dang po'o /
translated: This is the first group of the aggregate of dharmas to be abandoned, the aggregate of cloth.

original: // / stan gyi tshogs las brtsams te /
analyzed: // / stan gyi tshogs las brtsams te /
translated: The aggregate of seats

original: srin bal las stan byed pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa dze ta'i tshal na bzhugs so //
analyzed: srin bal las stan byed pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa dze ta'i tshal na bzhugs so //
translated: The background to the rule about making seats from kapok is this. The Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong mang po dag srin bal gyis stan sar pa byed du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong mang po dag srin bal gyis stan sar pa byed du 'jug ste /
translated: At that time, many monks were having new kapok seats made.

original: bya ba dang byed pa mang bas kha ton dang lung 'bogs pa'i bar chad du gyur pa dang / srin bal gyi stan bzang po la chags pas bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir rin che zhing dkon pa'i mal stan tshol zhing gzhan la slong pas na de'i phyir srog chags mang po gsod par gyur pas /
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa mang bas kha ton dang lung 'bogs pa'i bar chad du gyur pa dang / srin bal gyi stan bzang po la chags pas bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir rin che zhing dkon pa'i mal stan tshol zhing gzhan la slong pas na de'i phyir srog chags mang po gsod par gyur pas /
translated: Because they were busy with their work and their studies, they were interrupted in their recitations and their teachings. Because they were attached to their fine kapok seats, they sought and begged others for expensive and rare bedding. Because of this, many living beings were killed.

original: phyis mu stegs can rnams dge sbyong mgo reg de la bsod snyoms sbyin par su spro zhes mi snyan par 'dzer ba dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol nas /🔽bkas smras pa /
analyzed: phyis mu stegs can rnams dge sbyong mgo reg de la bsod snyoms sbyin par su spro zhes mi snyan par 'dzer ba dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol nas / bkas smras pa /
translated: The monks reported this to the Blessed One.🔽He said, “It is true, isn’t it?”

original: mad do zhes gsol ba dang / gso dka' dgang dka' ba zhes smras nas /
analyzed: mad do zhes gsol ba dang / gso dka' dgang dka' ba zhes smras nas /
translated: They replied, “It is true, Blessed One.”

original: chog shes pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan la dga' ba dang yon tan bsngags nas yang dge slong gang yang zhes @72a * //
analyzed: chog shes pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan la dga' ba dang yon tan bsngags nas yang dge slong gang yang zhes @72a * //
translated: The Blessed One praised contentment and the ascetic virtues, and then said, “If a monk . . .”

original: 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: and so on, up to “establishes the training rule for his disciples.”

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste /
translated: “A monk” means many monks.

original: gzhan yang 'di dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di dang 'dra'o //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: stan sar pa zhes bya ba ni sar pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: stan sar pa zhes bya ba ni sar pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “A new sitting mat” means new in two ways:

original: sar pa nyid sar pa dang / rnyed pa nyid sar pa'o //
analyzed: sar pa nyid sar pa dang / rnyed pa nyid sar pa'o //
translated: new in the sense of being new, and new in the sense of having been obtained.

original: skabs 'dir sar pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir sar pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: In this case, it means new in the sense of being new.

original: srin bal gyis stan sar pa byed ces bya ba ni nang tshangs can dang / bcags pa'o //
analyzed: srin bal gyis stan sar pa byed ces bya ba ni nang tshangs can dang / bcags pa'o //
translated: “A new sitting mat made of cotton” means one made of cotton that has not been woven together, or one made of cotton that has been woven together.

original: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
translated: “One should make” means that one should make it oneself or have someone else make it.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: A downfall is to be confessed after one has discarded the material.

original: nyes pa ni srin bal gyi phung po dang sgo na 'byed dam 'jig gam rmal tam rmel du bcug ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni srin bal gyi phung po dang sgo na 'byed dam 'jig gam rmal tam rmel du bcug ste /
translated: A fault is to make a mat of silk floss, or to make one in a doorway, or to make one on one’s lap, or to have one made on one’s lap.

original: stan ma zin bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: stan ma zin bar du nyes byas so //
translated: If one uses a mat that has not been finished, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: zin nas spang ba'i ltung ba'o //🔽byas pa rnyed pa dang / byas zin pa spyod pa dang / rnying pa 'chos pa la nyes pa med do //🔽gzhan bgyid du stsal ba dang / gzhan gyi phyir byed pa dang / gzhan gyis ma zin pa zin par byed pa dang / khyim pa la bgyid du stsal ba kun nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zin nas spang ba'i ltung ba'o // byas pa rnyed pa dang / byas zin pa spyod pa dang / rnying pa 'chos pa la nyes pa med do // gzhan bgyid du stsal ba dang / gzhan gyi phyir byed pa dang / gzhan gyis ma zin pa zin par byed pa dang / khyim pa la bgyid du stsal ba kun nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one uses a finished mat, one commits a downfall of transgression.

original: bslab pa byin pa dang / dge tshul pha dang / dge tshul ma dang / rkun gnas kyi srin bal gyis stan byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bslab pa byin pa dang / dge tshul pha dang / dge tshul ma dang / rkun gnas kyi srin bal gyis stan byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no offense if one uses a mat that has been made by oneself, or that has been made by someone else, or that has been made by one’s disciples, or that has been made by the disciples of someone else, or that has been made by one’s relatives, or that has been made by the relatives of someone else, or that has been made by one’s servants, or that has been made by the servants of someone else, or that has been made by those who have entered the monastic life, or that has been made by those who have entered the monastic life of another Buddhist tradition, or that has been made by those who have entered the monastic life of a non-Buddhist tradition, or that has been made by those who have entered the monastic life of a non-Buddhist tradition and then gone forth in our own tradition, or that has been made by those who have entered the monastic life of a non-Buddhist tradition and then gone forth in another non-Buddhist tradition, or that has been made by those who have entered the monastic life of a non-Buddhist tradition and then gone forth in a Buddhist tradition other than our own, or that has been made by those who have entered the monastic life of a non-Buddhist tradition and then gone forth in our own tradition, or that has been made by those who have entered the monastic life of a non-Buddhist tradition and then gone forth in another non-Buddhist tradition, or that has been made by those who have entered the monastic life of a non-Buddhist tradition and then gone forth in a Buddhist tradition other than our own, or that has been made by those who have entered the monastic life of a non-Buddhist tradition and then gone forth in our own tradition, or that has been made by those who have entered the monastic life of a non-Buddhist tradition and then gone forth in another non-Buddhist tradition, or that has been made by

original: 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa dang / mu stegs can dang / kun du rgyu ba la stan byed du bcug na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa dang / mu stegs can dang / kun du rgyu ba la stan byed du bcug na nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes a non-human being, a tīrthika, or a wandering ascetic sit on it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rgyu dang spun gcig rung la gcig mi rung ba 'dres bar stan byed du bcug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro//
analyzed: rgyu dang spun gcig rung la gcig mi rung ba 'dres bar stan byed du bcug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro//
translated: If one makes a mixed seat, where one part is suitable and one part is not suitable, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: srin bal dang / zar ma'i bal dang 'dres par byed du bcug pa dang / srin bal dang se bo dang 'dres par byed du bcug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srin bal dang / zar ma'i bal dang 'dres par byed du bcug pa dang / srin bal dang se bo dang 'dres par byed du bcug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes a seat mixed with cotton down, with silk, or with cotton down and wool, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gding ba'i tshad bde bar gshegs pa'i tshad du byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gding ba'i tshad bde bar gshegs pa'i tshad du byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes a seat the size of the Sugata, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gding ba chen po'i tshad ni khru phyed dang lnga'o //
analyzed: gding ba chen po'i tshad ni khru phyed dang lnga'o //
translated: The size of a large seat is one cubit and a half.

original: chung ngu ni khru phyed dang gsum mo //
analyzed: chung ngu ni khru phyed dang gsum mo //
translated: The size of a small seat is one cubit and three fingers.

original: par ma ni 'bring ngo //
analyzed: par ma ni 'bring ngo //
translated: The size of a medium seat is between these two.

original: bal nag po 'ba' zhig las stan byed pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bal nag po 'ba' zhig las stan byed pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of the rule prohibiting the use of a seat made entirely of black wool is as follows. The Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong mang po dag lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las stan byed de lug bal nag po yang rin che zhing rnyed dka' ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong mang po dag lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las stan byed de lug bal nag po yang rin che zhing rnyed dka' ste /
translated: At that time, many monks made seats from only black wool, but black wool was expensive and difficult to obtain.

original: khyim bdag dang bram ze kun la tshol zhing slong bas lung dbog pa dang bsam gtan byed pa'i bar chad du gyur pas /
analyzed: khyim bdag dang bram ze kun la tshol zhing slong bas lung dbog pa dang bsam gtan byed pa'i bar chad du gyur pas /
translated: They searched for and begged from all the householders and brahmins, so it became an obstacle to giving oral transmissions and practicing meditation.

original: don nyung ba'i dge slong rnams kyis snyan du gsol nas /
analyzed: don nyung ba'i dge slong rnams kyis snyan du gsol nas /
translated: The monks with few concerns reported this,

original: gso dka' ba dgang dka' ba zhes smad nas /
analyzed: gso dka' ba dgang dka' ba zhes smad nas /
translated: and after criticizing them as difficult to support and difficult to fill,

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan pa dga' ba dang tshod zin pa'i legs pa bsngags nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas te /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan pa dga' ba dang tshod zin pa'i legs pa bsngags nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas te /
translated: they praised the virtues of those who delight in the ascetic practices and are moderate, and established a training rule in the Monastic Law.

original: @72b yang dge slong zhes rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: @72b yang dge slong zhes rtsa ba'i tshig rnams so //
translated: Again, monks are the basic words.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste /
translated: As for which monk, it refers to many monks,

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: but it is the same for others.

original: bal nag po 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni nag po la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bal nag po 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni nag po la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: As for only black wool, there are four types of black:

original: rang bzhin gyis nag pa dang / sngon por btsos pa dang / sa nag gi nang du btsos pa dang / dri ma can lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nag pa dang / sngon por btsos pa dang / sa nag gi nang du btsos pa dang / dri ma can lta bu'o //
translated: The natural color is black, and the dyed color is blue, or the color of the black earth, or the color of dirt.

original: skabs 'dir ni rang bzhin gyis nag pa la bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni rang bzhin gyis nag pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, the natural color is black.

original: lug pa la zhes bya ba ni spu'o //
analyzed: lug pa la zhes bya ba ni spu'o //
translated: Wool means wool.

original: sar pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sar pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis te /
translated: New means two things:

original: gsar du byas pa dang / rnyed pa sar pa'o //
analyzed: gsar du byas pa dang / rnyed pa sar pa'o //
translated: new in the sense of newly made, and new in the sense of newly acquired.

original: skabs 'dir ni sar pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni sar pa byas pa'o //
translated: Here, it means new in the sense of newly made.

original: stan zhes bya ba ni nang tshangs can dang / bcags pa la bya'o //
analyzed: stan zhes bya ba ni nang tshangs can dang / bcags pa la bya'o //
translated: A mat means a mat with a fringe, or a mat made of strips of wood.

original: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
translated: To make means to make it oneself or to have someone else make it.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: A transgression to be confessed is a downfall that must be confessed after giving up the object.

original: nyes pa ni bal gyi phung po dang / ke'u dang / chun po bshig gam rme la te /
analyzed: nyes pa ni bal gyi phung po dang / ke'u dang / chun po bshig gam rme la te /
translated: A fault is a downfall that occurs when one uses a mat of wool that has been balled up, or that has been torn, or that has been cut into strips.

original: stan du byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stan du byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes a mat out of it, one commits a downfall.

original: gzhan gyis byin pa dang / byas zin pa la spyod pa dang / rnying pa 'chos pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byin pa dang / byas zin pa la spyod pa dang / rnying pa 'chos pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one uses a mat given by others, or if one uses a mat that has been made, or if one repairs an old mat.

original: phrin dang phrin yig gis byed du bcug pa ni rim pa gong ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: phrin dang phrin yig gis byed du bcug pa ni rim pa gong ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The one who causes it to be made by means of a message or a letter is similar to the above.🔽The basis for the rule concerning the two parts of the seat is this.

original: cha gnyis las stan du byed pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: cha gnyis las stan du byed pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe dge slong dag snga ma bzhin du stan nag po gcig pu byed du mi gnang ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong dag snga ma bzhin du stan nag po gcig pu byed du mi gnang ste /
translated: At that time, the monks were not allowed to make a seat of only black material.🔽The Blessed One said, “Add white to it.”🔽Because they wanted something nice, they added just a little white, the size of a mark, and made it.🔽The monks who had few desires criticized them,

original: de la dkar po bsres shig par bka' stsal pa dang / de dag gis bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir dkar po cung zad mtshan ma tsam zhig bsres shing byed pas don nyung ba'i dge slong rnams 'phya ste /🔽snyan du bdas nas rigs pa ma yin rung ba ma yin zhes smad de /
analyzed: de la dkar po bsres shig par bka' stsal pa dang / de dag gis bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir dkar po cung zad mtshan ma tsam zhig bsres shing byed pas don nyung ba'i dge slong rnams 'phya ste /🔽snyan du bdas nas rigs pa ma yin rung ba ma yin zhes smad de /
translated: and after reproaching them, they reported it to the Blessed One.

original: dge slong stan sar pa byed pa na phyed lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las chu shig / bzhi cha gcig dkar po las chug shig / bzhi cha gcig 'khob bal las chu ga shig / de ltar ma byas na spang bar 'gyur ro zhes bslab pa'i gnas
analyzed: dge slong stan sar pa byed pa na phyed lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las chu shig / bzhi cha gcig dkar po las chug shig / bzhi cha gcig 'khob bal las chu ga shig / de ltar ma byas na spang bar 'gyur ro zhes bslab pa'i gnas
translated: When a monk makes a new mat, he should make it half from black sheep’s wool, a quarter from white, and a quarter from coarse wool. If he does not do so, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: bcas so // stan sar pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bcas so // stan sar pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: New mat means one of two kinds:

original: gsar du byas pa dang / rnyed pa sar pa'o //
analyzed: gsar du byas pa dang / rnyed pa sar pa'o //
translated: one that is newly made, and one that is new and found.

original: skabs 'dir ni gsar du byas pa'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni gsar du byas pa'o //
translated: In this context, it means one that is newly made.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste /
translated: Monk means many monks.

original: chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: They are those who have entered this Dharma.

original: stan zhes bya ba ni nang tshangs can dang bcags pa la bya ste /
analyzed: stan zhes bya ba ni nang tshangs can dang bcags pa la bya ste /
translated: Mat means one with a lining and one without a lining.

original: skabs 'dir bcags pa la bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir bcags pa la bya'o //
translated: In this context, it means one without a lining.

original: byed ces bya ba ni bdag gis byas pa'am gzhan gyis byas pa'o //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni bdag gis byas pa'am gzhan gyis byas pa'o //
translated: Make means that he makes it himself or he has someone else make it.

original: gnyis kyi cha nag po las chug shig ces bya ba ni bal rang bzhin gyis gnag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi cha nag po las chug shig ces bya ba ni bal rang bzhin gyis gnag pa'o //
translated: Half from black means from black wool by nature.

original: bal zhes bya ba ni spu'o //
analyzed: bal zhes bya ba ni spu'o //
translated: Wool means animal hair.

original: bzhi cha gcig dkar po las chug shig ces bya ba ni sgang bal lam gnya' bal lam rtsib logs @73a * //🔽kyi bal lo //
analyzed: bzhi cha gcig dkar po las chug shig ces bya ba ni sgang bal lam gnya' bal lam rtsib logs @73a * // kyi bal lo //
translated: One quarter should be made of black wool means wool from the head and belly is called black wool.🔽One quarter should be made of brown wool means wool from the neck, shoulders, and hooves is called brown wool.

original: bzhi cha gcig 'khob bal zhes bya ba ni mgo bal dang lto bal la 'khob bal zhes bya'o //🔽ma bcug ces bya ba ni ma bsres pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi cha gcig 'khob bal zhes bya ba ni mgo bal dang lto bal la 'khob bal zhes bya'o // ma bcug ces bya ba ni ma bsres pa'o //
translated: One quarter should be made of white wool means wool from the chest, legs, and tail is called white wool.

original: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las stan byas na spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las stan byas na spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: If a monk makes a mat only from black wool, it is called a 'transgression to be relinquished.' This means that after relinquishing the item, the downfall should be confessed.🔽The fault is this: If a monk makes a mat from ten measures of wool, he should put five measures of black wool into it,🔽three and a half measures of white wool,

original: de la nyes pa ni dge slong gis bal srang bcu las stan gcig byed na de la lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las srang lnga chug shig / srang phyed dang gsum ni bal dkar po las chug shig / srang phyed dang gsum ni 'khob bal las chug
analyzed: de la nyes pa ni dge slong gis bal srang bcu las stan gcig byed na de la lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las srang lnga chug shig / srang phyed dang gsum ni bal dkar po las chug shig / srang phyed dang gsum ni 'khob bal las chug
translated: and three and a half measures of brown wool.

original: shig / gal te dge slong gis phyed lug bal nag po las ma bcug gam /
analyzed: shig / gal te dge slong gis phyed lug bal nag po las ma bcug gam /
translated: If a monk does not put in half the black wool,🔽or one quarter of white wool,

original: bzhi cha gcig dkar po las ma bcug gam /
analyzed: bzhi cha gcig dkar po las ma bcug gam /
translated: or one quarter of brown wool,

original: bzhi cha gcig 'khob bal las ma bcug par stan sar pa byas na zin ma thag tu spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi cha gcig 'khob bal las ma bcug par stan sar pa byas na zin ma thag tu spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he makes a new mat without adding a piece of cloth one-fourth the size of the mat, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession as soon as he has finished it.

original: de la bal nag po srang phyed dam /
analyzed: de la bal nag po srang phyed dam /
translated: In this case, if he adds a piece of black wool weighing half a pala or one pala,

original: srang gcig tsam gyis khyed par bcug na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srang gcig tsam gyis khyed par bcug na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession in its entirety.

original: de la srong bcu pa'i stan ji lta ba bzhin du srang nyi shu pa'am /
analyzed: de la srong bcu pa'i stan ji lta ba bzhin du srang nyi shu pa'am /
translated: In this case, just as with a mat made of ten palas of wool, a mat made of twenty palas of wool,

original: lnga bcu pa'am brgya pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: lnga bcu pa'am brgya pa yang rung ste /
translated: or fifty palas of wool, or a hundred palas of wool,

original: phyed nag po bzhi cha gnyis 'khob bal dang dkar po bsre bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyed nag po bzhi cha gnyis 'khob bal dang dkar po bsre bar rig par bya'o //
translated: should be made with half black wool and one-fourth white wool.🔽The origin of the rule prohibiting the making of a new mat before six years have passed on a previous one

original: stan sar pa byas pa lo drug ma lon par stan sar pa gzhan byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng bzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: stan sar pa byas pa lo drug ma lon par stan sar pa gzhan byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng bzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī.🔽At that time, the monks used bedding. Some mats were short, some were long, some were too narrow,

original: de'i tshe na dge slong dag mal stan la longs spyod de stan de ni thung stan de ni ring stan de ni ha cang zheng chung /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong dag mal stan la longs spyod de stan de ni thung stan de ni ring stan de ni ha cang zheng chung /
translated: and some were too wide.

original: de ni ha cang zheng ches zhes snga ma bor zhing stan sar pa 'ba' zhig byed pas bya ba dang byed pa mang ste /
analyzed: de ni ha cang zheng ches zhes snga ma bor zhing stan sar pa 'ba' zhig byed pas bya ba dang byed pa mang ste /
translated: The monks said, This is too wide, and they discarded the old seat and made a new one.

original: dge ba'i phyogs nyams par gyur pas dge slong rnams kyis snyan du gsol nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs nyams par gyur pas dge slong rnams kyis snyan du gsol nas /
translated: Since they were occupied with many activities, they neglected their virtuous practices.🔽The monks reported this to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gso dka' ba zhes rnam grangs du mas smad nas chog shes pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan la dga' ba'i bsngags pa brjod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gso dka' ba zhes rnam grangs du mas smad nas chog shes pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan la dga' ba'i bsngags pa brjod de /
translated: The Blessed One criticized the monks who are difficult to support in many ways, and praised contentment and delight in the ascetic virtues.🔽He established a rule for training in the Vinaya:

original: stan rnying pa dge slong gis lo drug gi bar du chongs shig / lo drug ma lon par stan sar pa gzhan byed na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: stan rnying pa dge slong gis lo drug gi bar du chongs shig / lo drug ma lon par stan sar pa gzhan byed na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Monks should keep the old seat for six years. If they make another new seat before six years have passed, it is an offense entailing relinquishment.

original: de la lo drug ma lon par stan sar pa byed du rjes su gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das 'brog skyes kyi 'brog bzang po na bzhugs so //
analyzed: de la lo drug ma lon par stan sar pa byed du rjes su gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das 'brog skyes kyi 'brog bzang po na bzhugs so //
translated: The basis for the allowance to make a new seat before six years have passed is this. The Blessed One was staying in the beautiful pasture of the nomads.

original: de'i tshe 'brog de na lhags pa dang rlung che bas las sar pa pa'i dge slong stan lo drug tu mi thub nas rdol bas las byed pa btang ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'brog de na lhags pa dang rlung che bas las sar pa pa'i dge slong stan lo drug tu mi thub nas rdol bas las byed pa btang ngo //
translated: At that time, in that wilderness, because of the strong wind and cold, the new mat of a certain monk could not be completed in six years. Therefore, the work was abandoned.

original: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas las sar pa @73b pa'i dge slong gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas las sar pa @73b pa'i dge slong gang yang rung ste /
translated: When this situation was reported to the Buddha, he said, “From now on, any new mat of a monk🔽that cannot be completed in six years, or that is completed in less than six years, should be requested from the Saṅgha.🔽The Saṅgha should also give the vow to make a new mat to one who cannot complete it in six years, or who requests it, after examining the mat well.

original: de'i stan lo drug tu mi thub pa dang / lo drug tshun chad stan sar pa bya bar dge 'dun la sdom pa gsol cig / dge 'dun gyis kyang stan legs par rtog pa la mi thub pa dang / gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis lo drug tshun chad stan sar pa byed pa'i sdom pa byin cig / stan sar pa zhes bya ba la gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i stan lo drug tu mi thub pa dang / lo drug tshun chad stan sar pa bya bar dge 'dun la sdom pa gsol cig / dge 'dun gyis kyang stan legs par rtog pa la mi thub pa dang / gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis lo drug tshun chad stan sar pa byed pa'i sdom pa byin cig / stan sar pa zhes bya ba la gnyis te /
translated: A new mat is of two kinds:

original: gsar du byas pa dang / rnyed pa sar pa'o //
analyzed: gsar du byas pa dang / rnyed pa sar pa'o //
translated: one newly made, and one newly acquired.

original: skabs 'dir ni gsar pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni gsar pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: In this context, it refers to a new one.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste /
translated: “Monk” means many monks.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to others.

original: stan zhes bya ba ni bcags pa la bya'o //
analyzed: stan zhes bya ba ni bcags pa la bya'o //
translated: “Seat” means a mat.

original: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa'o //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa'o //
translated: “To make” means to make it oneself or to have someone else make it.

original: mi 'dod bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ma dad par lo drug gi bar du chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ma dad par lo drug gi bar du chongs shig pa'o //
translated: “For six years” means to keep it for six years.

original: stan rnying pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma rnying pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: stan rnying pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma rnying pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Old seat” means the old one that one has.

original: spangs kyang rung ma spangs kyang rung ste stan sar pa byed ces bya ba ni sar pa'i gzhan gnyis pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: spangs kyang rung ma spangs kyang rung ste stan sar pa byed ces bya ba ni sar pa'i gzhan gnyis pa byed pa'o //
translated: “Whether it is discarded or not discarded” means whether it is discarded or not discarded.

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni bkol ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni bkol ba'o //
translated: “Except if the Saṅgha gives permission” means if it is assigned.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags pa'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags pa'o //
translated: “Foul” means to confess a downfall after discarding the object.

original: dge slong gis lo gang la stan byas nas de nyid kyi lo la stan phyi ma gnyis pa byed na nyes byas so / zin na spang pa'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis lo gang la stan byas nas de nyid kyi lo la stan phyi ma gnyis pa byed na nyes byas so / zin na spang pa'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If a monk makes a seat in a certain year and makes a second new seat in that same year, it is a minor infraction. If it is finished, it is a serious infraction.

original: stan byas pa las ma zin te de nyid bor ba ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: stan byas pa las ma zin te de nyid bor ba ni nyes byas so //
translated: If he makes a seat and does not finish it in that year, and then discards it, it is a minor infraction.

original: dge slong phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brda dang / gzhan gyi slad du lo drug tshun chad du stan byed du bcug na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brda dang / gzhan gyi slad du lo drug tshun chad du stan byed du bcug na nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk has a seat made for himself by another, using a messenger, a note, or a sign, or for the sake of another, for up to six years, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rgyu rung la spun mi rung ba dang gnyis ka mi rung ba las byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu rung la spun mi rung ba dang gnyis ka mi rung ba las byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he has it made with suitable material but unsuitable thread, or with both suitable and unsuitable material, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rkun gnas dang / so sor gnas pa dang / mu stegs can dang / 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa la byed du bcug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkun gnas dang / so sor gnas pa dang / mu stegs can dang / 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa la byed du bcug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he has it made by a novice monk, a trainee nun, a novice nun, a person living in the community without being fully admitted, a monastic Buddhist from another religion, or a person belonging to a different religion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gding ba sar pa la rnying pa mtho gang gis glan pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gding ba sar pa la rnying pa mtho gang gis glan pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin story of the rule that a new sitting mat must be reinforced with a piece of cloth from an old one takes place in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na rgyal po zas gtsang ma'i bu 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i mtshan can rgyal thabs bor nas rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na rgyal po zas gtsang ma'i bu 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i mtshan can rgyal thabs bor nas rab tu byung ste /
translated: At that time in Śrāvastī, the son of King Śuddhodana, who had the marks of a wheel-turning king, had given up his royal status and gone forth.

original: bdud rnam pa bzhi btul nas bla na med pa'i ye shes thob ste /
analyzed: bdud rnam pa bzhi btul nas bla na med pa'i ye shes thob ste /
translated: He had defeated the four demons and attained unsurpassed wisdom.

original: dbus kyi yul du 'byung ngo zhes sgra kun du grags pa /
analyzed: dbus kyi yul du 'byung ngo zhes sgra kun du grags pa /
translated: It is said that he will appear in the central country.

original: byang phyogs kyi tshong pas thos nas /
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi tshong pas thos nas /
translated: Hearing this, merchants from the north

original: tshong pa de dag sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang phyag 'tshal ba'i phyir der 'ongs pa dang / de nas khyim bdag mgon med kyis tshong pa de khrid de sangs rgyas kyi gam du phyag byas nas slar 'khor te dge slong gi gnas su song ba dang /🔽dge slong dag nyin @74a * //
analyzed: tshong pa de dag sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang phyag 'tshal ba'i phyir der 'ongs pa dang / de nas khyim bdag mgon med kyis tshong pa de khrid de sangs rgyas kyi gam du phyag byas nas slar 'khor te dge slong gi gnas su song ba dang / dge slong dag nyin @74a * //
translated: came to serve and pay homage to the Buddha. Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍada, leading the merchants, paid homage to the Buddha and returned to the monks' quarters.🔽The monks

original: par bsam gtan byed pa'i gnas na dge slong dag nyin par stan la skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug 'dug pas /
analyzed: par bsam gtan byed pa'i gnas na dge slong dag nyin par stan la skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug 'dug pas /
translated: were in their daytime meditation place. The monks sat cross-legged on their seats during the day.

original: de ltar rdol to zhes khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis tshong pa la byas nas tshong pa dad pa skyes nas ras yug lnga brgya stan rgyur phul lo //
analyzed: de ltar rdol to zhes khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis tshong pa la byas nas tshong pa dad pa skyes nas ras yug lnga brgya stan rgyur phul lo //
translated: It is said that it will be like this. Anāthapiṇḍada, the householder, said this to the merchants. The merchants developed faith and offered five hundred bolts of cloth for seats.

original: dge slong dag gis stan rnying pa rnams bla gab med par phyi rol tu bor te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gis stan rnying pa rnams bla gab med par phyi rol tu bor te /
translated: The monks threw the old seats outside in the open air.

original: dge slong dag grong du chos ston la song ba'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das mal stan byul bar bzhed de gtsug lag khang du byon pa dang phyag dar khrod na stan mang po long long por 'dug pa gzigs nas khyim bdag dad pa dang bram ze ni sha🔽khrag zad zad du dge slong dag la sbyin na /
analyzed: dge slong dag grong du chos ston la song ba'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das mal stan byul bar bzhed de gtsug lag khang du byon pa dang phyag dar khrod na stan mang po long long por 'dug pa gzigs nas khyim bdag dad pa dang bram ze ni sha khrag zad zad du dge slong dag la sbyin na /
translated: He saw that the householder had faith and the brahmin had no faith.

original: dge slong dag ni tshod mi zin par spyod do zhes smad nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag ni tshod mi zin par spyod do zhes smad nas /
translated: He disparaged the monks, saying, “The brahmin gives to the monks again and again, but the monks use it without moderation.”

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan la dga' ba dang / tshod zin pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan la dga' ba dang / tshod zin pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: He praised the delight in the ascetic qualities and the moderation.

original: stan sar pa byed na sra zhing mi rdol bar bya ba dang / stan bzang po la chags pa mi sdug par bya ba'i phyir sar pa la rnying pa mtho gang gis glon cig ces 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: stan sar pa byed na sra zhing mi rdol bar bya ba dang / stan bzang po la chags pa mi sdug par bya ba'i phyir sar pa la rnying pa mtho gang gis glon cig ces 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: In order to make the new cushions firm and not easily torn, and in order to make attachment to good cushions unattractive, he established the training rule that one should cover a new cushion with a piece of cloth the size of a handspan.

original: sar pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa gnyis te byas pa dang / rnyed pa sar pa'o //
analyzed: sar pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa gnyis te byas pa dang / rnyed pa sar pa'o //
translated: “New” has two types: made and newly acquired.

original: skabs 'dir ni byas pa sar pa la bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni byas pa sar pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, “new” means not used.

original: stan zhes bya ba ni gding ba'o //
analyzed: stan zhes bya ba ni gding ba'o //
translated: “Seat” means a mat.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: “Bhikṣu” means one who has entered this Dharma.

original: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
translated: “To make” means by oneself or by others.

original: gding ba rnying pa kun la zhes bya ba ni gal te stan sar pa gnyis pa gzhan yod na de ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gding ba rnying pa kun la zhes bya ba ni gal te stan sar pa gnyis pa gzhan yod na de ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: “To all old mats” means if there is another new second mat, one should do it that way.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa ste /
translated: “The Sugata’s cubit” means the Sugata is the Teacher.

original: de'i mtho gang la mi tshad ma'i khru phyed dang do'o /
analyzed: de'i mtho gang la mi tshad ma'i khru phyed dang do'o /
translated: His cubit is half a vyāma, which is one and a half cubits.

original: kha dog mi sdug par bya ba'i phyir glon cig ces bya ba ni bzang po la chags pa'i gnyen po dang sra bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhe'o /
analyzed: kha dog mi sdug par bya ba'i phyir glon cig ces bya ba ni bzang po la chags pa'i gnyen po dang sra bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhe'o /
translated: “To make it ugly” means to make it unattractive as an antidote to attachment to beauty, and to make it strong.

original: ma glan tam zhes bya ba ni ma sbyar ba la bya'o //
analyzed: ma glan tam zhes bya ba ni ma sbyar ba la bya'o //
translated: “Not patched” means not applied.

original: kha dog mi sdug par bya ba'i phyir ma glan na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //🔽gding ba sar pa la rnying pas ma glan na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha dog mi sdug par bya ba'i phyir ma glan na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o // gding ba sar pa la rnying pas ma glan na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not patch a new sitting mat with an old piece of cloth, you commit an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: gding ba rnying pa zhigs te glan du mi rung na ma glan kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gding ba rnying pa zhigs te glan du mi rung na ma glan kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: If the old piece of cloth is torn and cannot be used as a patch, there is no offense.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sor gcig gam sor phyed phri ste glan na spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sor gcig gam sor phyed phri ste glan na spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you patch it with a piece of cloth that is less than one or one-and-a-half handspans long, you commit an offense entailing relinquishment.

original: gzhan la sbyin pa dang khyim pa bgyid du bcug pa ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin pa dang khyim pa bgyid du bcug pa ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If you give it to someone else or have a layperson make it, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rgyu dang spun mi rung ba phri ba'am ma phri ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang spun mi rung ba phri ba'am ma phri ste /
translated: If you do not remove the warp and weft threads, or do not remove them properly,

original: @74b glan na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @74b glan na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brdas bde bar gshegs pa'i sor gcig phri ste /
analyzed: phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brdas bde bar gshegs pa'i sor gcig phri ste /
translated: If you have someone else remove one handspan of warp and weft threads, or you remove it by means of a message or a sign,

original: byad du bcug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byad du bcug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: lam na bal khyer ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: lam na bal khyer ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na 'phags pa drug sde po dag nang bgros pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe na 'phags pa drug sde po dag nang bgros pa /
translated: At that time, the group of six noble ones discussed among themselves:

original: lhung bzed nag po can spre'u tshil gyis rkang pa bskus pa de dag ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i tshe na yang rnyed pa bsgrub cing skye bo mang po dga' bar gyur na /
analyzed: lhung bzed nag po can spre'u tshil gyis rkang pa bskus pa de dag ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i tshe na yang rnyed pa bsgrub cing skye bo mang po dga' bar gyur na /
translated: Those who have black bowls and smear their feet with monkey fat, when they go out and come back, they obtain offerings and are liked by many people.

original: bdag cag ni khron pa'i sbal pa dang 'dra ste gar yang mi 'ong bas rnyed pa yang nyung na rnyed pa sgrub cing 'phags pa 'char ba po ni gzhi na gtsug khang srung du bzhag la bdag cag lnga ni bal yul du rnyed pa sgrub tu 'dong ngo
analyzed: bdag cag ni khron pa'i sbal pa dang 'dra ste gar yang mi 'ong bas rnyed pa yang nyung na rnyed pa sgrub cing 'phags pa 'char ba po ni gzhi na gtsug khang srung du bzhag la bdag cag lnga ni bal yul du rnyed pa sgrub tu 'dong ngo
translated: We are like frogs in a well, not going anywhere, so we get few offerings. If we obtain offerings, let us leave Ārya Udayin to guard the monastery and the five of us will go to Nepal to obtain offerings.

original: zhes nas tshong pa dag yul du 'gro ba dang lhan cig tu bal yul du song ste /
analyzed: zhes nas tshong pa dag yul du 'gro ba dang lhan cig tu bal yul du song ste /
translated: Then, together with merchants going to the country, they went to Nepal.

original: slar 'khor ba'i tshe lhan cig tu dong dong ba las tshong pa dag gis shing rta bal gyis gang ba shing rta chag nas bal lam du bor ba las /
analyzed: slar 'khor ba'i tshe lhan cig tu dong dong ba las tshong pa dag gis shing rta bal gyis gang ba shing rta chag nas bal lam du bor ba las /
translated: When they returned to the world, they went together to the place where the merchants had been. The merchants had been carrying their wool on carts, but the carts had broken down, and they had left the wool on the road.

original: 'phags pa drug sde bal bslangs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa drug sde bal bslangs te /
translated: The six noble ones asked for the wool.

original: bzhis ni bal khur re re khyer /
analyzed: bzhis ni bal khur re re khyer /
translated: Four of them each took a load of wool,

original: gcig gis ni bzhi po'i yo byad rnams khur khyer te /
analyzed: gcig gis ni bzhi po'i yo byad rnams khur khyer te /
translated: and one of them took the four loads of provisions.

original: tshong pa sngar gseb lam du dong dong ba las /
analyzed: tshong pa sngar gseb lam du dong dong ba las /
translated: The merchants went on ahead.

original: ri brags kyi dge slong dang grong mi dag gis mthong nas /
analyzed: ri brags kyi dge slong dang grong mi dag gis mthong nas /
translated: The monks of the mountain village and the townspeople saw them.

original: bal lang gis dmag 'ong ngo ri brags kyi grong mi rnams 'bros pa dang / dge slong khur khyer ba la mu stegs can dang bal bdag 'phya zhing /
analyzed: bal lang gis dmag 'ong ngo ri brags kyi grong mi rnams 'bros pa dang / dge slong khur khyer ba la mu stegs can dang bal bdag 'phya zhing /
translated: The townspeople of the mountain village fled, saying, The wool-bearing army is coming! The non-Buddhists and the owners of the wool ridiculed the monk who was carrying the load.

original: ma dad pa dang / mnyan du yod par 'ongs pa dang / khur chen po sa la bzhag pa'i tshe sgra chen po byung bas /
analyzed: ma dad pa dang / mnyan du yod par 'ongs pa dang / khur chen po sa la bzhag pa'i tshe sgra chen po byung bas /
translated: They were disrespectful, and when they arrived in Śrāvastī and the monk put down his heavy load with a loud noise,

original: dge slong rnams ma dad cing 'phya bar gyur te de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas so //
analyzed: dge slong rnams ma dad cing 'phya bar gyur te de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas so //
translated: the monks were disrespectful and ridiculed him. They reported the matter to the Teacher.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde po rnams la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde po rnams la /
translated: Then the Blessed One asked the group of six:

original: khyed kyis mi mdzes pa de lta bu byas pa bden nam zhes rmas na /
analyzed: khyed kyis mi mdzes pa de lta bu byas pa bden nam zhes rmas na /
translated: “Is it true that you did such an ugly thing?”

original: btsun pa mad do zhes gsol nas dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin dgos pa dang mthun pa dang rigs pa ma yin zhes smad nas /
analyzed: btsun pa mad do zhes gsol nas dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin dgos pa dang mthun pa dang rigs pa ma yin zhes smad nas /
translated: “Yes, Venerable,” they said, and after they were scolded for doing what was not a monk’s work, what was not proper, and what was not right,

original: dge slong gis bal lam du khyer du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong gis bal lam du khyer du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: the Blessed One laid down the training rule that monks are not allowed to carry wool.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
translated: “A monk” means one of the group of six,

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: or another who is similar.

original: lam du zhugs zhes bya ba ni mya ngan gyi lam mam /
analyzed: lam du zhugs zhes bya ba ni mya ngan gyi lam mam /
translated: “On a road” means on a road of sorrow,

original: skye bo mang po 'gro ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: skye bo mang po 'gro ba'i lam mo //
translated: or on a road traveled by many people.

original: rnyed ces bya ba ni gzhan las so //
analyzed: rnyed ces bya ba ni gzhan las so //
translated: “Obtained” means from another.

original: lug gi bal zhes bya ba ni spu'o //
analyzed: lug gi bal zhes bya ba ni spu'o //
translated: “Wool” means the hair of sheep.

original: dge slong des 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong des 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: “If the monk wishes” means if he has a need.

original: long shig ces bya ba ni blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: long shig ces bya ba ni blang bar bya'o //
translated: “Should take” means should accept.

original: blangs nas dpag tshad gsum gyi bar du rang gis khyer cig ces bya ba ni @75a * //
analyzed: blangs nas dpag tshad gsum gyi bar du rang gis khyer cig ces bya ba ni @75a * //
translated: Having taken it, carry it yourself for three yojanas.

original: dpag tshad gsum las mi 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad gsum las mi 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: One should not go beyond three yojanas.

original: gzhan gyis khyer pa med ces bya ba ni rung bar byed pa'am g-yog med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khyer pa med ces bya ba ni rung bar byed pa'am g-yog med pa'o //
translated: Not carried by another means not having it carried by another or not having it carried by a servant.

original: de las 'das par zhes bya ba ni thal ba'o //
analyzed: de las 'das par zhes bya ba ni thal ba'o //
translated: Exceeding that means exceeding the three yojanas.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung bshags par bya'o //
translated: A downfall that requires relinquishment and confession means that one must relinquish the wool and confess the downfall.

original: dge slong gis bal khyer nas dgon pa'i lam du zhugs te /
analyzed: dge slong gis bal khyer nas dgon pa'i lam du zhugs te /
translated: If a monk takes wool and enters a road in the wilderness,

analyzed: rgyang grags phyed dam grong gcig nas gcig tu byung na nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: he commits one offense of wrong conduct for every half league or every village he passes.

original: rgyang grangs gcig tu phyin na spang pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhva dang / lham dang / lcag pod kyi rgyu ni khyer kyang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rgyang grangs gcig tu phyin na spang pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ro // zhva dang / lham dang / lcag pod kyi rgyu ni khyer kyang ltung ba med do //
translated: If he goes one league, he commits a downfall that requires relinquishment.🔽There is no offense if the cause is boots, shoes, or a whip.

original: lug gi bal dpag tshad gsum las 'das par khyer yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /
analyzed: lug gi bal dpag tshad gsum las 'das par khyer yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /

original: dmus long rnams la bskur na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmus long rnams la bskur na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sends a messenger, a letter, a sign, a series of intermediaries, a madman, a person whose mind is disturbed, a person afflicted by illness, a fool, a mute, a deaf person, or a blind person, it is a fault in all cases.

original: bal khur bcol ba las slad kyis ma gnang pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bal khur bcol ba las slad kyis ma gnang pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The story of the wool that was entrusted to someone else but later not given is as follows. The Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe drug sde po rnams bal yul nas rnyed pa'i bal sngar ni lngar bgo bar chad pa las slad kyis 'char bas g-yo byas nas drug tu bgos so //
analyzed: de'i tshe drug sde po rnams bal yul nas rnyed pa'i bal sngar ni lngar bgo bar chad pa las slad kyis 'char bas g-yo byas nas drug tu bgos so //
translated: At that time, the group of six monks, having obtained wool from Nepal, previously divided it into five shares. Later, when they were distributing it, they cheated and divided it into six shares.

original: de nas 'char bas bsams pa bdag gis bal gyi skal ba 'di khyim mi mo la bcol na ni khyim mi mo yang khrims med pas brkus su'ang /
analyzed: de nas 'char bas bsams pa bdag gis bal gyi skal ba 'di khyim mi mo la bcol na ni khyim mi mo yang khrims med pas brkus su'ang /
translated: Then Ārṇa thought, “If I entrust this share of wool to a laywoman, she may steal it because she has no sense of ethics.

original: dge slong ma bcu bdun sde la bcol na ni bza' ba'i rin 'og tu btang yang dag na goo ta m'i skye dgu'i bdag mo ni 'khor dang bas par 'dul ba 'dzin pa yin gyi de la bcol lo snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: dge slong ma bcu bdun sde la bcol na ni bza' ba'i rin 'og tu btang yang dag na goo ta m'i skye dgu'i bdag mo ni 'khor dang bas par 'dul ba 'dzin pa yin gyi de la bcol lo snyam du bsams nas /
translated: But Gotami, the mother of the Buddha, is a holder of the Vinaya and has a large retinue. I will entrust it to her.

original: 'char ba song song ba dang skye dgu'i bdag mo dang lam du phrad nas 'char bas smras pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bsod nams dang ldan pa ni bsams pa bzhin du 'grub bo zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'char ba song song ba dang skye dgu'i bdag mo dang lam du phrad nas 'char bas smras pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bsod nams dang ldan pa ni bsams pa bzhin du 'grub bo zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan du mi 'gyur te /
translated: So she went to the mother of the Buddha and they met on the road. Utpala said, “The Blessed One said, ‘Those who have merit accomplish their goals as they wish.’ This is not the case for others.🔽I have some merit, but I have only a little wool. I will entrust it to the mother of the Buddha.”

original: bdag la yang bsod nams yod lta zhig / bdag la bal nyung zhig mchis na skye dgu'i bdag mo la bcol lo zhes byas pa dang / mo na re de ltar rung gis da ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal du 'gro yi don nod len pa btang gis skur cig ces byas so //
analyzed: bdag la yang bsod nams yod lta zhig / bdag la bal nyung zhig mchis na skye dgu'i bdag mo la bcol lo zhes byas pa dang / mo na re de ltar rung gis da ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal du 'gro yi don nod len pa btang gis skur cig ces byas so //
translated: She said, “That is fine. Now I am going to pay homage at the feet of the Buddha. I will take your message.”

original: de nas dge slong ma gnyis len du btang na bal chun po dam ches pas khur lci ste /
analyzed: de nas dge slong ma gnyis len du btang na bal chun po dam ches pas khur lci ste /
translated: Then, when two nuns were sent to fetch it, the wool was so tightly packed that it was too heavy to carry.

original: dge slong ma gnyis kyang ngal te nyal zhing 'dug @75b pa gzhan gyis mthong nas khyed gnyis ci'i phyir nyal zhes smras na /
analyzed: dge slong ma gnyis kyang ngal te nyal zhing 'dug @75b pa gzhan gyis mthong nas khyed gnyis ci'i phyir nyal zhes smras na /
translated: The two nuns were tired and lay down to rest. When others saw them, they said, “Why are you two lying down?”

original: de'i lo rgyus zhib tu de gnyis kyis smras so //
analyzed: de'i lo rgyus zhib tu de gnyis kyis smras so //
translated: The two nuns told them the story in detail.

original: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo yang bal mang po de mthong nas bal mang mod kyi skyes bu dang dam pa rnams ni khas blangs pa rnams la lcogs par bya dgos /
analyzed: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo yang bal mang po de mthong nas bal mang mod kyi skyes bu dang dam pa rnams ni khas blangs pa rnams la lcogs par bya dgos /
translated: Then the head of the community of nuns saw the great amount of wool and said, “There is a lot of wool, but those who are great and good must fulfill their promises.🔽Either you must take it or you must give it to others.”🔽Then she immediately sent out her disciples, who divided up the wool and gave it to everyone. When it was all gone, they sent it up to the top of the mountain.

original: yang na ni len dgos zhes nas 'phral la slob ma rnams kha bkram nas kun la bcol te byas nas zin te 'char ba'i steng du bskur te goo ta m'i skye dgu'i bdag mo lag pa shin tu dmar ba ni btso blags mkhan gyi lag pa dang 'dra
analyzed: yang na ni len dgos zhes nas 'phral la slob ma rnams kha bkram nas kun la bcol te byas nas zin te 'char ba'i steng du bskur te goo ta m'i skye dgu'i bdag mo lag pa shin tu dmar ba ni btso blags mkhan gyi lag pa dang 'dra
translated: Gautamī, the head of the community of nuns, had very red hands, like the hands of a cook.

original: bar gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba'i tshe /
analyzed: bar gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba'i tshe /
translated: When she bowed down at the feet of the Buddha,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs nas bkas rmas pa ji ltar gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs nas bkas rmas pa ji ltar gyur /
translated: The Blessed One saw this and asked, “What happened?

original: 'char bas bal bgyid du stsal to zhes gsol to //
analyzed: 'char bas bal bgyid du stsal to zhes gsol to //
translated: ” Udayin said, “I was ordered to do it.”

original: rigs pa ma yin zhes smad nas bslab pa bcas nas yang dge slong zhes smos so dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin zhes smad nas bslab pa bcas nas yang dge slong zhes smos so dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, “This is not right,” and after rebuking him and establishing a training rule he said, “Monks, a monk should not have wool washed, or dyed, or carded by a nun.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: If he has it done, he becomes guilty of an offense.”🔽“A nun” means one who has gone forth in this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: gnyen ma yin zhes bya ba ni pha ma'i zung bdun rgyud tshun chad ni gnyen yin no //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin zhes bya ba ni pha ma'i zung bdun rgyud tshun chad ni gnyen yin no //
translated: “A relative” means up to seven generations of parents.

original: de phan chad ni gnyen ma yin no //🔽dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de phan chad ni gnyen ma yin no // dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Beyond that, she is not a relative.

original: lug gi bal zhes bya ba ni spu'o //
analyzed: lug gi bal zhes bya ba ni spu'o //
translated: “Wool” means sheep’s wool.

original: 'khrur bcol zhes bya ba ni tha na chu'i nang du bcol ba tsam yang ngo //🔽'tshed du bcol ba zhes bya ba ni tha na tshon gyi nang du bsubs pa tsam yang ngo //
analyzed: 'khrur bcol zhes bya ba ni tha na chu'i nang du bcol ba tsam yang ngo // 'tshed du bcol ba zhes bya ba ni tha na tshon gyi nang du bsubs pa tsam yang ngo //
translated: “To have it washed” means to have it washed even in water.🔽“To have it dyed” means to have it dyed even with a single color.

original: rmel du bcol zhes bya ba ni tha na tshums gcig tsam mam /
analyzed: rmel du bcol zhes bya ba ni tha na tshums gcig tsam mam /
translated: “To have it carded” means to have it carded even with a single carding.🔽“A single carding” means a single carding.

original: 'dab ma gcig tsam mo //
analyzed: 'dab ma gcig tsam mo //
translated: “A single leaf” means a single leaf.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: “A downfall that requires relinquishment” means that the wool must be relinquished and the downfall confessed.

original: nyes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the offense?

original: dge slong gis gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la gnyen ma yin par 'du shes bzhin du lug gi bal 'khrur bcol na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la gnyen ma yin par 'du shes bzhin du lug gi bal 'khrur bcol na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk who is not a relative asks a nun who is not a relative to wash wool, thinking that she is not a relative, he commits a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: 'tshed du bcug na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'tshed du bcug na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he asks her to spin it, he commits a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: rmel du bcol na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽gnyen ma yin pa la ma yin pa'i 'du shes sam the tshom za bzhin du bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmel du bcol na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro // gnyen ma yin pa la ma yin pa'i 'du shes sam the tshom za bzhin du bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he asks her to weave it, he commits a downfall that requires relinquishment.🔽If he asks a nun who is not a relative, thinking that she is a relative, or if he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong ma gnyen ma lags pa la phrin dang phrin yig dang / lag brda dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de bcol ba ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma gnyen ma lags pa la phrin dang phrin yig dang / lag brda dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de bcol ba ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he asks a nun who is a relative to send a message, a letter, or a sign, or to pass on a request from one person to another, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong ma smyon ma dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / glen pa dang / lkugs pa dang 'on pa la 'khrur bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma smyon ma dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / glen pa dang / lkugs pa dang 'on pa la 'khrur bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one asks a nun who is insane, or who is overwhelmed by pain, or whose mind is disturbed, or who is a simpleton, or who is mute, or who is deaf, to wash it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mtshams med spa lnga byas pa dang / khyim mi mo la bcol na nyes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams med spa lnga byas pa dang / khyim mi mo la bcol na nyes su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one asks a lay vow-holder who has committed any of the five heinous actions, or a lay woman, to wash it, one commits an offense.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / bslab pa byin pa la 'khrur bcol na spang ba'i ltung @76a * //🔽bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / bslab pa byin pa la 'khrur bcol na spang ba'i ltung @76a * // bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one asks a schismatic or one who has been granted leave to remain in the community to wash it, one commits a serious violation.

original: mi rung ba dang 'dres pa ni rnga mo'i bal dang / ra'i bal dang ri dags kyi bal dang 'dres pa zhig 'khrul bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rung ba dang 'dres pa ni rnga mo'i bal dang / ra'i bal dang ri dags kyi bal dang 'dres pa zhig 'khrul bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one asks to wash a mixture of unsuitable wool, such as that of a camel, a goat, or a rabbit, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gzhan gyi bal zhig 'khrur bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bal zhig 'khrur bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one asks to wash another’s wool, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la 'khrur bcol ba dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / khyim pa mo dang / mu stegs can dang / 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa la 'khrur bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la 'khrur bcol ba dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / khyim pa mo dang / mu stegs can dang / 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa la 'khrur bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one asks an unordained person to wash it, or a fully ordained nun, or a novice monk or nun, or a male or female lay practitioner, or a non-Buddhist, or someone who has taken up another spiritual path, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sa le sbram len du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab bya ka lan da ka gnas pa'i 'od ma'i tshal na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sa le sbram len du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab bya ka lan da ka gnas pa'i 'od ma'i tshal na bzhugs so //
translated: The story of the prohibition against accepting gold and silver: The Blessed One was staying in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana near Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po'i khab na blon po dang grong dpon gtsug na nor bu la sogs pa dpong sar tshogs nas rtog cing dpyod pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po'i khab na blon po dang grong dpon gtsug na nor bu la sogs pa dpong sar tshogs nas rtog cing dpyod pa la zhugs te /
translated: At that time, in Rājagṛha, the ministers and the heads of the guilds, including Maṇi­caitya, had gathered in the town square and were discussing and debating.

original: la la na re sh'akya'i dge sbyong dag la gser rung ngo zhes zer ro /
analyzed: la la na re sh'akya'i dge sbyong dag la gser rung ngo zhes zer ro /
translated: Some said, “It is appropriate to give gold to the Śākya monks.”

original: la la ni mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la ni mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others said, “It is not appropriate.”

original: la la na re gser dngul su la rung ba de la ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang shing rta la sogs pa yang rung ngo //
analyzed: la la na re gser dngul su la rung ba de la ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang shing rta la sogs pa yang rung ngo //
translated: Some said, “It is proper for anyone to accept gold and silver, and also the five sense pleasures, chariots and so on.”

original: zhes zer na de ci 'dra ba zhu ba'i phyir grong dpon gtsug na nor bus ched du song ste sangs rgyas la zhus nas /
analyzed: zhes zer na de ci 'dra ba zhu ba'i phyir grong dpon gtsug na nor bus ched du song ste sangs rgyas la zhus nas /
translated: In order to ask the Buddha what was proper, the village chief Śikhī went to him and asked.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: gser dngul ni dge sbyong len du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gser dngul ni dge sbyong len du mi rung ngo //
translated: “It is not proper for a monk to accept gold and silver.🔽It is proper to accept chariots and so on offered by benefactors.”

original: shing rta la sogs pa yon bdag gis phul ba ni len du rung ngo zhes gnang ba dang / khyim bdag song gi 'og tu gser dngul len du mi gnang ngo zhes bka' ni stsal na 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas ma bcas so //
