analyzed: shing rta la sogs pa yon bdag gis phul ba ni len du rung ngo zhes gnang ba dang / khyim bdag song gi 'og tu gser dngul len du mi gnang ngo zhes bka' ni stsal na 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas ma bcas so //
translated: After the householder left, the Buddha said, “Do not accept gold and silver.”

original: slad kyis bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs pa'i tshe dge slong drug sde po rnams rang gi lag gis sa le sbram dang / dngul len cing len du 'jug //
analyzed: slad kyis bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs pa'i tshe dge slong drug sde po rnams rang gi lag gis sa le sbram dang / dngul len cing len du 'jug //
translated: Later, when the Bhagavān was staying in Śrāvastī, the group of six monks accepted gold and silver with their own hands and made others accept it.

original: phung po gcig dang / phung po gnyis dang / phung po du mang byed /
analyzed: phung po gcig dang / phung po gnyis dang / phung po du mang byed /
translated: one lump, two lumps, or many lumps.

original: stan gyi steng dang khri steng skyed cing 'jog pas na /
analyzed: stan gyi steng dang khri steng skyed cing 'jog pas na /
translated: They would make the lumps and then put them on the seats or on the platforms.

original: mu stegs can rnams kyang dge slong 'di dag khyim pa dang khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyang dge slong 'di dag khyim pa dang khyad par ci yod /
translated: The tīrthikas said, “What is the difference between these monks and householders?

original: bsam pa ni ci tha dad ces 'phya zhing mi snyan par 'dzer to /
analyzed: bsam pa ni ci tha dad ces 'phya zhing mi snyan par 'dzer to /
translated: What is the point of their being separate?” They disparaged them and spoke unpleasantly to them.

original: de ltar gyur pa dge slong rnams kyis snyan du gsol nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa dge slong rnams kyis snyan du gsol nas /
translated: The monks complained and reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: bkas drug sde po la rmas na /
analyzed: bkas drug sde po la rmas na /
translated: The Blessed One asked the group of six monks,🔽“Is it true that you did this?”

original: mad do zhes gsol nas rung ba ma yin zhes bya ba rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
analyzed: mad do zhes gsol nas rung ba ma yin zhes bya ba rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
translated: “It’s true,” they replied. The Blessed One rebuked them, “Foolish men, it is not suitable, it is not proper, it is not worthy of a monastic, it is not allowable, it is not to be done.

original: sa le sbra ma len du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: sa le sbra ma len du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: You should not take gold and silver.”🔽The Blessed One then instructed the monks,

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde po ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde po ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Monks, you should not take gold and silver.🔽If a monk takes gold and silver with his own hands, or has it taken, or says, ‘Take it,’ or makes a sign, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni lag gis 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni lag gis 'dzin pas so //
translated: Taking with one’s own hands: taking it oneself.

original: sa le sbram zhes bya ba ni gser @76b dang dngul lo //
analyzed: sa le sbram zhes bya ba ni gser @76b dang dngul lo //
translated: Gold and silver: gold and silver coins.

original: len zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: len zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “One takes” means that one takes it oneself.

original: len du bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan la'o //
analyzed: len du bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan la'o //
translated: “One makes another take” means that one makes another take it.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //🔽nyes pa ni 'di nas long 'di snyed cig long /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o // nyes pa ni 'di nas long 'di snyed cig long /
translated: “A downfall that requires relinquishment and confession” means that one must confess the downfall after relinquishing the object.🔽“A downfall that requires confession” means that one must confess the downfall.🔽“A minor infraction” means that one has committed a minor infraction.

original: 'di snyed cig khyer shog ces bsgo ba'i tshe na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig khyer shog ces bsgo ba'i tshe na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one tells another, “Take so much from here,” or “Bring so much from there,” one commits a minor infraction.

original: blang na ni spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blang na ni spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one takes it, one commits a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: dge slong gis gser dang dngul la reg na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis gser dang dngul la reg na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk touches gold or silver, he commits a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: nor bu dang mu tig dang beed'urya la reg na re res kyang spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor bu dang mu tig dang beed'urya la reg na re res kyang spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he touches a precious stone, a pearl, or a beryl, he commits a downfall that requires relinquishment for each item.

original: zangs dang lcags dang / ro nye dang tshon mo steng la reg na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: zangs dang lcags dang / ro nye dang tshon mo steng la reg na nyes pa med do //
translated: If he touches copper, iron, lead, or tin, he commits no offense.

original: de la gser dngul rjes su gnang ba ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs pa'i tshe yul tsam pa na khyim bdag bsam pa dge ba zhig gis gtsug lag khang zhig brtsigs nas dge slong mang zhig spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de la gser dngul rjes su gnang ba ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs pa'i tshe yul tsam pa na khyim bdag bsam pa dge ba zhig gis gtsug lag khang zhig brtsigs nas dge slong mang zhig spyan drangs te /
translated: When the Bhagavat was in Śrāvastī, a householder with virtuous thoughts built a temple and invited many monks.

original: dbyar zla ba gsum tshul du zhugs so //
analyzed: dbyar zla ba gsum tshul du zhugs so //
translated: They entered the three month rainy season retreat.

original: de nas dbyar zla ba gsum 'das nas tshul nas byung ste mnyan du yod par sangs rgyas gyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal du dong ba'i tshe khyim bdag la gos bslangs na gos 'phral du ma 'byor nas gos rin k'ar sh'a pa na byin na ston pas ma gnang🔽nas ma blangs so //
analyzed: de nas dbyar zla ba gsum 'das nas tshul nas byung ste mnyan du yod par sangs rgyas gyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal du dong ba'i tshe khyim bdag la gos bslangs na gos 'phral du ma 'byor nas gos rin k'ar sh'a pa na byin na ston pas ma gnang nas ma blangs so //
translated: After the three months of the rainy season had passed, they left the retreat and went to Śrāvastī to bow down to the Buddha’s feet. When they asked the householder for robes, he did not immediately have any robes, so he gave them the price of robes, one kārṣāpaṇa coin.🔽The Teacher did not permit it, so they did not accept it.

original: ma blangs pa dge slong dag la byas pa dang / dge slong gis snyan du gsol te /
analyzed: ma blangs pa dge slong dag la byas pa dang / dge slong gis snyan du gsol te /
translated: The householder gave it to the monks, and the monks reported it to the Teacher.

original: khyim bdag dad pas byin na dge slong dag gis len du rung bar thugs rjes dgongs te /
analyzed: khyim bdag dad pas byin na dge slong dag gis len du rung bar thugs rjes dgongs te /
translated: The Teacher thought with compassion, “If a faithful householder gives it, it is suitable for the monks to accept it.”

original: long shig blangs nas sbyin bdag gis bsngos te tshongs shig yang na kun dga' ra ba pa'am /
analyzed: long shig blangs nas sbyin bdag gis bsngos te tshongs shig yang na kun dga' ra ba pa'am /
translated: Give it to the Sangha and let the Sangha sell it.🔽

original: dge bsnyen la zhog shig /
analyzed: dge bsnyen la zhog shig /
translated: If he does not take it, he should give it to the monastery’s caretaker or to a lay practitioner.

original: yon bdag ma shi'i bar du yon bdag la bsngor rung ngo //
analyzed: yon bdag ma shi'i bar du yon bdag la bsngor rung ngo //
translated: If the donor is not dead, it is appropriate to dedicate the gold and silver to him.

original: yon bdag shi'am yon bdag med na gser dngul dge slong gcig gi mdun du zhog la dngos po rung ba ma yin pa 'di bdag gis rnyed de /
analyzed: yon bdag shi'am yon bdag med na gser dngul dge slong gcig gi mdun du zhog la dngos po rung ba ma yin pa 'di bdag gis rnyed de /
translated: If the donor is dead, or if there is no donor, the gold and silver should be placed in front of a single monk and he should say, ‘I have found this inappropriate thing.

original: rung ba ma yin pa 'dis rung ba'i gos shig bsgrub po zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa 'dis rung ba'i gos shig bsgrub po zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
translated: With this inappropriate thing, I will obtain an appropriate piece of cloth.’ He should say this a second and a third time.

original: dge slong gis phrin dang phrin yig dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de len du bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis phrin dang phrin yig dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de len du bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk has a messenger or a letter or a series of messages sent to him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: pha rol smyon pa dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / glen pa dang / 'on pa dang / lkugs pa la gser dngul len du bcug kyang rung ste nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol smyon pa dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / glen pa dang / 'on pa dang / lkugs pa la gser dngul len du bcug kyang rung ste nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he has a mad man, or a man afflicted by a disease, or a fool, or a mute, or a monk who is not fully ordained receive gold and silver, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gser dngul blangs kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba yod de /
analyzed: gser dngul blangs kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba yod de /
translated: There is no offense in accepting gold and silver.🔽

original: bdag gir bya ba'i sems med de /🔽gzhan la sbyin par bsam pa dang mi rung bas rung ba'i dngos po gzhan btsal lo snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gir bya ba'i sems med de / gzhan la sbyin par bsam pa dang mi rung bas rung ba'i dngos po gzhan btsal lo snyam mo //
translated: There is no offense in accepting gold and silver when there is no thought of making them one's own.

original: mtshan ma @77a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma @77a * //
translated: When one thinks of giving them to others, or when one thinks of exchanging them for something suitable, there is no offense.🔽The story of the prohibition against using the sign of the Buddha

original: btab pa yo byad du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: btab pa yo byad du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was staying at Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe byang phyogs kyi tshong pa la gcer bu pas lung bstan pa dang / 'dir ni sngar gtam thos pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun yin no snyam nas de la tshong pas byang phyogs kyi shing tog dang la ba bzang po zhig byin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe byang phyogs kyi tshong pa la gcer bu pas lung bstan pa dang / 'dir ni sngar gtam thos pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun yin no snyam nas de la tshong pas byang phyogs kyi shing tog dang la ba bzang po zhig byin no //
translated: At that time, the Nirgranthas predicted good fortune to merchants from the north, saying, The Buddha is staying here. The community of disciples is the same as before. The Buddha is the same as before. The merchants gave them good fruit and honey from the north.

original: de'i grogs dag gis je ta'i tshal du dom du btang ba dang / bsnyen dga' bo dze ta'i sgo na 'dug pas chos bshad de bdag gi la ba ngan pa dang brjes pa dang / de nas gcer bu pa'i grogs po dag gis 'dug tu ma ster te na na thur cher byas nas phyir len du bcug pa dang /
analyzed: de'i grogs dag gis je ta'i tshal du dom du btang ba dang / bsnyen dga' bo dze ta'i sgo na 'dug pas chos bshad de bdag gi la ba ngan pa dang brjes pa dang / de nas gcer bu pa'i grogs po dag gis 'dug tu ma ster te na na thur cher byas nas phyir len du bcug pa dang /
translated: His friends sent him to Jetavana, where he met Upasena and exchanged his poor robe for his.🔽Then the naked ascetic's friends would not let him stay. He became very angry and demanded his robe back.🔽He asked the Buddha, who ordered him, If you do not give it back, you will vomit blood and die. Give it back! He searched his house and gave it back.

original: ma ster nas sangs rgyas la gsol pa dang / ma byin na khrag gis skyugs te 'chi bas slar byin cig par bkas gtad de des khyim phyags nas slar byin no de ltar mtshan ma btab pas bzang ngan brjes pa dag byung mod kyi bslab pa ma bcas so //
analyzed: ma ster nas sangs rgyas la gsol pa dang / ma byin na khrag gis skyugs te 'chi bas slar byin cig par bkas gtad de des khyim phyags nas slar byin no de ltar mtshan ma btab pas bzang ngan brjes pa dag byung mod kyi bslab pa ma bcas so //
translated: Thus, although they exchanged robes by marking them, they did not establish a precept.

original: slad kyis mnyan du yod pa na dge slong drug sde po rnams mtshan ma btab pa rnam pa sna tshogs la spyod cing spogs byed de /
analyzed: slad kyis mnyan du yod pa na dge slong drug sde po rnams mtshan ma btab pa rnam pa sna tshogs la spyod cing spogs byed de /
translated: Later, in Śrāvastī, the group of six monks engaged in various kinds of marking and bartering.

original: skyed gtong bun 'gyed lhag tshol gser dngul brdungs pa dang / ma brdungs pa gnyis brje zhing spogs byed /🔽'bras bu dang nas gsar tog gnyis las gsum mam /
analyzed: skyed gtong bun 'gyed lhag tshol gser dngul brdungs pa dang / ma brdungs pa gnyis brje zhing spogs byed / 'bras bu dang nas gsar tog gnyis las gsum mam /
translated: They lent out gold and silver, both minted and unminted, at interest, and traded by exchanging one unminted coin for two minted ones.🔽They lent out rice and new barley at interest, and traded by exchanging three measures of one for two measures of the other.

original: gcig las gnyis su bun 'gyed pa dang / dung gis mu tig brje ba dang / mu tig gis nor bu rin po che brje bar lhag tshol /
analyzed: gcig las gnyis su bun 'gyed pa dang / dung gis mu tig brje ba dang / mu tig gis nor bu rin po che brje bar lhag tshol /
translated: They traded by exchanging conches for pearls and pearls for precious jewels.

original: de ltar byed pas na mu stegs can rnams 'phya zhing smod pas dge slong rnams kyis snyan du gsol te /
analyzed: de ltar byed pas na mu stegs can rnams 'phya zhing smod pas dge slong rnams kyis snyan du gsol te /
translated: Because they did this, the tīrthikas ridiculed and disparaged them. The monks reported this to the Blessed One,

original: da slan chad mtshan ma btab pa rnam pa sna tshogs la spyod cing bzang ngan brjer mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: da slan chad mtshan ma btab pa rnam pa sna tshogs la spyod cing bzang ngan brjer mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: and he decreed, “From now on, you should not engage in various kinds of bartering and exchanging of goods, whether good or bad. This is to be included in the training.”

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde pho ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde pho ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A monk” means a monk of the group of six or another similar monk.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma'o //
translated: “Various kinds” means many kinds.

original: mtshan ma btab pa la spyod par byed ces bya ba ni spogs byed pa dang / skyed gtong ba dang / bun 'gyed pa dang / lhag tshol ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma btab pa la spyod par byed ces bya ba ni spogs byed pa dang / skyed gtong ba dang / bun 'gyed pa dang / lhag tshol ba'o //
translated: “To engage in the use of names” means to engage in commerce, to lend money, to lend grain, and to lend at interest.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: “A downfall that requires confession” means to confess a downfall after having abandoned the object.

original: dge slong gis gser dngul lam /
analyzed: dge slong gis gser dngul lam /
translated: If a monk touches gold, silver,

original: yul phyogs su brin pa'i rdzas gang yang rung ba dang / nas 'bras skyed dang bun 'gyed pa'i tshe na ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul phyogs su brin pa'i rdzas gang yang rung ba dang / nas 'bras skyed dang bun 'gyed pa'i tshe na ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: or any object that is used as money in a certain place, or if he touches grain, seeds, or money in order to lend them at interest, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: spogs dang / khe bdag gi lag par thob na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spogs dang / khe bdag gi lag par thob na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he receives money in his hand in order to trade or to lend at interest, he commits a serious violation.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi phyir ram bu lon gyi 'og tu bsab pa'am gzhan @77b la sbyin pa ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi phyir ram bu lon gyi 'og tu bsab pa'am gzhan @77b la sbyin pa ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he does so for the sake of the Three Jewels, if he repays a debt, or if he gives to others.

original: phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brda dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
analyzed: phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brda dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
translated: If he sends a message, a letter, or a sign,

original: nor sna tshogs spogs byed pa ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor sna tshogs spogs byed pa ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: or if he engages in various kinds of commerce through an intermediary, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sems 'khrugs pa dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / gleng pa dang / 'on pa dang / lkugs pa dang 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa dang / lhan cig tu nor lhag spogs byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: sems 'khrugs pa dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / gleng pa dang / 'on pa dang / lkugs pa dang 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa dang / lhan cig tu nor lhag spogs byed na nyes byas so //
translated: If he does business with a person who is insane, who is sick, who is suspended, who is a paṇḍaka, who is a hermaphrodite, who is a novice monk, who is a nun, who is a male lay practitioner, who is a female lay practitioner, who is a non-Buddhist, who is a renunciant of another Buddhist school, who is a novice monk or nun, who is a student or postulant nun, who is a person of an animal species, who is a person with a distorted or confused mind, who is afflicted by a disease, who is mute, who is deaf, who is mute and deaf, who is a person of another type, or who is a person of another realm, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mi la mir 'du shes na spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi la mir 'du shes na spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the other person is a human, and he perceives him as such, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: mi la mi ma lags par 'du shes na nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi la mi ma lags par 'du shes na nyes byas so //
translated: If the other person is a human, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mi ma yin pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies if the other person is not a human.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs kha dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa na btang yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs kha dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa na btang yang nyes byas so //
translated: If he gives it to someone who has completed the rainy season residence or to someone who has not completed the rainy season residence, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nor sna tshogs la spogs byas kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba yang yod de rin thang 'dra mtshungs par brjes pa'o //
analyzed: nor sna tshogs la spogs byas kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba yang yod de rin thang 'dra mtshungs par brjes pa'o //
translated: There is no offense if he trades various goods for various goods, but the value must be the same.🔽As with a monk, so it is with one who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous assembly.

original: dge slong la spang bar 'gyur ba bzhin du bslab pa byin pa dang / dge slong ma la yang de bzhin no //🔽dge slong ma dang dge tshul pho mo la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong la spang bar 'gyur ba bzhin du bslab pa byin pa dang / dge slong ma la yang de bzhin no //🔽dge slong ma dang dge tshul pho mo la yang de bzhin no //
translated: As with a monk, so it is with a nun, a trainee nun, and a novice nun.

original: bslab pa'i gnas 'dir ji lta ba bzhin du nyo zhing 'tshong ba la yang de bzhin du sbyor cig / nyo tshong byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa dze ta'i tshal na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gnas 'dir ji lta ba bzhin du nyo zhing 'tshong ba la yang de bzhin du sbyor cig / nyo tshong byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa dze ta'i tshal na bzhugs so //
translated: The basis for the prohibition against buying and selling is this: The Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park.

original: de'i tshe dge slong drug sde po rnams sngar mtshan ma btab pas spogs byed cing dngos skyed /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong drug sde po rnams sngar mtshan ma btab pas spogs byed cing dngos skyed /
translated: At that time, the group of six monks made a profit by first marking goods and then inflating the price.

original: gnyis ka len par mi gnang bas na nyo zhing tshong byed pa la zhugs te /🔽dngos ni rin 'og tu thal byung du gtong zhing spogs byed de ji ltar na nyo zhing 'tshong zhe na /🔽nam rin thang chung ba de na nyos te bzhag nas nam rin che ba de na 'tshong ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka len par mi gnang bas na nyo zhing tshong byed pa la zhugs te / dngos ni rin 'og tu thal byung du gtong zhing spogs byed de ji ltar na nyo zhing 'tshong zhe na / nam rin thang chung ba de na nyos te bzhag nas nam rin che ba de na 'tshong ba'o //
translated: Since they were not allowed to buy and sell, they engaged in buying and selling.🔽They gave the goods at a low price and made a profit. How did they buy and sell?🔽When the price was low, they bought and stored the goods. When the price was high, they sold them.

original: lo legs pa'i tshe ni nyos te bzhag nas nam lo nyes shing rin che ba'i tshe ni phar 'tshong bar byed de /
analyzed: lo legs pa'i tshe ni nyos te bzhag nas nam lo nyes shing rin che ba'i tshe ni phar 'tshong bar byed de /
translated: When there was a good harvest, they bought and stored the goods. When there was a bad harvest and the price was high, they sold them.

original: de ltar nyo tshong rnam pa sna tshogs byed pas na mu stegs can rnams 'phya zhing smod de /
analyzed: de ltar nyo tshong rnam pa sna tshogs byed pas na mu stegs can rnams 'phya zhing smod de /
translated: Since they engaged in various kinds of buying and selling in this way, the tīrthikas ridiculed and disparaged them, saying,

original: dge slong sh'a kya'i bu rnams skyo zhing chog mi shes pa de dag khyim pa skya bo dang ni bye brag ni ci yod /
analyzed: dge slong sh'a kya'i bu rnams skyo zhing chog mi shes pa de dag khyim pa skya bo dang ni bye brag ni ci yod /
translated: “What is the difference between the monks, sons of the Śākya, and the lay people?🔽What is the difference in their thoughts?”

original: bsam pa ni cis tha dad ces mi snyan par zer ba de dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol to //
analyzed: bsam pa ni cis tha dad ces mi snyan par zer ba de dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this to the Blessed One.

original: drug sde rnams de ltar byed pa bden nam zhes rmas pa dang / mad do zhes gsol nas dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin rigs pa ma yin zhes smad nas nyo tshong byed du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: drug sde rnams de ltar byed pa bden nam zhes rmas pa dang / mad do zhes gsol nas dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin rigs pa ma yin zhes smad nas nyo tshong byed du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: “Is it true that the group of six acted in this way?” “It is true, Blessed One.” “Monks, this was not done well. This was not done properly.” He disparaged their actions and prohibited buying and selling. He then laid down the training rule.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde po ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde po ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: “Monks” means the group of six, and so on.

original: rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma'o //🔽nyo ba dang 'tshong bar byed ces bya ba ni kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma'o // nyo ba dang 'tshong bar byed ces bya ba ni kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: “In many ways” means in many forms.🔽“Buying and selling” means engaging in.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba @78a * //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba @78a * //
translated: “A downfall requiring relinquishment and confession” means

original: ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: If he has not given up the object, he must confess the transgression.

original: ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the transgression?

original: dge slong gis khe'i phyir 'tshong /
analyzed: dge slong gis khe'i phyir 'tshong /
translated: If a monk buys or sells for profit,

original: khe'i phyir nyon nyo ba'i tshe nyes byas so //
analyzed: khe'i phyir nyon nyo ba'i tshe nyes byas so //
translated: he commits an offense of wrong conduct when he haggles over the price.

original: btsongs te rin thob na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: btsongs te rin thob na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If he buys or sells after the price has been agreed upon, he commits a serious offense.

original: khe mi 'dod pa'i phyir nyo tshong byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: khe mi 'dod pa'i phyir nyo tshong byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: If he does not want to make a profit, there is no offense.

original: gzhan la sbyin pa'am bu lon chags pa'i phyir bsab pa la nyo tshod byas pa ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin pa'am bu lon chags pa'i phyir bsab pa la nyo tshod byas pa ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if he is giving something away or if he is repaying a debt by buying something for the same amount that he owes.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir nyo tshong rjes su gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das yul yangs pa can gyi khang bu brtsegs pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir nyo tshong rjes su gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das yul yangs pa can gyi khang bu brtsegs pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin story for the allowance to buy and sell for the Saṅgha: The Blessed One was staying in the manifold mansion in the town of Vaiśālī.

original: de'i tshe na byang phyogs kyi tshong pa sngon chad gtsug lag khang dag ma mthong bas de'i gtsug lag khang chen po zhig 'dug pa gsar du mthong nas de na dge slong 'khod pa dag la 'phags pa dag la bdag gis bshos gsol na bdag cag gsar du
analyzed: de'i tshe na byang phyogs kyi tshong pa sngon chad gtsug lag khang dag ma mthong bas de'i gtsug lag khang chen po zhig 'dug pa gsar du mthong nas de na dge slong 'khod pa dag la 'phags pa dag la bdag gis bshos gsol na bdag cag gsar du
translated: At that time, a merchant from the north, who had never seen a monastery before, saw this great monastery and asked the monks who were there, “Noble ones, if I offer food to you, I am new here and do not have any grain. I will pay for it with goods.”

original: lhags pas 'bras ma mchis kyis zong gis 'bras 'jal lo zhes byas pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis nyo tshong ma gnang ngo zhes ma byin pa dang snyan du bdas te dge 'dun gyi phyir 'bras tshong la rin long shig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lhags pas 'bras ma mchis kyis zong gis 'bras 'jal lo zhes byas pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis nyo tshong ma gnang ngo zhes ma byin pa dang snyan du bdas te dge 'dun gyi phyir 'bras tshong la rin long shig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One did not allow buying and selling, so he was not given permission. He appealed to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said, “For the sake of the saṅgha, buy grain with goods and give the price.”

original: de lta bu gsol pa mang ste de bzhin du sbyin pas dge 'dun bshos chad par gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu gsol pa mang ste de bzhin du sbyin pas dge 'dun bshos chad par gyur te /
translated: There were many such requests. In the same way, because of giving, the saṅgha’s food supply was cut off.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: zong gis 'bras gsar pa nyos la /
analyzed: zong gis 'bras gsar pa nyos la /
translated: “Buy new grain with goods.

original: rnying pa kun tshong gyis shig ces rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: rnying pa kun tshong gyis shig ces rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: Sell all the old grain.” He gave permission.

original: spang ba nyi shu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba nyi shu pa rdzogs so /
translated: The twenty exclusions are complete.

original: // / spang ba'i bcu phung tha ma ltung bzed lhag ma bcang du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / spang ba'i bcu phung tha ma ltung bzed lhag ma bcang du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The basis for the prohibition against keeping an extra alms bowl is as follows: The Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe bsnyen dga' bos 'di snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: de'i tshe bsnyen dga' bos 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: At that time, Upāli thought this:

original: mgon med zas sbyin gyis snyan du gsol nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas te //
analyzed: mgon med zas sbyin gyis snyan du gsol nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas te //
translated: Anāthapiṇḍada has requested it, and a rule has been established.

original: rnyed pa yang rab tu nyung nas mi dga' ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa yang rab tu nyung nas mi dga' ste /
translated: But since the gains are very small, I am unhappy.

original: khang thog tu 'dzegs te bltas nas skyed mos tshal na sun zin pa drug cu 'dus shing 'khod pa mthong nas der rnyed pa zhig ma grub na bdag gi ming bsnyen dga' bo zhes mi bya mod snyam du bsams nas der song ste de dag la chos bshad
analyzed: khang thog tu 'dzegs te bltas nas skyed mos tshal na sun zin pa drug cu 'dus shing 'khod pa mthong nas der rnyed pa zhig ma grub na bdag gi ming bsnyen dga' bo zhes mi bya mod snyam du bsams nas der song ste de dag la chos bshad
translated: I will go up to the roof and look. He saw sixty exhausted people gathered and sitting in the park. He thought, If I don't get any gains there, I will not be called Upāli. Thinking this, he went there and explained the Dharma to them.

original: de dad par byas pa dang / de na gcig na re 'phags pa la yon zhig 'bul na ci mkho zhes byas pa dang / bdag la lhung bzed mkho'o zhes byas so //
analyzed: de dad par byas pa dang / de na gcig na re 'phags pa la yon zhig 'bul na ci mkho zhes byas pa dang / bdag la lhung bzed mkho'o zhes byas so //
translated: When he inspired faith in them, one of them said, Noble one, if we offer a gift, what do you need? He said, I need an alms bowl.

original: lhung bzed ni ma mchis na zong zhig 'bul na ji tsam re /
analyzed: lhung bzed ni ma mchis na zong zhig 'bul na ji tsam re /
translated: “I don’t have a begging bowl, but I’ll give you some goods. How much do you want?”🔽“Sixty kārṣāpaṇas.” He gave him sixty kārṣāpaṇas. The other took them and went away.

original: k'ar sh'a pa na drug cu ri'o zhes byas pa dang / des k'ar sh'a pa na dug cu byin na gzhan la yang de'i thang du phab nas khyer ba dang / phyis su na zin pa rnams kyis bsod snyoms pa zhig la dge slong la ltung ba zed du dgos zhes smras pa dang /
analyzed: k'ar sh'a pa na drug cu ri'o zhes byas pa dang / des k'ar sh'a pa na dug cu byin na gzhan la yang de'i thang du phab nas khyer ba dang / phyis su na zin pa rnams kyis bsod snyoms pa zhig la dge slong la ltung ba zed du dgos zhes smras pa dang /
translated: Later, when the sick monks said to the alms-collector, “We need a begging bowl for the monk,”🔽he said, “One is enough.”

original: @78b gcig las mi dgos so zhes smras pa dang / dge sbyong sh'akya'i bu ni 'dod pas gzir ba zhes de dag 'phya'o //
analyzed: @78b gcig las mi dgos so zhes smras pa dang / dge sbyong sh'akya'i bu ni 'dod pas gzir ba zhes de dag 'phya'o //
translated: They criticized him, saying, “The ascetic Gautama is tormented by desire.”

original: de byung yang de'i mod la bslab pa la ma bcas so //
analyzed: de byung yang de'i mod la bslab pa la ma bcas so //
translated: Even though that happened, he did not immediately make a rule.

original: slad kyis bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: slad kyis bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: Later, when the Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī,

original: drug sde po rnams lhung bzed mang du rnyed cing thob pa rnams bsogs te bdag cag nyid kyang mi spyod gzhan yang spyod du mi ster to //
analyzed: drug sde po rnams lhung bzed mang du rnyed cing thob pa rnams bsogs te bdag cag nyid kyang mi spyod gzhan yang spyod du mi ster to //
translated: the group of six monks collected many begging bowls that they had obtained and did not use them themselves or give them to others.

original: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
translated: When that happened, they reported it to the Blessed One.

original: drug sde bo rnams la bkas rmad na /
analyzed: drug sde bo rnams la bkas rmad na /
translated: The group-of-six monks were reprimanded by the Blessed One.

original: mad do zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: mad do zhes gsol nas /
translated: “We are not guilty, Blessed One.”

original: dge slong gi bya ba ma yin rigs pa ma yin zhes smad nas /
analyzed: dge slong gi bya ba ma yin rigs pa ma yin zhes smad nas /
translated: “It is not right for monks to do that.”

original: zhag bcu las lhung bzed lhag ma 'chad du ma gnang bar bcas so //
analyzed: zhag bcu las lhung bzed lhag ma 'chad du ma gnang bar bcas so //
translated: He did not allow them to keep an extra alms-bowl for more than ten days.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A monk” means the group-of-six monks, and so on.

original: lhung bzed lhag ma zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa las lhag pa'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed lhag ma zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa las lhag pa'o //
translated: “An extra alms-bowl” means more than one consecrated bowl.

original: chongs shig ces bya ba ni zhag bcu'i bar du bdag gir bcangs pa'o //
analyzed: chongs shig ces bya ba ni zhag bcu'i bar du bdag gir bcangs pa'o //
translated: “Keep it” means to keep it for ten days.

original: de las 'das par bcangs na zhes bya ba ni zhag bcu las thal pa'o //
analyzed: de las 'das par bcangs na zhes bya ba ni zhag bcu las thal pa'o //
translated: “If he keeps it longer than that” means more than ten days.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: “A downfall requiring relinquishment and confession” means that he must relinquish the object and confess the downfall.

original: ltung bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na dge slong gis tshes gcig gi nyin par lhung bzed lhag ma zhig rnyed na zhag bcu tshun chad byin gyis rlobs shig //
analyzed: ltung bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na dge slong gis tshes gcig gi nyin par lhung bzed lhag ma zhig rnyed na zhag bcu tshun chad byin gyis rlobs shig //
translated: “What is the downfall?” If a monk obtains an extra alms-bowl on the first day of the month, he may keep it for ten days at the most.

original: yang na gzhan du skur cig //
analyzed: yang na gzhan du skur cig //
translated: Or he should send it to another place.

original: yang na gzhan la byin cig / de tshun chad du ma bskur ram gzhan la ma byin nam /
analyzed: yang na gzhan la byin cig / de tshun chad du ma bskur ram gzhan la ma byin nam /
translated: If you do not give it away or to someone else by that time,

original: yang na sde ma spangs te phyi ma byin gyis ma brlabs na tshes bcu gcig gi skya rangs shar na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na sde ma spangs te phyi ma byin gyis ma brlabs na tshes bcu gcig gi skya rangs shar na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or if you do not give up the group and consecrate it for the next life, then at dawn on the eleventh day, it becomes a downfall.

original: dge slong gis lhung bzed lhag pa de spang bar bya ba ma spangs /
analyzed: dge slong gis lhung bzed lhag pa de spang bar bya ba ma spangs /
translated: If a monk does not give up the extra alms bowl,

original: nyes pa ma bshags na /
analyzed: nyes pa ma bshags na /
translated: and does not confess the fault,

original: de tshun chad yo byad ci snyed pa kun snga ma'i rgyun gyis spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tshun chad yo byad ci snyed pa kun snga ma'i rgyun gyis spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then from that time on, whatever goods he has will become subject to the downfall.

original: zhag bcu las lhung bzed lhag par bcangs kyang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: zhag bcu las lhung bzed lhag par bcangs kyang nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault if he keeps the extra alms bowl for more than ten days,

original: dge slong gzhan gyis lhung bzed bskur ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyis lhung bzed bskur ba'o //
translated: if another monk sends him the bowl,

original: lhung bzed tshad las ches pa dang / chung ba dang / ma bsregs pa dang dkar po bcangs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: lhung bzed tshad las ches pa dang / chung ba dang / ma bsregs pa dang dkar po bcangs na nyes byas so //
translated: or if he keeps a bowl that is too big or too small, or one that is not baked, or one that is white.

original: dge slong smyos pa'i tshe zhag thal ba nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong smyos pa'i tshe zhag thal ba nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if the monk is insane.

original: phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brda dang / gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de lhung bzed lhag pa zhag bcu las 'das par bcangs kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brda dang / gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de lhung bzed lhag pa zhag bcu las 'das par bcangs kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one keeps an extra alms-bowl for more than ten days by means of a message, a letter, a sign, or by indication, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: lhung bzed gcig las lhag pa med kyang spang bar 'gyur ba yod de /
analyzed: lhung bzed gcig las lhag pa med kyang spang bar 'gyur ba yod de /
translated: Even if one does not have an extra bowl, it is an offense if one keeps an extra bowl.

original: lhung bzed byin gyis ma brlabs pa bcangs pa'o //🔽tshes gcig la bcangs kyang @79a * //
analyzed: lhung bzed byin gyis ma brlabs pa bcangs pa'o // tshes gcig la bcangs kyang @79a * //
translated: It is not an offense if one keeps an extra bowl that has not been consecrated.🔽It is not an offense if one keeps an extra bowl for less than one day.

original: nyes pa med de zhag bcu tshun chad kyis shi ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa med de zhag bcu tshun chad kyis shi ba'o //
translated: It is not an offense if one keeps an extra bowl for more than ten days, but less than one day.

original: lhung bzed spyad bzod pa yod bzhin du lhag par bzang po tshol du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: lhung bzed spyad bzod pa yod bzhin du lhag par bzang po tshol du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin story of the prohibition against seeking a better alms-bowl while one has a serviceable one took place in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na mnyam du yod pa na spos 'tshong ba'i khye'u zhig gnas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na mnyam du yod pa na spos 'tshong ba'i khye'u zhig gnas te /
translated: At that time, a young man who sold incense lived in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshod 'dus na lhung bzed spyad bzod pa bzang po zhig yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshod 'dus na lhung bzed spyad bzod pa bzang po zhig yod de /
translated: He had a good alms-bowl that was serviceable.

original: khye'u des nang par dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig der 'ongs pa la lhung bzed btsongs na ma 'dod do //
analyzed: khye'u des nang par dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig der 'ongs pa la lhung bzed btsongs na ma 'dod do //
translated: The young man said, “If you sell the begging bowl in the morning, a monk who begs for his food will come here.

original: dze ta'i tshal na dge slong gnas pa lhung bzed nyo ba lta yod na der btang du bcol zhes gsol to //
analyzed: dze ta'i tshal na dge slong gnas pa lhung bzed nyo ba lta yod na der btang du bcol zhes gsol to //
translated: If there is a monk living in Jetavana who wants to buy a begging bowl, send it there.”

original: dge slong des kyang dge slong dag la lhung bzed de 'dra ba zhig yod ces gtam byas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bos thos nas des gzhan la byas su dogs nas gzhan gyis mi thos par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge slong des kyang dge slong dag la lhung bzed de 'dra ba zhig yod ces gtam byas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bos thos nas des gzhan la byas su dogs nas gzhan gyis mi thos par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The monk told the other monks, “I have such and such a begging bowl.” Upali heard this and, fearing that someone else would buy it, in order to prevent others from hearing,🔽he said, “Are you only doing this kind of work and making a living?”

original: khyod de lta bu'i bya ba 'ba' zhig byed cing than skyel tam zhes byas nas de'i 'og tu gzhan med pa dang de la bzhams te khyim gang tsam na yod pa zhig tu dris nas tshong dus su bsnyen dga' bo gom pa brgyangs te song ba dang /
analyzed: khyod de lta bu'i bya ba 'ba' zhig byed cing than skyel tam zhes byas nas de'i 'og tu gzhan med pa dang de la bzhams te khyim gang tsam na yod pa zhig tu dris nas tshong dus su bsnyen dga' bo gom pa brgyangs te song ba dang /
translated: After that, when there was no one else, he asked in a low voice, “Where is it?” He went to the market place, stretched out his foot, and walked.

original: spos 'tshong ba'i khye'us kyang drug sde bo yin par shes nas lhung bzed sbas so //
analyzed: spos 'tshong ba'i khye'us kyang drug sde bo yin par shes nas lhung bzed sbas so //
translated: The young man who sold incense also recognized him as one of the group of six. He hid the begging bowl.

original: bsnyen dga' bos mthong nas lhung bzed blangs nas bzhin bzangs nad med cing sbyin pa 'dis khyed kyi sems kyi rgyan dang sems kyi yo byad dang rnal 'byor kyi tshogs dang don gyi mchog grub cing lha dang mi'i don du gyur cig ces byas pa dang 'phags pa
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bos mthong nas lhung bzed blangs nas bzhin bzangs nad med cing sbyin pa 'dis khyed kyi sems kyi rgyan dang sems kyi yo byad dang rnal 'byor kyi tshogs dang don gyi mchog grub cing lha dang mi'i don du gyur cig ces byas pa dang 'phags pa
translated: When Upāli saw him, he took his begging bowl and said, “Good man, may you be free from illness. By this gift may you have the mental adornments, the mental equipment, the requisites of a yogi, and may you achieve the highest goal for the benefit of gods and humans.”🔽The noble one said, “You’ve said a lot, but I won’t accept it until you pay the price.”🔽Upāli’s friend, a merchant, came there and said to Upāli, “I pay homage to you.”

original: khyod kyi sa mang zhig smras mod kyi rin med kyi bar du mi gsol lo zhes ma ster ba dang / bsnyen dga' bo dang bshes pa'i tshong dpon zhig der phyin de bsnyen dga' bo la phyag 'tshal lo zhes byas pa dang / khyed kyi phyag skam pos nga la ci bya /
analyzed: khyod kyi sa mang zhig smras mod kyi rin med kyi bar du mi gsol lo zhes ma ster ba dang / bsnyen dga' bo dang bshes pa'i tshong dpon zhig der phyin de bsnyen dga' bo la phyag 'tshal lo zhes byas pa dang / khyed kyi phyag skam pos nga la ci bya /
translated: Upāli said, “What use is your dry homage to me?🔽If you do what I want and then leave, that would be helpful.”

original: nga'i ci dag bsgrubs te phyin na phan mod ces byas pa dang / 'o na ngas ci bya lhung bzed de nyos te nga la byin na phan mod /
analyzed: nga'i ci dag bsgrubs te phyin na phan mod ces byas pa dang / 'o na ngas ci bya lhung bzed de nyos te nga la byin na phan mod /
translated: The merchant said, “Well then, what should I do? If you buy that begging bowl and give it to me, that would be helpful.”

original: des kyang nyos nas byin no //
analyzed: des kyang nyos nas byin no //
translated: The merchant bought it and gave it to him.

original: bsnyen dga' bos lhung bzed de khyer nas lhung bzed bzang po gzhan la spyoms shing ngom pa dang / dge slong gzhon nu zhig gis smras pa gnas brtan lhung bzed bzang po yod bzhin du gzhan la bslang ba'i rigs sam zhes byas pa dang / dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de ni bden no zhes 'phya bar gyur ba snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bos lhung bzed de khyer nas lhung bzed bzang po gzhan la spyoms shing ngom pa dang / dge slong gzhon nu zhig gis smras pa gnas brtan lhung bzed bzang po yod bzhin du gzhan la bslang ba'i rigs sam zhes byas pa dang / dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de ni bden no zhes 'phya bar gyur ba snyan du bdas nas /
translated: Other monks also criticized him, saying, “That is true.”🔽He was embarrassed and went to the Blessed One.

original: lhung bzed bzang po tshol du mi gnang bar bcas so //
analyzed: lhung bzed bzang po tshol du mi gnang bar bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One did not allow the search for a good alms bowl.

original: de ltar lhung bzed bzang po tshol du mi gnang ba dang / dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig lhung @79b bzed rdol te 'bras khu dag zags te /
analyzed: de ltar lhung bzed bzang po tshol du mi gnang ba dang / dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig lhung @79b bzed rdol te 'bras khu dag zags te /
translated: A monk who was a beggar had a cracked alms bowl and rice gruel dripped out.🔽Many flies gathered around it.

original: sbrang ma mang po 'du bar gyur pa bram ze'i bu dag gis tshong dpon dang ded dpon 'dra bar 'khor mang pos bskor to zhes 'phya bas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sbrang ma mang po 'du bar gyur pa bram ze'i bu dag gis tshong dpon dang ded dpon 'dra bar 'khor mang pos bskor to zhes 'phya bas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The sons of brahmans criticized him, saying, “He is like a merchant or caravan leader surrounded by a large retinue.”

original: lhung bzed rdol ba glon cig drubs shig / lhan pa lngar ma tshang gi bar du gzhan tshol du mi gnang bar bcas so //
analyzed: lhung bzed rdol ba glon cig drubs shig / lhan pa lngar ma tshang gi bar du gzhan tshol du mi gnang bar bcas so //
translated: And he did not allow them to seek another bowl until the old one had five patches on it.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste //
translated: A mendicant is a monk.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: And so on means and so forth.

original: lhung bzed lhan pa lnga las nyung ba zhes bya ba ni lngar ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed lhan pa lnga las nyung ba zhes bya ba ni lngar ma tshang ba'o //
translated: A broken alms-bowl with less than five patches is one with less than five patches.

original: spyad bzod par yod bzhin du zhes bya ba ni spyad du rung ba'o //
analyzed: spyad bzod par yod bzhin du zhes bya ba ni spyad du rung ba'o //
translated: A mendicant who is able to use it is one who is able to use it.

original: lhung bzed sar pa gzhan tshol zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed gzhan gnyis pa tshol ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed sar pa gzhan tshol zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed gzhan gnyis pa tshol ba'o //
translated: A new alms-bowl is a second bowl.

original: sar pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis sar pas sar pa dang / thob pas sar pa'o //
analyzed: sar pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis sar pas sar pa dang / thob pas sar pa'o //
translated: A new bowl is of two kinds: new in kind and new in acquisition.

original: skabs 'dir sar pa gnyi ga la bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir sar pa gnyi ga la bya'o //
translated: In this context, new means both kinds.

original: tshol zhes bya ba ni 'tshol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshol zhes bya ba ni 'tshol bar byed pa'o //
translated: To seek means to seek out.

original: bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma las lhag par bzang po 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma las lhag par bzang po 'dod pa'o //
translated: To desire a better one means to desire one better than the previous one.

original: lhung bzed de grub na zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed de grub na zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: The phrase if that alms bowl is obtained means if it is acquired.

original: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong de nyid do //
analyzed: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong de nyid do //
translated: The phrase that monk refers to the very same monk.

original: lhung bzed de dge 'dun gyi 'khor la dbul bar bya zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong 'khod pa'i 'khor der lhung bzed su ngan pa la phrogs te sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed de dge 'dun gyi 'khor la dbul bar bya zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong 'khod pa'i 'khor der lhung bzed su ngan pa la phrogs te sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The phrase that alms bowl should be offered to the assembly of monks means that it should be offered to the assembly of monks who are present there, and that the best of the alms bowls should be given to the monk who is the least advanced in seniority.

original: lhung bzed bzang po lhag pa 'drim pa'i dge slong pha gsol ba dang las kyis bskos shig / dge slong des lhung bzed thogs la rgan rims su gnas brten dang gsar bu'i bar du lhung bzed kyi yon tan bsngags shing 'di bzhed na snoms shig ces gnas brtan
analyzed: lhung bzed bzang po lhag pa 'drim pa'i dge slong pha gsol ba dang las kyis bskos shig / dge slong des lhung bzed thogs la rgan rims su gnas brten dang gsar bu'i bar du lhung bzed kyi yon tan bsngags shing 'di bzhed na snoms shig ces gnas brtan
translated: The monk who is distributing the extra good alms bowls should be appointed by means of a legal procedure consisting of an announcement of motion alone. That monk should take the alms bowls and, beginning with the most senior monk and proceeding in order of seniority down to the most junior monk, praise the good qualities of the alms bowls and say, If you want one, take it.

original: dang po la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang po la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: The most senior monk should be offered the best alms bowl.

original: des ma 'dod na dang 'og dang gsum la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: des ma 'dod na dang 'og dang gsum la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: If he does not want it, it should be offered to the second most senior monk, and so on down to the most junior monk.

original: gang gis lhung bzed bzang po khyer ba de'i lhung bzed ngan pa gnas brtan nas gcig tu brjes la nan gyis dge slong gsar bu la byin cig //
analyzed: gang gis lhung bzed bzang po khyer ba de'i lhung bzed ngan pa gnas brtan nas gcig tu brjes la nan gyis dge slong gsar bu la byin cig //
translated: The elder should take the bad bowl of the monk who has the good bowl and give it to the young monk.

original: dge slong lhung bzed lhag pa 'chang ba'i chad pa yang dge slong gi 'khor thams cad kyi lhung bzed ngan par gyur pa dge slong de la byin te /
analyzed: dge slong lhung bzed lhag pa 'chang ba'i chad pa yang dge slong gi 'khor thams cad kyi lhung bzed ngan par gyur pa dge slong de la byin te /
translated: The punishment for the monk who keeps an extra bowl is that all the monks’ bad bowls are given to that monk.

original: lhung bzed de byin gyis kyang ma brlabs gzhan la yang ma bskur /
analyzed: lhung bzed de byin gyis kyang ma brlabs gzhan la yang ma bskur /
translated: He should not consecrate that bowl, nor should he give it to another.

original: gzhan la yang ma byin par tha ma chag pa la thug gi bar du dal bus bags kyis spyad cig ces sgo shig / de'i chad pa dang mthun pa ni de yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la yang ma byin par tha ma chag pa la thug gi bar du dal bus bags kyis spyad cig ces sgo shig / de'i chad pa dang mthun pa ni de yin no //
translated: He should use it slowly, little by little, until it breaks. That is the punishment.🔽That monk should keep two bowls. He should put the unblessed bowl in the better of the two bowls, and he should put the blessed bowl in the worse one.

original: dge slong des kyang lhung bzed snod gnyis gyis la snod gang bzang ba'i nang du ni lhung bzed ma glan pa chug shig / ngan pa'i nang du ni byin gyis brlabs pa chug shig / zas bsod snyoms dang 'gro @80a * //
analyzed: dge slong des kyang lhung bzed snod gnyis gyis la snod gang bzang ba'i nang du ni lhung bzed ma glan pa chug shig / ngan pa'i nang du ni byin gyis brlabs pa chug shig / zas bsod snyoms dang 'gro @80a * //
translated: He should eat his alms-food in the worse bowl.

original: ba'i tshe ya gnyis ka thogs la kha zas skam po zhig rnyed na ma glan pa'i nang du ldugs shig / kha zas gsher ba zhig rnyed na byin gyis brlabs pa'i nang du ldugs shig / lhung bzed de yang ji srid 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang bar bya
analyzed: ba'i tshe ya gnyis ka thogs la kha zas skam po zhig rnyed na ma glan pa'i nang du ldugs shig / kha zas gsher ba zhig rnyed na byin gyis brlabs pa'i nang du ldugs shig / lhung bzed de yang ji srid 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang bar bya
translated: You should carry that begging bowl for as long as you live.

original: ste / de ni chad pa'o //
analyzed: ste / de ni chad pa'o //
translated: That is the rule.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: A downfall that requires confession is a downfall that must be confessed and the object given up.

original: dge slong gis lhung bzed spyad bzod pa yod la lhan pa lngas ma btab pa las lhung bzed lhag pa gzhan zhig tshol na tshol ba'i tshe nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong gis lhung bzed spyad bzod pa yod la lhan pa lngas ma btab pa las lhung bzed lhag pa gzhan zhig tshol na tshol ba'i tshe nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk who has a usable begging bowl seeks another begging bowl that is not patched with less than five pieces, he commits an offense of wrong conduct in the seeking.

original: grub na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: grub na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If he gets it, it is a downfall that requires confession.🔽The origin of the rule about having a non-relative weaver make robes

original: gnyen ma yin pa'i tha ga pa la gos 'thag tu bcug pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa'i tha ga pa la gos 'thag tu bcug pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was staying at Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe bsnyen dga' bos bsams pa khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis slong du mi gnang ba'i sdom pa bcas pas rnyed pa yang rab tu nyung na da cung zad rnyed pa dag sgrub po snyam nas khang thog tu 'dzegs te bltas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe bsnyen dga' bos bsams pa khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis slong du mi gnang ba'i sdom pa bcas pas rnyed pa yang rab tu nyung na da cung zad rnyed pa dag sgrub po snyam nas khang thog tu 'dzegs te bltas na /
translated: At that time Upāli thought, “Since the householder Anāthapiṇḍada has taken a vow not to give to beggars, his gains are very few. Now I will obtain some of the little he has.” He climbed to the roof of the house and looked around.

original: yugs sa mo bal 'khal ba lnga brgya tsam zhig dze ta'i tshal gyi shar sgo na 'dug pa mthong nas bsnyen dga' bo de dag gi gan du song ba dang / bud med gcig gis ni phyag byas kyi gzhan gyis ni ma byas so //
analyzed: yugs sa mo bal 'khal ba lnga brgya tsam zhig dze ta'i tshal gyi shar sgo na 'dug pa mthong nas bsnyen dga' bo de dag gi gan du song ba dang / bud med gcig gis ni phyag byas kyi gzhan gyis ni ma byas so //
translated: He saw about five hundred widows spinning wool at the eastern gate of Jetavana. Upāli went to them, and one of the women prostrated to him, but the others did not.

original: bsnyen dga' bos bud med gzhan gyis ni tshe phyi ma'i sa bon ma btab kyi bu mo 'di gcig pus tshe phyi ma'i sa bon btab po zhes smras pa dang / de ji lta bu zhes bud med rnams kyis dris pa dang / der chos bshad pas dad pa skyes te bud med rnams kyis 'phags pa yon zhig 'bul lo zhes pa dang /
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bos bud med gzhan gyis ni tshe phyi ma'i sa bon ma btab kyi bu mo 'di gcig pus tshe phyi ma'i sa bon btab po zhes smras pa dang / de ji lta bu zhes bud med rnams kyis dris pa dang / der chos bshad pas dad pa skyes te bud med rnams kyis 'phags pa yon zhig 'bul lo zhes pa dang /
translated: She taught them the Dharma, and they developed faith. They said, Noble one, we will offer you a gift.

original: bsnyen dga' bos smras pa /
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bos smras pa /
translated: The nun Utpalavarṇā said,

original: sangs rgyas 'khor dang bcas pa bshos gsol cig / de ni mi nus so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'khor dang bcas pa bshos gsol cig / de ni mi nus so //
translated: You should offer food to the Buddha and his retinue. We cannot do that.🔽 Then she said, You should invite the group of six.🔽 We cannot do that, they said. Then can you give me half a pound of thread?

original: 'o na drug sde po rnams spyan drongs shig / de yang mi nus so zhes smras pa dang / 'o na nga la skud pa srang phyed phyed tsam zhig dbul mi nus sam zhes smras pa dang / de ni nus so zhes nas kun gyis bsdus te byin pa dang de'i nang nas gnyis 'khal mkhas pas na de gnyis ka la bkal du bcol to //
analyzed: 'o na drug sde po rnams spyan drongs shig / de yang mi nus so zhes smras pa dang / 'o na nga la skud pa srang phyed phyed tsam zhig dbul mi nus sam zhes smras pa dang / de ni nus so zhes nas kun gyis bsdus te byin pa dang de'i nang nas gnyis 'khal mkhas pas na de gnyis ka la bkal du bcol to //
translated: They said, We can do that, and they all collected and gave it to her. Of them, two were skilled at spinning, so she asked them to spin it.

original: de nas skud pa bkal zin pa dang / de de khyer te tha ga pa spyi cer la 'thag tu bcol na de ma btub pa dang / des chos bshad de byas na de'i chung mas len du bcug ste byas pa dang / phyis rngan pa bdas na ma ster to //
analyzed: de nas skud pa bkal zin pa dang / de de khyer te tha ga pa spyi cer la 'thag tu bcol na de ma btub pa dang / des chos bshad de byas na de'i chung mas len du bcug ste byas pa dang / phyis rngan pa bdas na ma ster to //
translated: Then, when the yarn was spun, he took it to the weaver Pūtanā and asked him to weave it. Pūtanā could not do it.🔽He explained the Dharma to him, and his wife made him accept the job.🔽Later, when he was paid, he did not give any to the weaver.

original: phyis yang skud pa rnyed nas spyi cer la bcol pa dang snga ma'i rngan pa ma ster bas phyi ma yang ma btub nas de bzo dpon gyi gan du song ste /
analyzed: phyis yang skud pa rnyed nas spyi cer la bcol pa dang snga ma'i rngan pa ma ster bas phyi ma yang ma btub nas de bzo dpon gyi gan du song ste /
translated: Later, when he got more yarn, he gave it to Pūtanā. Because he had not been paid for the previous job, he could not do the new job. He went to the master weaver and said,🔽“If I do this for you, is it all right if I give the job to another weaver?”

original: de bzo dpon la byas na tha ga pa gzhan la bcol @80b du mi rung ngam zhes dris pa dang / bsnyen dga' bcos bsams pa sbyin cer yang shin tu mkhas la sngar 'thag tu ma btub pas 'khon yang yod pas spyi cer la mi bcol du mi rung ngo zhes lan du mar nan gyis bzo dpon la gsol nas /
analyzed: de bzo dpon la byas na tha ga pa gzhan la bcol @80b du mi rung ngam zhes dris pa dang / bsnyen dga' bcos bsams pa sbyin cer yang shin tu mkhas la sngar 'thag tu ma btub pas 'khon yang yod pas spyi cer la mi bcol du mi rung ngo zhes lan du mar nan gyis bzo dpon la gsol nas /
translated: “Pūtanā is very skilled, but because he could not do the previous job, he is angry. It is not all right to give it to Pūtanā.”🔽He made this request many times, insisting to the master weaver.

original: tha mar skud pa skyel ba'i rang mnos nas rang rtas bzo dpon gyi tshig gis thogs shig par bsgo na /
analyzed: tha mar skud pa skyel ba'i rang mnos nas rang rtas bzo dpon gyi tshig gis thogs shig par bsgo na /
translated: Finally, he took the thread and wove it himself. He said to the weaver, “Weave it with the words of the master weaver.”🔽The weaver could not do it. He was threatened with force many times and was pressured to weave it.🔽After the weaver had finished weaving it, he said, “Noble one, please give me the price of the beer.”🔽“You poor man, is what you are drinking mine?

original: ma btub nas lan du mar mthus bsdigs shing nan thur gyis 'thag tu bcug pas na tha ga pas btags zin pa'i 'og tu 'phags pa bdag cag gis chang rin zhig 'phags pa la gsol lo zhes byas na bkren pa khyod ci bcang ba nga'i yin nam dug
analyzed: ma btub nas lan du mar mthus bsdigs shing nan thur gyis 'thag tu bcug pas na tha ga pas btags zin pa'i 'og tu 'phags pa bdag cag gis chang rin zhig 'phags pa la gsol lo zhes byas na bkren pa khyod ci bcang ba nga'i yin nam dug
translated: What is wrong with drinking poison?”

original: 'thung na ci nyes zhes bsgo ba dang / khyim bdag de yang ma dad par gyur nas dge sbyong sh'a kya'i bu de dag ni chos kyis bsgo nas /
analyzed: 'thung na ci nyes zhes bsgo ba dang / khyim bdag de yang ma dad par gyur nas dge sbyong sh'a kya'i bu de dag ni chos kyis bsgo nas /
translated: The householder also became faithless and said, “Those śramaṇas, sons of Śākya, are not to be spoken to with the Dharma.

original: rgyal po dang blon po'i mthus 'thag tu bcug go zhes mi snyan par 'dzer to //
analyzed: rgyal po dang blon po'i mthus 'thag tu bcug go zhes mi snyan par 'dzer to //
translated: They are made to weave by the power of the king and the ministers.” He said unpleasant things.

original: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas bkas rmas na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas bkas rmas na /
translated: When this was reported to the Blessed One,

original: bsnyen dga' bos mad do zhes gsol te /
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bos mad do zhes gsol te /
translated: Upāli said, “It is true.”

original: dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin zhes rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin zhes rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
translated: He criticized it in many ways, saying, “This is not the work of a śramaṇa.”

original: gnyen ma yin pa la 'thag tu mi gnang bar bcas so //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa la 'thag tu mi gnang bar bcas so //
translated: It is forbidden to have a non-relative weave.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste /
translated: The one who is called a bhikṣu is one who has been ordained.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The same applies to others.

original: bdag gis bslangs pa'i skud pa zhes bya ba ni ji tsam du dad pa ste /🔽la las srang phyed la las srang gnyis /
analyzed: bdag gis bslangs pa'i skud pa zhes bya ba ni ji tsam du dad pa ste / la las srang phyed la las srang gnyis /
translated: The one who is called the thread that I have requested is the one that I have requested.🔽Some give half a pala, some give two palas,

original: kha cig las ni zho gcig / kha gcig gis ni zho phyed phyed sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig las ni zho gcig / kha gcig gis ni zho phyed phyed sbyin pa'o //
translated: some give one karshapana, some give half a karshapana.

original: gnyen ma yin zhes bya ba ni gong ma dag dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin zhes bya ba ni gong ma dag dang 'dra'o //
translated: The one who is called a non-relative is as above.

original: tha ga pa zhes bya ba ni gos 'thag pa'o //
analyzed: tha ga pa zhes bya ba ni gos 'thag pa'o //
translated: The one who is called a weaver is the one who weaves cloth.

original: 'thag tu bcug ces bya ba ni bal gyi dang sha na'i shun pa dang / du gu la'i dang / shing bal gyi dang / rtsva ko tam dang / srin bal gyi dang de dag las gang yang rung ba 'thag tu bcol ba'o //
analyzed: 'thag tu bcug ces bya ba ni bal gyi dang sha na'i shun pa dang / du gu la'i dang / shing bal gyi dang / rtsva ko tam dang / srin bal gyi dang de dag las gang yang rung ba 'thag tu bcol ba'o //
translated: The one who is called I have had it woven is the one who has requested any of the following to be woven: wool, silk, cotton, linen, jute, or hemp.

original: grub ces bya ba ni lag tu thob pa'o //
analyzed: grub ces bya ba ni lag tu thob pa'o //
translated: The one who is called finished is the one who has obtained it in his hands.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: “A downfall that requires relinquishment” means that you must confess the downfall after relinquishing the article.

original: gnyen ma yin pa la skud pa dang bal slong ba'i tshe nyes byas so //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa la skud pa dang bal slong ba'i tshe nyes byas so //
translated: If you ask for thread or wool from someone who is not a relative, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gnyen ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcol na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcol na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you ask a non-relative to weave it, you commit a downfall that requires confession.

original: gnyen ma yin pa las skud pa bslangs te bdag nyid kyis btags na nyes byas su 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa las skud pa bslangs te bdag nyid kyis btags na nyes byas su 'gyur /
translated: If you ask a non-relative for thread and then weave it yourself, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gnyen las skud pa bslangs te gnyen la 'thag tu bcug pa ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gnyen las skud pa bslangs te gnyen la 'thag tu bcug pa ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If you ask a relative for thread and then ask a relative to weave it, there is no offense.

original: gla byin pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gla byin pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies if you pay for the work.

original: phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brda dang / gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de bcol ba dang / gzhan gyi phyir bcol ba ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brda dang / gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de bcol ba dang / gzhan gyi phyir bcol ba ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If you send a message, a letter, a sign, or if you ask someone to request it for you, or if you ask someone to request it for another person, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tha ga pa smyon pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / nad kyis @81a * //
analyzed: tha ga pa smyon pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / nad kyis @81a * //
translated: If the weaver is insane, has a confused mind, or is a novice,

original: gzir ba dang / glen pa dang / 'on pa dang / lkugs pa dang / mi ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzir ba dang / glen pa dang / 'on pa dang / lkugs pa dang / mi ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has a non-human being spin it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rgyu dang spun mi rung ba dang / gnyis ka mi rung dang 'dres pa 'thag tu bcug na nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang spun mi rung ba dang / gnyis ka mi rung dang 'dres pa 'thag tu bcug na nyes byas so //
translated: If one has a non-relative or a relative who is unsuitable spin it, or if one has both a relative and a non-relative spin it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'thag pa gnyis pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'thag pa gnyis pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of the second rule on spinning: The Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na khyim bdag khyo shug gnyis so sor 'phyo zhing nyal po byed pas nor kun 'thor zhing 'gribs par gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na khyim bdag khyo shug gnyis so sor 'phyo zhing nyal po byed pas nor kun 'thor zhing 'gribs par gyur te /
translated: At that time, a married couple was living separately and having sex. As a result, all their wealth was scattered and depleted.

original: khyo shug gnyis kyis len du mar bran mor brdegs so //
analyzed: khyo shug gnyis kyis len du mar bran mor brdegs so //
translated: The couple beat their maid to make her take the blame.

original: de ltar gyur pa bsnyen dga' bos rig nas de dag la chos bshad de khrims phog go //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa bsnyen dga' bos rig nas de dag la chos bshad de khrims phog go //
translated: Nandā, having heard what had happened, explained the Dharma to them and imposed a rule.

original: khrims phog pa'i 'og tu yang bran mo brdegs pa dang / de chung mas bdag cag sngon chad dang mi 'dra bar da bdag cag bden pa mthong na ci'i phyir brdeg ces smras pa dang / khos de ni bden no zhes nas bran mo la gos shig byin no //
analyzed: khrims phog pa'i 'og tu yang bran mo brdegs pa dang / de chung mas bdag cag sngon chad dang mi 'dra bar da bdag cag bden pa mthong na ci'i phyir brdeg ces smras pa dang / khos de ni bden no zhes nas bran mo la gos shig byin no //
translated: After the law was promulgated, the slave woman was beaten. She said to her husband, “We are not the same as before. Now that we have seen the truth, why do you beat me?” He said, “That is true.” He gave the slave woman a piece of clothing.

original: khyim bdag pho mo gnyis kyis bsams pa bdag cag bden pa mthong zhing sdig pa'i dri ma dang bral ba ni 'phags pa bsnyen dga' bo'i drin yin gyis de la gos shig sbyin no zhes sngar 'tham zhing 'khod pa bran mos thos nas bran mos bsams pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag pho mo gnyis kyis bsams pa bdag cag bden pa mthong zhing sdig pa'i dri ma dang bral ba ni 'phags pa bsnyen dga' bo'i drin yin gyis de la gos shig sbyin no zhes sngar 'tham zhing 'khod pa bran mos thos nas bran mos bsams pa /
translated: The male and female householders thought, “We have seen the truth and are free of the stains of sin. This is through the kindness of the noble Nanda. Let us give him a piece of clothing.” The slave woman heard them talking and embracing each other. The slave woman thought,

original: bdag la sngan chad de bzhin mi brdeg pa dang gos byin pa yang bsnyen dga' bo'i bka' drin yin na /
analyzed: bdag la sngan chad de bzhin mi brdeg pa dang gos byin pa yang bsnyen dga' bo'i bka' drin yin na /
translated: “In the past, I was not beaten like that and was given clothing because of the kindness of Nanda.

original: bdag gis len gzhan ni mi nus kyis gtam snyan pa tsam bskyal lo snyam nas gtam 'di bsnyen dga' bo la sbran no snyam nas bsnyen dga' bo der 'ongs pa la 'phags pa dga' ba skyed cig ces byas nas /
analyzed: bdag gis len gzhan ni mi nus kyis gtam snyan pa tsam bskyal lo snyam nas gtam 'di bsnyen dga' bo la sbran no snyam nas bsnyen dga' bo der 'ongs pa la 'phags pa dga' ba skyed cig ces byas nas /
translated: I cannot take it myself, but I will send a message to please the Exalted One. He thought, I will send this message to Upasena. He went to Upasena and said, Exalted One, please be pleased.🔽 He did not believe it and said, I will go back and see. Exalted One, please do not speak much. Go to Tagpa. He went to Tagpa and said, Exalted One, please be pleased.

original: de yang yid ma ches te phyir bsdigs na 'phags pa mang du smra mi 'tshal gyis thag pa'i gan du bzhud cig ces byas nas thag pa dad phrad nas gos de nga'i phyir 'thag pa yin gyis /
analyzed: de yang yid ma ches te phyir bsdigs na 'phags pa mang du smra mi 'tshal gyis thag pa'i gan du bzhud cig ces byas nas thag pa dad phrad nas gos de nga'i phyir 'thag pa yin gyis /
translated: He said, Exalted One, please do not speak much. Go to Tagpa. Tagpa and Upasena met and said, This cloth was woven for me.

original: thag ran bzang ba dang yug khyim che bar gyis shig ces bsgo nas /
analyzed: thag ran bzang ba dang yug khyim che bar gyis shig ces bsgo nas /
translated: Make the warp and weft good and large.

original: btsun mo phred ldan ma la bsod snyoms blangs pa'i la du lhung bzed gang tha ga ba la gra rngan du byin no //
analyzed: btsun mo phred ldan ma la bsod snyoms blangs pa'i la du lhung bzed gang tha ga ba la gra rngan du byin no //
translated: He gave the alms bowl filled with alms to Queen Prasenajit's wife as a gift for the weaver.

original: de nas thag pas skud pa mchog nas chung ma dang khyo las so sor lan re blangs te bsnan no /
analyzed: de nas thag pas skud pa mchog nas chung ma dang khyo las so sor lan re blangs te bsnan no /
translated: Then Tagpa spun the best thread and his wife and husband each took turns adding it.

original: slad kyis gnyis ka tshogs pa la yang blangs pa dang / de rnyed gyi rgyu zhig khyer na ci 'dra ba zhig ces khyim bdag gis bltas na /
analyzed: slad kyis gnyis ka tshogs pa la yang blangs pa dang / de rnyed gyi rgyu zhig khyer na ci 'dra ba zhig ces khyim bdag gis bltas na /
translated: The householder looked to see what kind of cloth it was that he wanted.

original: gos bzang po zhig nas de ni sbyin du mi rung gzhan zhig sbyin no zhes khyim bdag khyo shug gnyis kyis bgros pa tha ga pas thos nas bsnyen dga' bo la sbran no //
analyzed: gos bzang po zhig nas de ni sbyin du mi rung gzhan zhig sbyin no zhes khyim bdag khyo shug gnyis kyis bgros pa tha ga pas thos nas bsnyen dga' bo la sbran no //
translated: The householder and his wife discussed it and decided, This fine cloth is not suitable for giving. We will give him another. The weaver overheard this and told Upasena.

original: bsnyen @81b dga' bo dang thag pa gnyis kyis thabs byas nas /
analyzed: bsnyen @81b dga' bo dang thag pa gnyis kyis thabs byas nas /
translated: Upasena and the weaver devised a plan.

original: bsnyen dga' bo khyim bdag gi der chos bshad pa'i tshe tha ga pas snam bu khyer te 'ongs nas sngon du tshogs pa la phul lo //
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bo khyim bdag gi der chos bshad pa'i tshe tha ga pas snam bu khyer te 'ongs nas sngon du tshogs pa la phul lo //
translated: When Upasena went to the householder's house to teach the Dharma, the weaver brought the cloth and offered it to the assembly that had gathered there.

original: bsnyen dga' bos sbyin pa'i tshigs bcad sngar blangs te thal byung du khyer ro //
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bos sbyin pa'i tshigs bcad sngar blangs te thal byung du khyer ro //
translated: Upasena recited the verse on generosity that he had previously memorized and then left in a hurry.

original: de nas phyis tha ga bas khyim bdag la gla rngan bdas na khyod kyis nga'i gos dngos kyang stor bar byas na /
analyzed: de nas phyis tha ga bas khyim bdag la gla rngan bdas na khyod kyis nga'i gos dngos kyang stor bar byas na /
translated: Later, when the weaver demanded his wages from the householder, the householder said, You have stolen my cloth.

original: phyis gla sbyin pa lta ci smos zhes ma ster ro //🔽bsnyen dga' bo la gla rngan bdas na khyod khyim bdag las long shig ces nas lan du mar bdas na yang ma ster nas slad kyis bdas na nga'i la du'i mar dang sprang rtsi dang spod tshun chad brtsis na yang gla lhag par gyur na thag pa bzung
analyzed: phyis gla sbyin pa lta ci smos zhes ma ster ro // bsnyen dga' bo la gla rngan bdas na khyod khyim bdag las long shig ces nas lan du mar bdas na yang ma ster nas slad kyis bdas na nga'i la du'i mar dang sprang rtsi dang spod tshun chad brtsis na yang gla lhag par gyur na thag pa bzung
translated: How much more so if you are to be paid! And he would not give it to him.

original: ste nyi tshan la gzhag go //
analyzed: ste nyi tshan la gzhag go //
translated: He said to Upali, If you want to be paid for your work, you should ask the householder for it. He asked the householder many times, but was not given anything. Later he said, If you count the ghee, honey, and spices I used for my own food, the wages are still not enough. I will take the rope and put it in the sun to dry.

original: de yang gla ma byin pa'i steng du dngos kyang bzung bas 'phya zhing mi snyan par 'dzer bas de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas so //🔽bkas rmas na /
analyzed: de yang gla ma byin pa'i steng du dngos kyang bzung bas 'phya zhing mi snyan par 'dzer bas de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas so // bkas rmas na /
translated: He also said, You are not only not paying me, but you are also holding back my things. People will laugh at me and say bad things. I will tell people about this.

original: mad do zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: mad do zhes gsol nas /
translated: When he was scolded, he said, It is true.

original: rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad de /
analyzed: rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad de /
translated: He was scolded in many ways.

original: bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir zas cung zad tsam gyis gos bsgrubs te grub na spang ba'i ltung ba'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir zas cung zad tsam gyis gos bsgrubs te grub na spang ba'i ltung ba'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: If you obtain cloth for a small amount of food because you desire something good, it is a downfall that requires confession.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The term monk refers to Nanda and others like him.

original: gnyen zhes bya ba dang / gos zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bdun po gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gnyen zhes bya ba dang / gos zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bdun po gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The term relative and the term cloth are the same as the sevenfold classification above.

original: khyim bdag ces bya ba ni skyes pa'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag ces bya ba ni skyes pa'o //
translated: The term householder refers to a man.

original: chung ma zhes bya ba ni bud med do //
analyzed: chung ma zhes bya ba ni bud med do //
translated: The term wife refers to a woman.

original: 'thag tu bcol zhes bya ba ni bal rnam pa bdun gyi skud pa las gang yang rung ba'o //🔽sngar ma bsgo zhes bya ba ni sngar gos sbyin no //
analyzed: 'thag tu bcol zhes bya ba ni bal rnam pa bdun gyi skud pa las gang yang rung ba'o // sngar ma bsgo zhes bya ba ni sngar gos sbyin no //
translated: The term to weave refers to any of the seven types of wool thread.

original: zhes mgron du ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes mgron du ma byas pa'o //
