translated: The term not previously requested means not previously given cloth.🔽The term not previously invited means not previously invited to request cloth.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung zhes bya ba ni gzhan las thos pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung zhes bya ba ni gzhan las thos pa'o //
translated: The term some idea means having heard from others.

original: da'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: da'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: The term for that reason means for the sake of myself.

original: thag ran bzang zhing yug khyim che ba dang 'jur mdud med pa ni srid dang zheng 'di tsam du gyis la bzang por gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: thag ran bzang zhing yug khyim che ba dang 'jur mdud med pa ni srid dang zheng 'di tsam du gyis la bzang por gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The term good warp and woof means make it this much in length and width, and make it good.

original: bca' ba cung zad cig byin nas gos grub ces bya ba ni lag par thob pa'o //
analyzed: bca' ba cung zad cig byin nas gos grub ces bya ba ni lag par thob pa'o //
translated: Having given a little bit of cloth, he said, “Make a robe.” “Make a robe” means “Make it for my hand.”

original: dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: Having given up the object, he should confess the offense.

original: gos grub pa'i phyir 'thag pa la bsgo pa'i tshe ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: gos grub pa'i phyir 'thag pa la bsgo pa'i tshe ni nyes byas so //
translated: When he tells the weaver to make a robe, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: thob na ni spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: thob na ni spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: When he gets it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: 'di lta bu zhig long shig par bsgo ba ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhig long shig par bsgo ba ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he tells him to get such-and-such a robe.🔽The story of not allowing the taking back of a gift

original: byin phrog mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: byin phrog mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha was at Śrāvastī.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa nas yul ko sa lar ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa'i tshe dge slong drug sde po'i nang nas dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis sangs rgyas dang chos kyi @82a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa nas yul ko sa lar ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa'i tshe dge slong drug sde po'i nang nas dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis sangs rgyas dang chos kyi @82a * //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was traveling through the country of Kosala, going from Śrāvastī to Kauśala. Among the group of six monks, Nanda and Upananda said to the Buddha, “Blessed One, we will go to the village.”

original: yon tan sgrogs shing sngar 'gro bar dad de grogs med nas dga' bo'i slob ma chos can mkhan po la ma dad de kun dga' bo'i gan na 'dug pa chos gos sbyar ma'i rgyu zhig khyer te mkhan po la zhus te sbyar mar drub po zhes byas pa
analyzed: yon tan sgrogs shing sngar 'gro bar dad de grogs med nas dga' bo'i slob ma chos can mkhan po la ma dad de kun dga' bo'i gan na 'dug pa chos gos sbyar ma'i rgyu zhig khyer te mkhan po la zhus te sbyar mar drub po zhes byas pa
translated: He was a disciple of Nanda who had no faith in his preceptor Dharmadinnā. He stayed with Ānanda and took a piece of cloth to his preceptor, saying, “Preceptor, I will make a patched robe.”🔽He met a monk who lived on alms and said, “When you finish making your robe, ask me for an old one.” “ Fine,” he said. Dharmadinnā said to his preceptor, “Preceptor, I will make a patched robe.”

original: dang / de bsod snyoms pa zhig dang phrad de khyod chos gos drub zin pa dang / nga la rnying pa slong ngo zhes byas pa dang / rung ngo zhes nas chos can kyis mkhan po la chos gos drub po zhes zhus pa dang / dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis gros byas nas chos can la chos gos byin nas grogs su sngar khrid par bya ste /
analyzed: dang / de bsod snyoms pa zhig dang phrad de khyod chos gos drub zin pa dang / nga la rnying pa slong ngo zhes byas pa dang / rung ngo zhes nas chos can kyis mkhan po la chos gos drub po zhes zhus pa dang / dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis gros byas nas chos can la chos gos byin nas grogs su sngar khrid par bya ste /
translated: Nanda and Upasena discussed it and gave Dharmadinnā a robe and said, “We will take you as our companion.

original: khyod kyi chos gos drub mi dgos kyis zhes nas chos gos gcig byin no //
analyzed: khyod kyi chos gos drub mi dgos kyis zhes nas chos gos gcig byin no //
translated: You don’t need to make a robe.” They gave him a robe.

original: chos kyi chos gos rnying pa ni bsod snyoms pa la byin no //
analyzed: chos kyi chos gos rnying pa ni bsod snyoms pa la byin no //
translated: Dharmadinnā gave his old robe to the monk who lived on alms.

original: chos gos kyi rgyu ras sar pa ni dge 'dun la yon du phul lo //
analyzed: chos gos kyi rgyu ras sar pa ni dge 'dun la yon du phul lo //
translated: The cloth for the robe was offered as a gift to the Saṅgha.

original: chos can yang grogs su sngar khrid par byas pa dang slad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zha 'bring du 'gro zhes ma btub pa dang sbyar ma phyir phrogs so//
analyzed: chos can yang grogs su sngar khrid par byas pa dang slad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zha 'bring du 'gro zhes ma btub pa dang sbyar ma phyir phrogs so//
translated: Dharmadatta was previously instructed to be a friend, but later he was not able to go to the Buddha's presence, so he was forcibly taken back.

original: de nas yul ko sa lar gshegs te nyan thos kyi 'khor rnams la chos gos dang sham thabs legs par bgos sam ma bgos pa g-yas phyogs su sku thams cad kyis glang po che lta bu'i tshul du gzigs pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa chos can stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs gnyis phyogs su dang ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar gzigs nas dbyar gnas pa'i dge slong gis gos ma rnyed dam zhes kun dga' bo la rmas pa dang /
analyzed: de nas yul ko sa lar gshegs te nyan thos kyi 'khor rnams la chos gos dang sham thabs legs par bgos sam ma bgos pa g-yas phyogs su sku thams cad kyis glang po che lta bu'i tshul du gzigs pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa chos can stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs gnyis phyogs su dang ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar gzigs nas dbyar gnas pa'i dge slong gis gos ma rnyed dam zhes kun dga' bo la rmas pa dang /
translated: Then, going to the country of Kosala, he saw with his entire body turning to the right like an elephant that the assembly of śrāvakas had put on their Dharma robes and lower robes well, and he asked Ānanda, Did the monk who stayed in the rainy season not find any cloth?

original: chos gos kyang rnyed de de ltar phrogs so zhes snyan du gsol to //
analyzed: chos gos kyang rnyed de de ltar phrogs so zhes snyan du gsol to //
translated: The Dharma robe was found, but it was taken like this, he respectfully reported.

original: dge slong gi bya ba ma yin tshul ma yin zhes rnam grangs du mas smad nas slan chad byin phrogs mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong gi bya ba ma yin tshul ma yin zhes rnam grangs du mas smad nas slan chad byin phrogs mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: Having censured him in many ways, the Blessed One decreed the training rule of the monks not to steal back what was given.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni dga' bo dang / bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni dga' bo dang / bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A certain monk” refers to Nanda and Upananda, and others like them.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: “Monk” refers to one who has the Dharma.

original: gos zhes bya ba ni bal la sogs pa rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: gos zhes bya ba ni bal la sogs pa rnam pa bdun no //
translated: “Cloth” refers to the seven types of cloth, such as wool.

original: byin zhes bya ba ni sngar byin pa'o //
analyzed: byin zhes bya ba ni sngar byin pa'o //
translated: “Given” refers to what was given before.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan na'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan na'o //
translated: “Later” refers to another time.

original: khros zhes bya ba ni 'khrugs pa ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: khros zhes bya ba ni 'khrugs pa ma zhi ba'o //
translated: “Angry” refers to being upset and not at peace.

original: phrogs zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so //
analyzed: phrogs zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so //
translated: “Steal” refers to taking it oneself.

original: 'phrog tu bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: 'phrog tu bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis so //
translated: “Cause to steal” refers to having others take it.

original: gos kyi lhag ma yod pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe lhag ma tsam lus pa'o //
analyzed: gos kyi lhag ma yod pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe lhag ma tsam lus pa'o //
translated: “The remainder of the cloth” refers to just a small amount left at that time.

original: byin cig ces bya ba ni slar btang ba'o //
analyzed: byin cig ces bya ba ni slar btang ba'o //
translated: “Give it back” refers to returning it.

original: sbyin nas spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni slar blangs ma thag tu dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par @82b bya'o ;🔽/ nyes pa ni lus dang ngag gi sgo nas byin zin pa'i 'og tu khyer la shog ces smras sam /
analyzed: sbyin nas spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni slar blangs ma thag tu dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par @82b bya'o ; / nyes pa ni lus dang ngag gi sgo nas byin zin pa'i 'og tu khyer la shog ces smras sam /
translated: The offense of abandoning after giving is that, immediately after receiving a gift, one must confess the offense of abandoning the gift.🔽The offense is that, after giving, one says to the recipient, “Come and take it back,” or one takes it back oneself.

original: lus kyis phrogs kyang rung ste spang pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽de la don gzhan nam gdul ba'i phyir nyes pa med de ji ltar na gzhan gyi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyis phrogs kyang rung ste spang pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ro // de la don gzhan nam gdul ba'i phyir nyes pa med de ji ltar na gzhan gyi phyir zhe na /
translated: This is the offense of abandoning.🔽There is no offense if one does so for another purpose or for the sake of disciplining the recipient.

original: bdag la gnas bca' ba'am //
analyzed: bdag la gnas bca' ba'am //
translated: How is it for the sake of another?

original: bdag gi slob ma yul 'jigs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba la rkun po dang mi rgod kyis phrogs su dogs pa'i phyir phrogs pa 'am /
analyzed: bdag gi slob ma yul 'jigs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba la rkun po dang mi rgod kyis phrogs su dogs pa'i phyir phrogs pa 'am /
translated: If one gives to a student or a disciple who is going to a dangerous place, fearing that he will be robbed by thieves or brigands,

original: chus khyer du dogs pa'i phyir phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: chus khyer du dogs pa'i phyir phrogs pa'o //
translated: or fearing that he will be carried away by water.

original: ji lta na slob ma 'dul ba'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta na slob ma 'dul ba'i phyir zhe na /
translated: How is it for the sake of disciplining a student?

original: slob ma dang nye gnas sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur te bdag gi ngag mi nyan tam /
analyzed: slob ma dang nye gnas sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur te bdag gi ngag mi nyan tam /
translated: If a student or disciple has a sinful view and does not listen to one’s words,

original: dge ba la mi 'grus sam /
analyzed: dge ba la mi 'grus sam /
translated: or does not apply himself to virtue,

original: grogs po ngan pa sdig pa can la brten cing mkhan po slob dpon spong ba la 'dul ba'i phyir phrogs kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: grogs po ngan pa sdig pa can la brten cing mkhan po slob dpon spong ba la 'dul ba'i phyir phrogs kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one steals in order to subdue a bad friend who is a sinner and who has abandoned his preceptor and teacher.

original: phrin yig dang lag brda dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / dge slong sems 'khrugs pa dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / smyon pa dang / glen pa dang / 'on pa dang / lkugs pa dang / mu stegs can dang / dge slong ma dang /
analyzed: phrin yig dang lag brda dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / dge slong sems 'khrugs pa dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / smyon pa dang / glen pa dang / 'on pa dang / lkugs pa dang / mu stegs can dang / dge slong ma dang /
translated: There is no offense if one steals a letter, a sign, or a message; if one steals from a monk whose mind is disturbed, who is sick, who is insane, who is the first of two people with the same name, who is deaf, who is mute, or who is a tīrthika; if one steals from a nun,🔽a novice monk, a novice nun, or a layperson.

original: dge sbyong dang / dge slob ma dang / dge bsnyen ma la gos byin te phrogs kyang thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / dge slob ma dang / dge bsnyen ma la gos byin te phrogs kyang thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: In all of these cases, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽The Story of the Last Month of Autumn

original: ston zla tha chungs kyi gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs kyi gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe khyim bdag cig gis ri brags shig gi grong zhig tu btsug lag khang zhig brtsigs te dge slong drug cu'i 'tsho ba'i yo byad cig sbyar nas gtsug lag khang du bkod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyim bdag cig gis ri brags shig gi grong zhig tu btsug lag khang zhig brtsigs te dge slong drug cu'i 'tsho ba'i yo byad cig sbyar nas gtsug lag khang du bkod de /
translated: At that time, a householder built a monastery in a town in a mountain district, and provided the necessities of life for sixty monks.

original: khyim bdag de yang slad kyis dus las 'das te /
analyzed: khyim bdag de yang slad kyis dus las 'das te /
translated: Later, that householder died,

original: de'i bus kyang dge slong dag gi 'tsho ba ma 'byor nas dge slong gzhan ni so sor gyes so //
analyzed: de'i bus kyang dge slong dag gi 'tsho ba ma 'byor nas dge slong gzhan ni so sor gyes so //
translated: and his son also could not provide for the monks. The other monks dispersed,🔽but two old monks remained, living in the monastery and going out for alms.

original: de la rgan zhugs gnyis shig bsod snyoms spyod cing gtsug lag khang na gnas pa dang / de'i tshe byang phyogs kyi tshong pa dag cig yul de'i phyogs su lhags te /
analyzed: de la rgan zhugs gnyis shig bsod snyoms spyod cing gtsug lag khang na gnas pa dang / de'i tshe byang phyogs kyi tshong pa dag cig yul de'i phyogs su lhags te /
translated: At that time, some merchants from the north came to that country.🔽The merchants asked the two monks, “What is it like here?”

original: tshong ba rnams kyis dge slong gnyis la 'dir ji lta bu zhes dris pa dang / de gnyis kyang yon bdag shi ba dang bus 'tsho ba ma sbyor ba zhib tu smras so //
analyzed: tshong ba rnams kyis dge slong gnyis la 'dir ji lta bu zhes dris pa dang / de gnyis kyang yon bdag shi ba dang bus 'tsho ba ma sbyor ba zhib tu smras so //
translated: They told them in detail how the patron had died and his son had not provided for them.

original: de nas tshong pa dad pa dag gis dge slong drug cu dbyar zla ba gsum gyi 'tsho ba'i zong de gnyis la byin te dge slong spyan drongs shig ces tshong pa dag gis bsgo ba dang / rgan po gcig ni mnyan du yod par spyan 'dren du song na bsnyen dga' bo dang sgor phrad nas der dge slong gis de ltar yon bdag gis 'tsho ba sbyar te spyan 'dren to zhes byas pa dang /
analyzed: de nas tshong pa dad pa dag gis dge slong drug cu dbyar zla ba gsum gyi 'tsho ba'i zong de gnyis la byin te dge slong spyan drongs shig ces tshong pa dag gis bsgo ba dang / rgan po gcig ni mnyan du yod par spyan 'dren du song na bsnyen dga' bo dang sgor phrad nas der dge slong gis de ltar yon bdag gis 'tsho ba sbyar te spyan 'dren to zhes byas pa dang /
translated: One of the old men went to invite the monks to Śrāvastī. When he met Upagupta at the gate, the monk said, “The benefactors have provided provisions and are inviting the monks.”

original: bsnyen dga' bos @83a * //
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bos @83a * //
translated: Upagupta said,🔽“I will not go.”

original: gzhan dag der dong du dogs nas thabs shig byas te /
analyzed: gzhan dag der dong du dogs nas thabs shig byas te /
translated: Fearing that the others would go there, he devised a means.

original: 'di na dge slong gnas pa ni rgyal pos yon bdag byas te 'tsho ba shin tu 'byor ba dang ldan pa sha stag gnas pas khyod kyi der su zhig 'gro //
analyzed: 'di na dge slong gnas pa ni rgyal pos yon bdag byas te 'tsho ba shin tu 'byor ba dang ldan pa sha stag gnas pas khyod kyi der su zhig 'gro //
translated: “The monks who live there are supported by the king as benefactors. They have very comfortable living conditions. Who would go there?”

original: khyod ni dge slong rkur 'ongs pas gzhan gyis thos na spang ba'i las byas sa re zhes bsdigs nas 'on kyang ded drug sde po 'khor bcu bcu ste drug cu zhig 'ong gis sngar song la zhal ta gyis shig ces sangs rgyas la phyag byed du yang ma
analyzed: khyod ni dge slong rkur 'ongs pas gzhan gyis thos na spang ba'i las byas sa re zhes bsdigs nas 'on kyang ded drug sde po 'khor bcu bcu ste drug cu zhig 'ong gis sngar song la zhal ta gyis shig ces sangs rgyas la phyag byed du yang ma
translated: He would not even let the monks bow down to the Buddha.

original: ster bar myur du phyir btang ngo /
analyzed: ster bar myur du phyir btang ngo /
translated: He sent them away quickly.

original: phyis drug sde po 'khor dang bcas te lhags nas dbyar phyi mar tshul du zhugs te /
analyzed: phyis drug sde po 'khor dang bcas te lhags nas dbyar phyi mar tshul du zhugs te /
translated: Later, the six groups of monks came with their retinues and entered the rainy season retreat.

original: dbyar zla ba gsum gyi yo byad bgos nas zla ba gcig tu zad par byas te phyir dong bas na phyis tshong pa dag gtsug lag khang du 'ongs te /
analyzed: dbyar zla ba gsum gyi yo byad bgos nas zla ba gcig tu zad par byas te phyir dong bas na phyis tshong pa dag gtsug lag khang du 'ongs te /
translated: They divided up the provisions for the three months of the rainy season and used them up in one month. Then they left.🔽Later, some merchants came to the monastery and asked two old monks,🔽 Which monks have been invited here?🔽 They said, The six groups of monks.

original: dge slong rgan po gnyis la 'dir dge slong su dag spyan drangs zhes smras na drug sde po zhes byas pa dang / 'phags pa rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du dong ste /
analyzed: dge slong rgan po gnyis la 'dir dge slong su dag spyan drangs zhes smras na drug sde po zhes byas pa dang / 'phags pa rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du dong ste /
translated: The merchants said, Noble ones, you went out into the great ocean

original: nor bu do zan khyer te 'ongs sam /
analyzed: nor bu do zan khyer te 'ongs sam /
translated: and brought back jewels as provisions.

original: dge slong gzhan de na med dam zhes drug sde po lam dad pa dang / zla ba gsum gyi yo byad zla ba gcig tu bgos pa na ma dad cing 'phya bar gyur pa las snyan du bdas nas slan chad zla ba gsum ma lon par dbyar gyi rnyed pa dus ma yin par len cing 'gyed du mi gnang bar bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan de na med dam zhes drug sde po lam dad pa dang / zla ba gsum gyi yo byad zla ba gcig tu bgos pa na ma dad cing 'phya bar gyur pa las snyan du bdas nas slan chad zla ba gsum ma lon par dbyar gyi rnyed pa dus ma yin par len cing 'gyed du mi gnang bar bcas so //
translated: After they were reprimanded, it was decreed that Henceforth, without completing three months, it is not permitted to take and distribute the summer gains at the wrong time.

original: de nas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blon po dmag dpon kha 'da' shag ti dmag dpon du bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blon po dmag dpon kha 'da' shag ti dmag dpon du bka' stsal nas /
translated: Then King Prasenajit appointed the minister Shatra, who was past his prime, as general.

original: yul gzhan du 'gro bar lam du zhugs te /
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'gro bar lam du zhugs te /
translated: He set out on the road to go to another country and said, I will not return.

original: des dge 'dun la tshul gyi tshe yon mang po zhig phul ba dang / dge slong dag gis len cing 'gyed pa'i dus ma yin no zhes ma blangs pa dang / snyan du bdas te bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la nan tan byed pa'i bsngags pa brjod pas zhag bcus tshul nas ma byung ba la gtad pa'i gos len du rjes su gnang ste /
analyzed: des dge 'dun la tshul gyi tshe yon mang po zhig phul ba dang / dge slong dag gis len cing 'gyed pa'i dus ma yin no zhes ma blangs pa dang / snyan du bdas te bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la nan tan byed pa'i bsngags pa brjod pas zhag bcus tshul nas ma byung ba la gtad pa'i gos len du rjes su gnang ste /
translated: He then whispered in the Buddha’s ear and praised the monks’ respect for the precepts and their earnest practice of them. The Buddha then allowed them to accept the robes that had been offered and that had been set aside for ten days.

original: de las sngar len zhing 'gyed du mi gnang ba dang / dge slong dag gis gos sngar blangs nas mdzod kyi nang du sbas pas gos dag rul bar gyur to //
analyzed: de las sngar len zhing 'gyed du mi gnang ba dang / dge slong dag gis gos sngar blangs nas mdzod kyi nang du sbas pas gos dag rul bar gyur to //
translated: He did not allow them to accept the robes before that time and to distribute them. The monks accepted the robes before that time and hid them in a treasury, so the robes became moldy.

original: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
translated: He whispered in the Buddha’s ear about what had happened.

original: gos sped pa'i dge slong yon tan lnga dang ldan pa'i dge slong zhig bskos la dbyar gyi nang logs su len du yang mi gnang /
analyzed: gos sped pa'i dge slong yon tan lnga dang ldan pa'i dge slong zhig bskos la dbyar gyi nang logs su len du yang mi gnang /
translated: The Buddha then appointed a monk who had five good qualities to be the monk in charge of storing the robes. He did not allow the robes to be accepted during the rainy season.

original: gos 'gyed pa'i dus las yol bar yang len du mi gnang ngo zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: gos 'gyed pa'i dus las yol bar yang len du mi gnang ngo zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: He did not allow them to be taken after the time for distributing the robes. Thus he established a rule of training for the monks.

original: ston zla tha chungs nyar zhag bcus ma tshang ba zhes bya ba ni zhag bcu nas @83b tshul nas byung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs nyar zhag bcus ma tshang ba zhes bya ba ni zhag bcu nas @83b tshul nas byung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase before the last day of the last month of the rainy season means before ten days have passed of the last month of the rainy season.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase a monk refers to the group of six monks, who had entered into this doctrine.

original: rnyed ces bya ba ni gzhan las so /
analyzed: rnyed ces bya ba ni gzhan las so /
translated: The phrase he obtains means from another.

original: gtad pa'i gos zhes bya ba ni gtong pa'i gos la rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: gtad pa'i gos zhes bya ba ni gtong pa'i gos la rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The phrase a robe that is given refers to a robe that is given in five ways:

original: nad pas byin pa dang / na ba'i phyir byin pa dang / 'chi ba'i tshe byin pa dang / shi ba'i phyir byin pa dang / 'gro ba'i phyir byin pa'o //
analyzed: nad pas byin pa dang / na ba'i phyir byin pa dang / 'chi ba'i tshe byin pa dang / shi ba'i phyir byin pa dang / 'gro ba'i phyir byin pa'o //
translated: a robe given by a sick person, a robe given for the sake of a sick person, a robe given at the time of death, a robe given for the sake of a dead person, and a robe given for the sake of a journey.

original: 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni gos bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni gos bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase if he wishes means if he desires a robe.

original: gos zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bdun las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gos zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bdun las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The phrase a robe refers to any of the seven types of robes.

original: long shig ces bya ba ni bdag gi phyir ro //
analyzed: long shig ces bya ba ni bdag gi phyir ro //
translated: The phrase he should take possession of it means for his own sake.

original: blangs nas chos gos 'gyed pa'i dus la ma bab kyi bar du chongs shig ces bya ba ni gtad pa'i gos de gos sbed pa'i lag par gzhag par bya'o //🔽gos kyi dus ni gang dus ma yin pa ni gang zhe na gnas su gtan pa ma drub pa zhig ni ston zla tha chungs nyal tshul nas byung ste /🔽de'i phyi de nyin gos 'gyed pa'i dus yin no //
analyzed: blangs nas chos gos 'gyed pa'i dus la ma bab kyi bar du chongs shig ces bya ba ni gtad pa'i gos de gos sbed pa'i lag par gzhag par bya'o // gos kyi dus ni gang dus ma yin pa ni gang zhe na gnas su gtan pa ma drub pa zhig ni ston zla tha chungs nyal tshul nas byung ste / de'i phyi de nyin gos 'gyed pa'i dus yin no //
translated: The time for the robes is when the robes are made. The time not for the robes is when the robes are not made.

original: lhag ma rnams ni dus ma yin no //🔽gnas su gtan pa zhig drub pa zhig na ston zla tha chungs nya nas dpyid zla tha chungs nya'i bar du gos len pa'i dus yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni dus ma yin no // gnas su gtan pa zhig drub pa zhig na ston zla tha chungs nya nas dpyid zla tha chungs nya'i bar du gos len pa'i dus yin no //

original: lhag ma rnams ni dus ma yin no //🔽de las 'das par bcangs na zhes bya ba ni thal ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni dus ma yin no // de las 'das par bcangs na zhes bya ba ni thal ba'o //
translated: The time for the robes is when the robes are made. The time not for the robes is when the robes are not made.

original: spang pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: spang pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: The time for the robes is when the robes are made

original: dbyar ma zad pa'i skabs su dbyar gyi rnyed pa bgos sam 'god pa'i dus las 'das par bcangs na thams cad du spangs pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyar ma zad pa'i skabs su dbyar gyi rnyed pa bgos sam 'god pa'i dus las 'das par bcangs na thams cad du spangs pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one keeps it beyond the time of distribution or setting aside of the summer gains, before the end of summer, it is a downfall by rejection in all cases.

original: sbyin bdag gis sngar phul pa slad kyis bdag rang gis so sor dbul lo zhes dus las 'das kyang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis sngar phul pa slad kyis bdag rang gis so sor dbul lo zhes dus las 'das kyang ltung ba med do //
translated: If one says, “I will give it myself later,” after the donor has previously offered it, there is no downfall even if one goes beyond the time.

original: gtad pa'i gos 'gyed pa'i dus las 'das par bcangs kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /
analyzed: gtad pa'i gos 'gyed pa'i dus las 'das par bcangs kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /
translated: There is also no fault in keeping beyond the time of distribution of the robe-cloth that has been entrusted to oneself.

original: dge slong gos rnyed ma thag tu smyos sam sems 'khrugs sam /
analyzed: dge slong gos rnyed ma thag tu smyos sam sems 'khrugs sam /
translated: If a monk, as soon as he has obtained robe-cloth, becomes insane or mentally disturbed,

original: gos kyi rgyu dang spun mi rung ba dang zhag bcu tshun chad dus las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gos kyi rgyu dang spun mi rung ba dang zhag bcu tshun chad dus las 'das pa'o //
translated: or if the robe-cloth is unsuitable for him or his companion, or if he keeps it beyond the time, for less than ten days, there is no downfall.

original: dgon par chos gos dang bral du gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: dgon par chos gos dang bral du gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The basis for the allowance to be without one’s Dharma robes in the wilderness is as follows. The Bhagavat was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe ri brags kyi grong na khyim bdag dad pa can zhig gnas pa des dgon pa'i gnas su gtsug lag khang bzang po zhig brtsigs nas dge slong mang po zhig spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ri brags kyi grong na khyim bdag dad pa can zhig gnas pa des dgon pa'i gnas su gtsug lag khang bzang po zhig brtsigs nas dge slong mang po zhig spyan drangs te /
translated: At that time, in a village of a mountain district, there lived a householder who had faith. He built a fine temple in a remote place and invited many monks.

original: yo byad dag sbyar nas bkod pa dang dge slong dag kyang yul gzhan du dang ngo //
analyzed: yo byad dag sbyar nas bkod pa dang dge slong dag kyang yul gzhan du dang ngo //
translated: He provided them with necessities and arranged for their support. The monks went to other countries.

original: yul gzhan nas dge slong dag cig gtsug lag khang der lhags so //
analyzed: yul gzhan nas dge slong dag cig gtsug lag khang der lhags so //
translated: Some monks from other countries came to that temple.

original: de dag kyang yul gud du rgyu zhing sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal zhing 'dong bar byas nas yon bdag gis gsol ba /
analyzed: de dag kyang yul gud du rgyu zhing sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal zhing 'dong bar byas nas yon bdag gis gsol ba /
translated: They also decided to go to other countries, to travel around, and to pay homage to the Buddha. The patron said,

original: gtsug lag khang 'di bdag gis pha'i phyin yang ma brtsigs @84a * //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'di bdag gis pha'i phyin yang ma brtsigs @84a * //
translated: “I did not build this temple for my father.

original: ma'i phyir yang ma brtsigs 'phags pa khyed kyi phyir brtsigs na gud du mi gshegs shing 'dir tshul du 'jug par ci gnang zhes gsol nas de'i sems bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong de dag kyang der gnas so //
analyzed: ma'i phyir yang ma brtsigs 'phags pa khyed kyi phyir brtsigs na gud du mi gshegs shing 'dir tshul du 'jug par ci gnang zhes gsol nas de'i sems bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong de dag kyang der gnas so //
translated: I did not build it for my mother. I built it for you, Noble Ones. Please do not go elsewhere. Please stay here.” In order to protect his mind, those monks stayed there.

original: yul de phyogs na lha khang gzhan med de yul gyi mi dad pa kun gyis kyang lha khang der yon phul bas dge slong dag kyang rnyed pa shin tu mang ngo //
analyzed: yul de phyogs na lha khang gzhan med de yul gyi mi dad pa kun gyis kyang lha khang der yon phul bas dge slong dag kyang rnyed pa shin tu mang ngo //
translated: In that region there were no other temples, and all the people of the country made offerings to that temple.

original: ston zla tha chungs g-yon can gyi rkun po dag gis bgros pa /
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs g-yon can gyi rkun po dag gis bgros pa /
translated: In the last autumn month, some deceitful thieves discussed among themselves,🔽Among them, one who knew about monks said, If we cross the threshold of a hundred doors and fill our bellies, there is nothing wrong with that.

original: de dag gi nang na dge slong gi rgyus shes pa gcig na re sgo'i them pa brgya rgal zhing lto 'gengs pa de ngag la cang med pa'i rigs na zhes byas na de bas kyang rgyus mkhas pa gcig na re de dag rnyed pa rab tu mang ngo
analyzed: de dag gi nang na dge slong gi rgyus shes pa gcig na re sgo'i them pa brgya rgal zhing lto 'gengs pa de ngag la cang med pa'i rigs na zhes byas na de bas kyang rgyus mkhas pa gcig na re de dag rnyed pa rab tu mang ngo
translated: But another who was more knowledgeable about them said, They have a lot of wealth.

original: zhes nas de na yod dam med pa brtags pa'i phyir gnyis shig lha khang gi nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: zhes nas de na yod dam med pa brtags pa'i phyir gnyis shig lha khang gi nang du zhugs te /
translated: Therefore, in order to investigate whether they were there or not, two of them entered the temple.

original: phyag byas nas bskor zhing dang dad ltar byas te dge slong gzhan ni med rgan zhugs shig de na 'dug pa de la 'di gtsug lag khang 'byor pa'am brel pa'i gnas zhes dris na dge slong des ma go nas gtsug lag khang ni 'byor pa'o zhes smras nas
analyzed: phyag byas nas bskor zhing dang dad ltar byas te dge slong gzhan ni med rgan zhugs shig de na 'dug pa de la 'di gtsug lag khang 'byor pa'am brel pa'i gnas zhes dris na dge slong des ma go nas gtsug lag khang ni 'byor pa'o zhes smras nas
translated: He prostrated himself, circumambulated, and made offerings. There was no other monk there, only an old man. He asked him, “Is this a prosperous or a poor monastery?” The monk did not understand and said, “The monastery is prosperous.”

original: rgan zhugs des 'di na brel ba ma yin gyi yo byad dang ldan zhing 'byor pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: rgan zhugs des 'di na brel ba ma yin gyi yo byad dang ldan zhing 'byor pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: The old man said, “This is not a poor place. It is a prosperous place with all the necessities.

original: gos gyi thum po kun kyang sbyoms pa'i phyir bstan to //
analyzed: gos gyi thum po kun kyang sbyoms pa'i phyir bstan to //
translated: All the bundles of cloth are displayed for sale.”

original: rkun po de dag gis kyang shin tu rtog nas nam tshul nas byung ba'i dus dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rkun po de dag gis kyang shin tu rtog nas nam tshul nas byung ba'i dus dang sbyar te /
translated: The thieves also thought carefully and waited for the right time.

original: de'i tshe dge slong dag mtshan thog thag chos 'chad cing kha ton byed pa'i tshe g-yon can dag chos nyan pa 'dra bar sgo brdungs te g-yon can dag nad du lhags nas dge spyong dag gi gos dang yo byad ma lus par phrogs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong dag mtshan thog thag chos 'chad cing kha ton byed pa'i tshe g-yon can dag chos nyan pa 'dra bar sgo brdungs te g-yon can dag nad du lhags nas dge spyong dag gi gos dang yo byad ma lus par phrogs so //
translated: At that time, the monks were explaining the Dharma and reciting scriptures all night. The rogues knocked on the door as if they were listening to the Dharma. The rogues said, “We are sick. We ask for the monks’ clothes and all the necessities.” The monks gave them everything.

original: de nas dge slong 'di dag kyang yon bdag la ni ba bzhos pa bzhin du bya dgos kyi dong ngo zhes nas gcer bus mnyan du yod par phyin te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong 'di dag kyang yon bdag la ni ba bzhos pa bzhin du bya dgos kyi dong ngo zhes nas gcer bus mnyan du yod par phyin te /
translated: Then he said, These monks must be milked like a cow for the benefactors. I will go. The naked ascetic went to Śrāvastī.🔽Then the monks who were staying in Śrāvastī gave him the thirteen articles, such as Dharma robes, and after informing the Blessed One of what had happened, they said,

original: de nas dge slong mnyan du yod pa na 'khod pa rnams kyis chos gos la sogs te yo byad bcu gsum byin nas de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas nga slan chad 'jigs shing dogs pa'i gnas su chos gos gsum las gang yang rung ste gcig zhag
analyzed: de nas dge slong mnyan du yod pa na 'khod pa rnams kyis chos gos la sogs te yo byad bcu gsum byin nas de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas nga slan chad 'jigs shing dogs pa'i gnas su chos gos gsum las gang yang rung ste gcig zhag
translated: From now on, we will be afraid and suspicious. We will not give anything to anyone who asks for any of the three Dharma robes.

analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde po ste gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //

translated: It is not suitable to use unsuitable cloth or cotton, and if one gives the vow not to be separated from the Dharma robes, and if the Dharma robes are placed on the ground, but the monk remains in the sky, there is no downfall even if it is more than six days.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen dus las sngon rol du btsal tam dbyar 'das par 'chad du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //

translated: He rebuked him in many ways, saying, “It is difficult to cure, difficult to fill, and insatiable. It is not the duty of an ascetic.”

original: spyir bsngos pa gang gzag bdag gir byas na mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: spyir bsngos pa gang gzag bdag gir byas na mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: He prohibited the appropriation of what is dedicated to the general community.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste /
translated: “A monk” means Nandaka.

original: gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it means one who has entered this Dharma.

original: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis rig pa 'am gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis rig pa 'am gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
translated: “Mindfully” means knowing oneself or being instructed by others.

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos so //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos so //
translated: “The Saṅgha” means the Blessed One’s disciples.

original: rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “Gain” is of two kinds:

original: gos kyi rnyed pa dang / kha zas kyi rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa dang / kha zas kyi rnyed pa'o //
translated: gain of robes and gain of food.

original: skabs 'dir ni gos kyi rnyed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni gos kyi rnyed pa la bya'o //
translated: In this context, it refers to gain of robes.

original: gang zag bdag gir bsngos zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gi ched du bsngos pa'o //🔽spang @86a * //
analyzed: gang zag bdag gir bsngos zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gi ched du bsngos pa'o // spang @86a * //
translated: “Dedicated to oneself” means dedicated for oneself.

original: ba'i ltung ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba'i ltung ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags par bya ba'o //
translated: “To give up” means to give up the object and confess the downfall.

original: nyes pa ni gang zag gcig gi rnyed pa bdag gir bsngos sam /
analyzed: nyes pa ni gang zag gcig gi rnyed pa bdag gir bsngos sam /
translated: “Fault” means that if one dedicates to oneself the gain of one person,

original: gcig gam gnyis sam gsum mam mang po yang rung ste /
analyzed: gcig gam gnyis sam gsum mam mang po yang rung ste /
translated: or of one, two, three, or many people,

original: bsdos pa'i tshe ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: bsdos pa'i tshe ni nyes byas so //
translated: then at the time of the distribution, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: thob na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accepts it, there is a downfall of forsaking.

original: dge slong gis gang zag gcig gi rnyed pa pha rol gnyis la bsngos sam mang po yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis gang zag gcig gi rnyed pa pha rol gnyis la bsngos sam mang po yang rung ste /
translated: If a monk dedicates to two others the gain of one person, or of many people,

original: 'god pa'i tshe ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'god pa'i tshe ni nyes byas so //
translated: then at the time of the distribution, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang zag gi rnyed pa dge 'dun gyir bsngos na 'ged pa'i tshe nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang zag gi rnyed pa dge 'dun gyir bsngos na 'ged pa'i tshe nyes byas so //
translated: If the gain of a person is dedicated to the Saṅgha, then at the time of the distribution, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: thob na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: thob na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one accepts it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bzhin du gtsug lag khang gi yo byad dang / gtsug lag khang gi rgyan gyi yo byad dang mchod rten gyi phang lo rim bzhin du 'dug pa las ltag 'og bsnor na nyes byas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtsug lag khang gi yo byad dang / gtsug lag khang gi rgyan gyi yo byad dang mchod rten gyi phang lo rim bzhin du 'dug pa las ltag 'og bsnor na nyes byas so //
translated: Likewise, if one turns upside down the articles of the temple, the articles of the temple's decoration, and the wheels of the stupa, one commits an offense.

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa gang zag bdag gir bsngos na nyes par mi 'gyur ba yang yod de phrin pa dang phrin yig pa dang lag brda dang / gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / rgyu dang spun mi rung ba rnams ni ltung ba med de nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa gang zag bdag gir bsngos na nyes par mi 'gyur ba yang yod de phrin pa dang phrin yig pa dang lag brda dang / gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / rgyu dang spun mi rung ba rnams ni ltung ba med de nyes byas so //
translated: There is also no offense if one dedicates to oneself the property of the Sangha, but there is an offense if one does so by means of a messenger, a written message, a sign, or by means of a series of intermediaries.

original: sman gzhag pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka len da ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sman gzhag pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka len da ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of the rule concerning the storage of medicine: The Blessed One was staying in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana near Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa srung ba po'i bu la brten cing gnas bca' ba'i nye gnas lhan cig spyod pa'i dge slong dag gis sman byin len byas pa dang / byin len ma byas pa dang snga dro ba dang zhag bdun par 'dres shing mi mngon par de lta bur dus dang dus ma yin par za zhing rang gi lag gis blangs nas za bas na sman zhag bdun gyi bar du byin gyis brlabs la gzhag par bya
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa srung ba po'i bu la brten cing gnas bca' ba'i nye gnas lhan cig spyod pa'i dge slong dag gis sman byin len byas pa dang / byin len ma byas pa dang snga dro ba dang zhag bdun par 'dres shing mi mngon par de lta bur dus dang dus ma yin par za zhing rang gi lag gis blangs nas za bas na sman zhag bdun gyi bar du byin gyis brlabs la gzhag par bya
translated: Therefore, medicines should be consecrated and kept for seven days.

original: / de las 'das par bcang bar mi gnang ste de ltar gyur pa la dge slong dag 'phya ba snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: / de las 'das par bcang bar mi gnang ste de ltar gyur pa la dge slong dag 'phya ba snyan du bdas nas /
translated: It is not permitted to keep them beyond that. When the monks heard the complaints about this,🔽they reported it to the Blessed One, saying, “It is true, Blessed One.”

original: bkas rmas na mad do zhes gsol ba dang / chog mi shes pa gso dka' ba dgang dka' ba'o zhes smad nas /
analyzed: bkas rmas na mad do zhes gsol ba dang / chog mi shes pa gso dka' ba dgang dka' ba'o zhes smad nas /
translated: The Blessed One rebuked them, saying, “It is improper to be insatiable, difficult to care for, and difficult to fill.”

original: sman zhag bdun gyi bar du dril zhing bza' bar bya /
analyzed: sman zhag bdun gyi bar du dril zhing bza' bar bya /
translated: Medicines should be kept for seven days and eaten after they have been rung.

original: de las 'das par bzhag na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: de las 'das par bzhag na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: If he keeps it beyond that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: na ba zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: na ba zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba'o //
translated: “Sick” means unwell.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: “Monk” means one who has entered this Dharma.

original: phan pa gang byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni de dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa gang byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni de dang mthun pa'o //
translated: “What is beneficial” means what is suitable for him.

original: sman du gsungs zhes bya ba ni bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: sman du gsungs zhes bya ba ni bsgrags pa'o //
translated: “Medicines” means what is prescribed.

original: mar dang til dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram zhes bya ba ni dngos su bas so //
analyzed: mar dang til dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram zhes bya ba ni dngos su bas so //
translated: “Ghee, oil, honey, and molasses” means what is actually mentioned.

original: 'dod ces bya ba ni gal te 'dod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod ces bya ba ni gal te 'dod par gyur pa'o //
translated: “If he wishes” means if he desires.

original: zhag bdun gyi bar du zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun tshun chad do //🔽rang gis byin gyis rlobs shig ces bya ba ni @86b bdag gis so //
analyzed: zhag bdun gyi bar du zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun tshun chad do // rang gis byin gyis rlobs shig ces bya ba ni @86b bdag gis so //
translated: “For seven days” means up to seven days.🔽“He should consume it himself” means he should consume it himself.

original: gzhag par bya ba'i bza' ba'o zhes bya ba ni rang gis blangs nas bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba'i bza' ba'o zhes bya ba ni rang gis blangs nas bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: “He should keep it as a stored food” means he should keep it as a stored food that he has taken himself.

original: de las 'das par bzhag na zhes bya ba ni de las 'das par ro //
analyzed: de las 'das par bzhag na zhes bya ba ni de las 'das par ro //
translated: “If he keeps it beyond that” means if he keeps it beyond that.

original: spang pa'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags pa'o //
analyzed: spang pa'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs nas ltung ba bshags pa'o //
translated: The transgression of abandonment is a downfall that is confessed after having abandoned the object.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong gis tshes gcig la sman zhig rnyed na zhag bdun tshun chad du byin gyis rlobs shig / yang na gzhan la skur cig //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong gis tshes gcig la sman zhig rnyed na zhag bdun tshun chad du byin gyis rlobs shig / yang na gzhan la skur cig //
translated: The fault is that if a monk obtains medicine on the first day, he should consecrate it for seven days, or send it to another,

original: yang na byin cig //
analyzed: yang na byin cig //
translated: or give it away,

original: de ltar ma byas na tshes brgyad kyi skya rengs shar nas spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na tshes brgyad kyi skya rengs shar nas spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and if he does not do so, then at dawn on the eighth day it becomes a transgression of abandonment.

original: sman zhag bdun du byin gyis rlob pa ni bdag lag bkrus te sman byin len byas nas tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i mdun du tsog tsog por 'dug la 'di skad du rjod cig dgongs shig //
analyzed: sman zhag bdun du byin gyis rlob pa ni bdag lag bkrus te sman byin len byas nas tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i mdun du tsog tsog por 'dug la 'di skad du rjod cig dgongs shig //
translated: The consecration of medicine for seven days is as follows: Having washed one's hands, one should take the medicine, and sitting in the presence of a fellow monk, one should say, Please listen!

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba rung ba'i sman 'di zhag bdun tshun chad du bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i phyir byin gyis brlab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba rung ba'i sman 'di zhag bdun tshun chad du bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i phyir byin gyis brlab par bgyi'o //
translated: For seven days I, named so-and-so, will consecrate this suitable medicine for myself and for my fellow monks.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du smros shig //
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du smros shig //
translated: One should say this twice and three times.

original: ji lta bur zos pa yang nyin gcig bzhin du de ni bdag gis nyi ma gcig zos lhag ma yang bza'o zhes tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i mdun du zhag bdun gyi bar du rjod cig / de ste yang sman lhag ste ma zad na dge sbyong ngam
analyzed: ji lta bur zos pa yang nyin gcig bzhin du de ni bdag gis nyi ma gcig zos lhag ma yang bza'o zhes tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i mdun du zhag bdun gyi bar du rjod cig / de ste yang sman lhag ste ma zad na dge sbyong ngam
translated: And in the presence of fellow practitioners of pure conduct, for seven days, say, ‘I have eaten one day’s supply of this medicine, and I will eat the rest on the following day.’🔽If the medicine is not finished, the monk should give it to other monks,

original: kun dga'i ra ba la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga'i ra ba la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: or to novices, or to monastery workers.

original: sman spang bar bya ba de ma spangs sam bral bar ma byas sam ltung ba ma bshags par gzhan zhig rnyed na yang snga ma'i rgyun gyis phyi ma rnyed pa thams cad spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhag bdun las 'das kyang spang bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /
analyzed: sman spang bar bya ba de ma spangs sam bral bar ma byas sam ltung ba ma bshags par gzhan zhig rnyed na yang snga ma'i rgyun gyis phyi ma rnyed pa thams cad spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro // zhag bdun las 'das kyang spang bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /
translated: If he obtains other medicine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct for the period of time he does not get rid of the medicine or separate himself from it or confess the offense.🔽There is no offense if he does not get rid of the medicine after seven days,

original: sman dge slong 'chad du mi rung ba ni zhag bdun las 'das kyang spang ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sman dge slong 'chad du mi rung ba ni zhag bdun las 'das kyang spang ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but before the medicine that is not suitable for a monk has been discarded.

original: dge slong nad kyis gzir ba dang smyos pa dang sems stor ba ni nam sems 'khrugs pa rnyed pa nas zhag bdun bgrang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong nad kyis gzir ba dang smyos pa dang sems stor ba ni nam sems 'khrugs pa rnyed pa nas zhag bdun bgrang bar bya'o //
translated: A monk who is afflicted by illness, or who is insane, or whose mind is disturbed, should count the days from the time his mind is disturbed.

original: snga dro ba'i sman ni snga dro spyad par bya phyi dro ba'i sman ni phyi dro spyad par bya /
analyzed: snga dro ba'i sman ni snga dro spyad par bya phyi dro ba'i sman ni phyi dro spyad par bya /
translated: A medicine that is to be taken in the morning should be taken in the morning. A medicine that is to be taken in the evening should be taken in the evening.

original: zhag bdun pa yang zhag bdun tshun chad du spyad par bya /
analyzed: zhag bdun pa yang zhag bdun tshun chad du spyad par bya /
translated: A medicine that is to be taken for seven days should be taken for seven days at most.

original: tshes gcig pa'i sman yang tshes gcig tshun chad du bcad par bya /
analyzed: tshes gcig pa'i sman yang tshes gcig tshun chad du bcad par bya /
translated: A medicine that is to be taken for one day should be taken for one day at most.

original: de las 'das par bcangs na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las 'das par bcangs na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: If one keeps it beyond that, it should be understood that it is a downfall requiring relinquishment in all cases.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba sum cu'i bslab pa'i gnas rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba sum cu'i bslab pa'i gnas rdzogs so /
translated: The training rule on thirty downfalls requiring relinquishment is finished.

original: // / shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of lying in full awareness: The Blessed One was staying at Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin la dad pa'i bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das ga la bzhugs zhes dris na /🔽bcom ldan @87a * //🔽'das 'od ma'i tshal na bzhugs na ni bya rgod phung po'i ri la bzhugs so zhes zer /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin la dad pa'i bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das ga la bzhugs zhes dris na / bcom ldan @87a * // 'das 'od ma'i tshal na bzhugs na ni bya rgod phung po'i ri la bzhugs so zhes zer /
translated: At that time, the brahmans and householders who had faith in the Venerable Rāhula asked, “Where is the Blessed One staying?”🔽“The Blessed One is staying in the Bamboo Grove.”

original: pi pi li'i shing drung gi phug na bzhugs na ni sde chen ma'i phug na 'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: pi pi li'i shing drung gi phug na bzhugs na ni sde chen ma'i phug na 'o zhes zer te /
translated: “The Blessed One is staying in the cave of the Great Division.”

original: de bzhin du khyim bdag gis btsal kyang ma rnyed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyim bdag gis btsal kyang ma rnyed do //
translated: In the same way, the householder searched but did not find him.

original: de dag gis sgra gcan zin la khyod kyis ched du bsams te /🔽bdag cag la tho 'tshams sam de bzhin no zhes byas pa dang / de dag 'phya bar gyur ba snyan du bdas nas lcags kyi thu lu ma za ba ni bla'i /
analyzed: de dag gis sgra gcan zin la khyod kyis ched du bsams te / bdag cag la tho 'tshams sam de bzhin no zhes byas pa dang / de dag 'phya bar gyur ba snyan du bdas nas lcags kyi thu lu ma za ba ni bla'i /
translated: They said to Rāhula, “Did you intentionally🔽harass us?” He said, “Yes.” They reported this to the Blessed One, who scolded him, saying, “Is it suitable for a disciple

original: 'di lta bu ni ma yin no zhes bkas smad kyang bslab pa ma bcas so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni ma yin no zhes bkas smad kyang bslab pa ma bcas so //
translated: to act like this?” and imposed a penance.

original: slad kyis bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs pa'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na sh'akya'i bu dge slong me bzhi skyes zhes bya ba zhig gnas te /
analyzed: slad kyis bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs pa'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na sh'akya'i bu dge slong me bzhi skyes zhes bya ba zhig gnas te /
translated: Later, when the Bhagavat was living in Śrāvastī, there was a Śākya bhikṣu named Caturdāntajātaka living in Śrāvastī.

original: de yang phyi rol gyi gzhung gzhan la rab tu mkhas shing gzhan dang rab tu 'gyed pa la brtson pa zhig 'dug go //
analyzed: de yang phyi rol gyi gzhung gzhan la rab tu mkhas shing gzhan dang rab tu 'gyed pa la brtson pa zhig 'dug go //
translated: He was very learned in the scriptures of other schools and was devoted to debating with others.

original: de'i tshe lho'i phyogs nas bram ze'i bu zhig sngags tshol zhing mnyan du yod par phyin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe lho'i phyogs nas bram ze'i bu zhig sngags tshol zhing mnyan du yod par phyin te /
translated: At that time, a brahmin boy from the south came to Śrāvastī in search of mantras.

original: sngar gnas pa'i bram ze dang cung zad 'gyed par byas pa las /🔽bram ze dag gis g-yo byas nas sh'akya'i dge slong me bzhi skyes la /
analyzed: sngar gnas pa'i bram ze dang cung zad 'gyed par byas pa las / bram ze dag gis g-yo byas nas sh'akya'i dge slong me bzhi skyes la /
translated: He debated a little with the brahmin who was already there.

original: gtsug lag gis rgol cig ces byas nas /
analyzed: gtsug lag gis rgol cig ces byas nas /
translated: The brahmins deceived him and said, “Debate with the Śākya bhikṣu Caturdāntajātaka.🔽He is skilled in the treatises.”

original: de gnyis kyang skyed mos tshal zhig tu dus byas nas /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang skyed mos tshal zhig tu dus byas nas /
translated: Those two made an appointment in a certain park.

original: bram ze ni de'i mtshan thog thag bdag gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs la sems sems te nam nangs nas dus sar phyin pa dang / dge slong me bzhi skyes ni de'i nyin mo bsod snyoms la song song ste slar log pa dang / bram ze dang phrad nas nga ni brjed do zhes byas so //
analyzed: bram ze ni de'i mtshan thog thag bdag gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs la sems sems te nam nangs nas dus sar phyin pa dang / dge slong me bzhi skyes ni de'i nyin mo bsod snyoms la song song ste slar log pa dang / bram ze dang phrad nas nga ni brjed do zhes byas so //
translated: The monk Caturdharma had been out begging for almsfood that day and was on his way back when he met the brahmin. “ I forgot,” he said.

original: phyi de nyin dus byas pa dang / dge slong de yang dus der ma 'ongs nas grang gzhan na 'gro ba bram ze des mthong nas /
analyzed: phyi de nyin dus byas pa dang / dge slong de yang dus der ma 'ongs nas grang gzhan na 'gro ba bram ze des mthong nas /
translated: The next day, when the time came, the monk did not show up. The brahmin saw the other monks going off to eat.🔽“ Monk, why didn’t you come here?”

original: dge slong khyod ci'i phyir 'dir mi 'ong zhes byas pa dang / don de gcig pur zad dam /
analyzed: dge slong khyod ci'i phyir 'dir mi 'ong zhes byas pa dang / don de gcig pur zad dam /
translated: “ Is that all there is to it?”

original: bdag ni ston pa dang / bla ma la bsnyen bkur bya dgos /
analyzed: bdag ni ston pa dang / bla ma la bsnyen bkur bya dgos /
translated: “ I have to serve my teacher and guru.”

original: khyim bdag dang bram ze lhags pa rnams la chos bstan dgos so zhes smras pa dang / bram zes khyod nga la ched du bsams te tho 'tshams sam ci zhes byas pa dang de bzhin no zhes smras pa dang / bram ze'i bu dag dge sbyong de dag ni bzhin du brdzun zer ro zhes mi snyan par zer ba snyan du bdas nas rnam grangs du mas smad nas 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: khyim bdag dang bram ze lhags pa rnams la chos bstan dgos so zhes smras pa dang / bram zes khyod nga la ched du bsams te tho 'tshams sam ci zhes byas pa dang de bzhin no zhes smras pa dang / bram ze'i bu dag dge sbyong de dag ni bzhin du brdzun zer ro zhes mi snyan par zer ba snyan du bdas nas rnam grangs du mas smad nas 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The Buddha said, I must teach the Dharma to the assembled householders and brahmins. The brahmin said, Did you intentionally deceive me? The Buddha said, Yes, I did. The brahmin's sons said, Those ascetics speak lies. They spread unpleasant words and criticized the Buddha in many ways. The Buddha then established the training rule for the monastic code.

original: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'o //
translated: The term knowingly means having examined.

original: brdzun zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: brdzun zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: The term false has nine aspects:

original: phas pham par 'gyur ba dang lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / ltung bar 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang / rtsa ba med pa dang / tshul khrims @87b log par zhugs pa dang / lta ba log par zhugs pa dang / cho ga log par zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: phas pham par 'gyur ba dang lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / ltung bar 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang / rtsa ba med pa dang / tshul khrims @87b log par zhugs pa dang / lta ba log par zhugs pa dang / cho ga log par zhugs pa dang /
translated: defeat, residual sin, downfall, minor offense, groundless, wrongly engaging in morality, wrongly engaging in views, wrongly engaging in conduct,

original: 'tsho ba log par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba log par zhugs pa'o //
translated: and wrongly engaging in livelihood.

original: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang byol song dang yi dags ngan 'gro log par bsregs pa dang btso bar ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang byol song dang yi dags ngan 'gro log par bsregs pa dang btso bar ltung ba'o //
translated: “Falling” means falling into the bad destinies of hell, animal, or hungry ghost.

original: de la dge slong gi 'du shes sbas nas mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la dge slong gi 'du shes sbas nas mthong ngo //
translated: If a monk hides his perception and says, “I saw it,”

original: dogs so zhes smras na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dogs so zhes smras na ltung ba'o //
translated: or “I suspect it,” he commits an offense.

original: dge slong gis mi'i skyon nas 'bod pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: dge slong gis mi'i skyon nas 'bod pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The basis for the rule about calling out a monk’s faults is this. The Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde po gzhan gyi skyon nas 'bod pa ni 'di lta ste zhar ba dang rkang dos dang gyol po dang sor mo 'jas pa dang / rgur po dang lkog glon can dang / mchu 'phyang dang mgo bo che la sogs pa'i skyon nas bos pas dge slong dag bag 'khums pa dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde po gzhan gyi skyon nas 'bod pa ni 'di lta ste zhar ba dang rkang dos dang gyol po dang sor mo 'jas pa dang / rgur po dang lkog glon can dang / mchu 'phyang dang mgo bo che la sogs pa'i skyon nas bos pas dge slong dag bag 'khums pa dang /
translated: At that time the group of six monks called out the faults of others, such as “You’re blind,” “You’re lame,” “You’re crippled,” “You have clubfoot,” “You’re hunchbacked,” “You’re a gossip,” “You have a pendulous lower lip,” “You have a large head,” and so on. The monks became timid,

original: mi spobs pa dang / spa gong bar gyur nas dge ba'i bar chad du 'gyur bas snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: mi spobs pa dang / spa gong bar gyur nas dge ba'i bar chad du 'gyur bas snyan du bdas nas /
translated: unconfident, and discouraged, and this became an obstacle to their virtue.

original: bkas drug sde la rmas na mad do zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: bkas drug sde la rmas na mad do zhes gsol nas /
translated: The Buddha said, If you ask the group of six, they will tell you.

original: dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin /
translated: It is not the duty of a monk,🔽it is not right.

original: rigs pa ma yin zhes rnam grangs du mas smad nas bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin zhes rnam grangs du mas smad nas bslab pa bcas so //
translated: After rebuking him in many ways, he laid down the training rule.

original: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni ngan song gsum du ltung bar byed pas na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni ngan song gsum du ltung bar byed pas na ltung ba'o //
translated: As for offense, it is called an offense because it causes one to fall into the three lower realms.

original: ltung ba de ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams sgrib par byed pas na ltung ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ltung ba de ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams sgrib par byed pas na ltung ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: If that offense is not confessed, it obscures virtuous qualities, so it is called an offense.

original: dge slong gis mi'i skyon nas 'bod par bsams te /
analyzed: dge slong gis mi'i skyon nas 'bod par bsams te /
translated: If a monk, intending to call out the faults of a person,

original: dge slong la tshe dang ldan pa khyod rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i rigs las rab tu byung bas khyod la dge sbyong dang tshangs pa med do zhes byas na dge sbyong spa gong yang rung la ma gong yang rung ste nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong la tshe dang ldan pa khyod rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i rigs las rab tu byung bas khyod la dge sbyong dang tshangs pa med do zhes byas na dge sbyong spa gong yang rung la ma gong yang rung ste nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: says to a monk, Venerable, since you have gone forth from the warrior caste or the brahmin caste, you have no virtue or purity, whether the monk is discouraged or not, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: lham mkhan dang skud ris mkhas dang shing mkhan dang tha ga pa dang / 'dreg mkhan dang / theng po dang / lag sor 'khums pa dang / lkog glon can dang / skrangs pa la sogs pa las khyod rab tu byung bas na dge sbyong dang tshangs pa med do zhes smras na /
analyzed: lham mkhan dang skud ris mkhas dang shing mkhan dang tha ga pa dang / 'dreg mkhan dang / theng po dang / lag sor 'khums pa dang / lkog glon can dang / skrangs pa la sogs pa las khyod rab tu byung bas na dge sbyong dang tshangs pa med do zhes smras na /
translated: If one says to a monk, “You are not a monk, not a celibate, not a śramaṇa, not a renunciant, because you are a shoemaker, a weaver, a carpenter, a tailor, a barber, a hunchback, a dwarf, a hermaphrodite, a leper, or because you have goiter,”

original: dge slong spa gong yang rung ma gong yang rung ste ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong spa gong yang rung ma gong yang rung ste ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: then, whether the monk is embarrassed or not, there is an individual transgression.

original: phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brda dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / dge slong smyon pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang ra ro ba las mi'i skyon nas bos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrin dang phrin yig dang lag brda dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / dge slong smyon pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang ra ro ba las mi'i skyon nas bos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says to a monk, “You are not a monk, not a celibate, not a śramaṇa, not a renunciant, because you are a messenger, a letter carrier, a sign carrier, or because you are a monk who is insane, deranged, or intoxicated,” then, whether the monk is embarrassed or not, there is an individual transgression.

original: 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa dang mtha' 'khob pa dang / 'phags pa'i skad kyis gcig la gcig brda mi 'jal ba dang / dge sbyong dang / khyim pa dang / de bzhin du pha bsad pa dang ma bsad pa dang dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang /🔽mu @88a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan du gnas pa dang mtha' 'khob pa dang / 'phags pa'i skad kyis gcig la gcig brda mi 'jal ba dang / dge sbyong dang / khyim pa dang / de bzhin du pha bsad pa dang ma bsad pa dang dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang / mu @88a * //
translated: It is a wrong action to call others by names that refer to their inferior social class, to their being from another country, to their being from a border region, to their not being able to communicate with each other in the language of the noble ones, to their being renunciates, to their being householders, to their being murderers of their father, to their being murderers of their mother, to their being murderers of an arhat,🔽to their being schismatics, and so on.

original: stegs can la sogs pa la skyon nas bos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stegs can la sogs pa la skyon nas bos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a wrong action to call tīrthikas and so on by their faults.🔽The basis of the origin of slander is as follows: The Bhagavan was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: phra ma'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so / de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde po rnams phra ma smra ba la zhugs nas /
analyzed: phra ma'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so / de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde po rnams phra ma smra ba la zhugs nas /
translated: At that time the group of six monks engaged in slander.

original: de ltar phra ma smra bas na dge slong dag kyang 'khums shing bag tsha bar gyur nas lung 'bogs pa dang kha ton byed pa la sems bag tsha bas dge ba dag btang bas mdza' zhing sdug pa chos bzhin du 'khod par yang ma gyur nas don nyung
analyzed: de ltar phra ma smra bas na dge slong dag kyang 'khums shing bag tsha bar gyur nas lung 'bogs pa dang kha ton byed pa la sems bag tsha bas dge ba dag btang bas mdza' zhing sdug pa chos bzhin du 'khod par yang ma gyur nas don nyung
translated: Since they engaged in slander, the monks became withdrawn and anxious. Since they were anxious about giving oral transmissions and reciting texts, they abandoned virtue. Since they were not harmonious and loving in accordance with the Dharma, their purpose was diminished.

original: ngu ba'i dge slong dag 'phya bar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: ngu ba'i dge slong dag 'phya bar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The monks who were crying were ridiculed.

original: dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin zhes smad nas /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin zhes smad nas /
translated: They were reproached, saying, “This is not the work of a śramaṇa.”

original: 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: And the training rule was set forth.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde po'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde po'o //
translated: “A monk” means the group of six.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense” is as above.

original: dge slong gis phra ma bya bar bsams nas thag pa dang / shing mkhan dang 'dreg mkhan la sogs pa las rab tu byung nas dge sbyong dang tshangs pa ga la yod ces zer ro zhes smras na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis phra ma bya bar bsams nas thag pa dang / shing mkhan dang 'dreg mkhan la sogs pa las rab tu byung nas dge sbyong dang tshangs pa ga la yod ces zer ro zhes smras na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk, intending to cause division, says to a rope maker, a woodworker, a barber, or someone else, “How can you be a śramaṇa or a brāhmaṇa?” he commits an offense.

original: gzhan ni skyon gyi skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni skyon gyi skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: phrin dang lag brda yang gong ma bzhin du sbyar ro /
analyzed: phrin dang lag brda yang gong ma bzhin du sbyar ro /
translated: The same applies to messages and gestures.🔽The origin of the training rule on complaining

original: skyo sdogs kyi gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: skyo sdogs kyi gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was staying at Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde po rnams dge slong mkhas pa dge 'dun 'dus pas ches bzhin du rtsod pa zhi bar byas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde po rnams dge slong mkhas pa dge 'dun 'dus pas ches bzhin du rtsod pa zhi bar byas te /
translated: At that time the group of six monks saw that a dispute was being settled by the assembly of monks, who were skilled.

original: spangs par shes bzhin du slar yang de las su mi rung ste ma byas legs par ma sbyangs pas slar sbyang dgos so zhes yang nas yang du skyo sdogs byas te /
analyzed: spangs par shes bzhin du slar yang de las su mi rung ste ma byas legs par ma sbyangs pas slar sbyang dgos so zhes yang nas yang du skyo sdogs byas te /
translated: Knowing that he had been expelled, he again did not do what was required of him. He did not train well, so he needed to train again. He was repeatedly discouraged, saying, “I will do it again and again.”

original: bya ba mang byed pa mang du gyur pas dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: bya ba mang byed pa mang du gyur pas dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
translated: Because he did many things and had many activities, the monks criticized him.

original: dge slong mkhas pa tshogs pas chos bzhin du las byas shing rtsod pa spangs pa slar skyor du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong mkhas pa tshogs pas chos bzhin du las byas shing rtsod pa spangs pa slar skyor du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The monks gathered and did the legal procedure in accordance with the Teaching. They dismissed the dispute and did not allow it to be reopened. They also added a training rule to the monastic code.

original: dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
analyzed: dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
translated: “A monk” means the group of six.

original: gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: It also means anyone who has entered this Teaching.

original: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis rig pa'am /
analyzed: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis rig pa'am /
translated: “Knowing” means knowing it oneself

original: gzhan gyis bsgo bar gyur pa'o //🔽'du shes zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun tshogs shing mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsgo bar gyur pa'o // 'du shes zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun tshogs shing mthun pa'o //
translated: or being told by someone else.🔽“Perception” means the perception of the Saṅgha gathering and being in harmony.

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la bya'o //
translated: “Saṅgha” means the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata’s disciples.

original: chos ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: chos ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba ste /
translated: “In accordance with the Dharma” means not in contradiction with the Vinaya.

original: ston pas bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ston pas bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: It is just as the Teacher taught.

original: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: “Dispute” means any of the four types of disputes:

original: 'thabs nas rtsod pa dang ma 'thabs ma bcos bar rtsod pa dang / ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa dang / bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: 'thabs nas rtsod pa dang ma 'thabs ma bcos bar rtsod pa dang / ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa dang / bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa'o //
translated: disputes that arise from fighting, disputes that arise from not resolving disputes, disputes that arise from downfalls, and disputes that arise from actions.

original: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi po gang yang rung ste zhi bar @88b byas so //
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi po gang yang rung ste zhi bar @88b byas so //
translated: “Resolved” means that any of the four types of disputes has been resolved.

original: yang bya bar skyo sngogs byed ces bya ba ni phyi phyir byed du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: yang bya bar skyo sngogs byed ces bya ba ni phyi phyir byed du gzhug pa'o //
translated: “To reopen” means to reopen again and again.

original: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal bar ltung ba la sogs te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal bar ltung ba la sogs te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Downfall” means falling into the hells, and so on, as before.

original: nyes pa ji lta bu zhen dge slong gis 'thab pa'i rtsod par 'du shes shing spangs pa la spangs pa'i 'du shes kyis yang bya bar skyo sngogs byed na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ji lta bu zhen dge slong gis 'thab pa'i rtsod par 'du shes shing spangs pa la spangs pa'i 'du shes kyis yang bya bar skyo sngogs byed na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the offense? If a monk perceives that a dispute has arisen from fighting, and he perceives that it has been resolved, and he reopens it, he commits an offense.

original: the tshom za na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom za na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you have doubts, you have a downfall.

original: ma spangs pa la yang spangs pa'i 'du shes kyis skyo sngogs byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma spangs pa la yang spangs pa'i 'du shes kyis skyo sngogs byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not give up a bad action, but pretend to be disgusted with it, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: the tshom za na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom za na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If you have doubts, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ji ltar 'thab pa la rnam pa bzhir sbyar ba bzhin du mi gdams pa dang / ltung ba dang bya ba'i rtsod pa la yang de bzhin du sbyor cig //
analyzed: ji ltar 'thab pa la rnam pa bzhir sbyar ba bzhin du mi gdams pa dang / ltung ba dang bya ba'i rtsod pa la yang de bzhin du sbyor cig //
translated: As in the case of the four kinds of disputes, you should apply this also to the disputes about advice, downfalls, and business.

original: bud med la /
analyzed: bud med la /
translated: To women

original: chos tshig lnga drug las lhag par 'chad du mi gnang zhing rig pa'i skyes pa med par tshig lnga drug las lhag par bshad pa'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: chos tshig lnga drug las lhag par 'chad du mi gnang zhing rig pa'i skyes pa med par tshig lnga drug las lhag par bshad pa'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: . It is not permitted to teach more than five or six words of the Dharma to a woman who is not related to you. The origin story of this rule took place in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'char ba rig pa'i nor bu zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'char ba rig pa'i nor bu zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: At that time, there was a monk named Udayābha, who was a jewel of knowledge.

original: de'i mthus mtshan gyi rig pa shes te /
analyzed: de'i mthus mtshan gyi rig pa shes te /
translated: By the power of his knowledge, he knew the signs of a woman.

original: snga dro bram ze dang khyim bdag dag gi rigs kyi der bsod snyoms la 'jug cing chos bstan pa'i 'og tu khyim bdag gi mna' ma la khyod kyi sgyug mo ci 'dra zhes dris so //
analyzed: snga dro bram ze dang khyim bdag dag gi rigs kyi der bsod snyoms la 'jug cing chos bstan pa'i 'og tu khyim bdag gi mna' ma la khyod kyi sgyug mo ci 'dra zhes dris so //
translated: In the morning he went to beg for alms in the houses of the Brahmans and householders, and after he had preached the Law, he asked the daughter-in-law of the householder, “What is your mother-in-law like?”
